imgui_demo.cpp
[詳解]
1// dear imgui, v1.92.1
2// (demo code)
3
4// Help:
5// - Read FAQ at http://dearimgui.com/faq
6// - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in imgui_demo.cpp. All applications in examples/ are doing that.
7// - Need help integrating Dear ImGui in your codebase?
8// - Read Getting Started https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Getting-Started
9// - Read 'Programmer guide' in imgui.cpp for notes on how to setup Dear ImGui in your codebase.
10// Read top of imgui.cpp and imgui.h for many details, documentation, comments, links.
11// Get the latest version at https://github.com/ocornut/imgui
12
13// How to easily locate code?
14// - Use Tools->Item Picker to debug break in code by clicking any widgets: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Debug-Tools
15// - Browse an online version the demo with code linked to hovered widgets: https://pthom.github.io/imgui_manual_online/manual/imgui_manual.html
16// - Find a visible string and search for it in the code!
17
18//---------------------------------------------------
19// PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS FILE FROM YOUR PROJECT!
20//---------------------------------------------------
21// Message to the person tempted to delete this file when integrating Dear ImGui into their codebase:
22// Think again! It is the most useful reference code that you and other coders will want to refer to and call.
23// Have the ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() function wired in an always-available debug menu of your game/app!
24// Also include Metrics! ItemPicker! DebugLog! and other debug features.
25// Removing this file from your project is hindering access to documentation for everyone in your team,
26// likely leading you to poorer usage of the library.
27// Everything in this file will be stripped out by the linker if you don't call ImGui::ShowDemoWindow().
28// If you want to link core Dear ImGui in your shipped builds but want a thorough guarantee that the demo will not be
29// linked, you can setup your imconfig.h with #define IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS and those functions will be empty.
30// In another situation, whenever you have Dear ImGui available you probably want this to be available for reference.
31// Thank you,
32// -Your beloved friend, imgui_demo.cpp (which you won't delete)
33
34//--------------------------------------------
35// ABOUT THE MEANING OF THE 'static' KEYWORD:
36//--------------------------------------------
37// In this demo code, we frequently use 'static' variables inside functions.
38// A static variable persists across calls. It is essentially a global variable but declared inside the scope of the function.
39// Think of "static int n = 0;" as "global int n = 0;" !
40// We do this IN THE DEMO because we want:
41// - to gather code and data in the same place.
42// - to make the demo source code faster to read, faster to change, smaller in size.
43// - it is also a convenient way of storing simple UI related information as long as your function
44// doesn't need to be reentrant or used in multiple threads.
45// This might be a pattern you will want to use in your code, but most of the data you would be working
46// with in a complex codebase is likely going to be stored outside your functions.
47
48//-----------------------------------------
49// ABOUT THE CODING STYLE OF OUR DEMO CODE
50//-----------------------------------------
51// The Demo code in this file is designed to be easy to copy-and-paste into your application!
52// Because of this:
53// - We never omit the ImGui:: prefix when calling functions, even though most code here is in the same namespace.
54// - We try to declare static variables in the local scope, as close as possible to the code using them.
55// - We never use any of the helpers/facilities used internally by Dear ImGui, unless available in the public API.
56// - We never use maths operators on ImVec2/ImVec4. For our other sources files we use them, and they are provided
57// by imgui.h using the IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS define. For your own sources file they are optional
58// and require you either enable those, either provide your own via IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h.
59// Because we can't assume anything about your support of maths operators, we cannot use them in imgui_demo.cpp.
60
61// Navigating this file:
62// - In Visual Studio: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols inside comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
63// - In Visual Studio w/ Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols inside comments.
64// - In VS Code, CLion, etc.: CTRL+click can follow symbols inside comments.
65// - You can search/grep for all sections listed in the index to find the section.
66
67/*
68
69Index of this file:
70
71// [SECTION] Forward Declarations
72// [SECTION] Helpers
73// [SECTION] Demo Window / ShowDemoWindow()
74// [SECTION] DemoWindowMenuBar()
75// [SECTION] Helpers: ExampleTreeNode, ExampleMemberInfo (for use by Property Editor & Multi-Select demos)
76// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsBasic()
77// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsBullets()
78// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsCollapsingHeaders()
79// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsComboBoxes()
80// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsColorAndPickers()
81// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsDataTypes()
82// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsDisableBlocks()
83// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsDragAndDrop()
84// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsDragsAndSliders()
85// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsFonts()
86// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsImages()
87// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsListBoxes()
88// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsMultiComponents()
89// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsPlotting()
90// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsProgressBars()
91// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsQueryingStatuses()
92// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsSelectables()
93// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsSelectionAndMultiSelect()
94// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsTabs()
95// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsText()
96// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsTextFilter()
97// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsTextInput()
98// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsTooltips()
99// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsTreeNodes()
100// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsVerticalSliders()
101// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgets()
102// [SECTION] DemoWindowLayout()
103// [SECTION] DemoWindowPopups()
104// [SECTION] DemoWindowTables()
105// [SECTION] DemoWindowInputs()
106// [SECTION] About Window / ShowAboutWindow()
107// [SECTION] Style Editor / ShowStyleEditor()
108// [SECTION] User Guide / ShowUserGuide()
109// [SECTION] Example App: Main Menu Bar / ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
110// [SECTION] Example App: Debug Console / ShowExampleAppConsole()
111// [SECTION] Example App: Debug Log / ShowExampleAppLog()
112// [SECTION] Example App: Simple Layout / ShowExampleAppLayout()
113// [SECTION] Example App: Property Editor / ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor()
114// [SECTION] Example App: Long Text / ShowExampleAppLongText()
115// [SECTION] Example App: Auto Resize / ShowExampleAppAutoResize()
116// [SECTION] Example App: Constrained Resize / ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize()
117// [SECTION] Example App: Simple overlay / ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay()
118// [SECTION] Example App: Fullscreen window / ShowExampleAppFullscreen()
119// [SECTION] Example App: Manipulating window titles / ShowExampleAppWindowTitles()
120// [SECTION] Example App: Custom Rendering using ImDrawList API / ShowExampleAppCustomRendering()
121// [SECTION] Example App: Docking, DockSpace / ShowExampleAppDockSpace()
122// [SECTION] Example App: Documents Handling / ShowExampleAppDocuments()
123// [SECTION] Example App: Assets Browser / ShowExampleAppAssetsBrowser()
124
125*/
126
127#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(_CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS)
128#define _CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS
129#endif
130
131#include "imgui.h"
132#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
133
134// System includes
135#include <ctype.h> // toupper
136#include <limits.h> // INT_MIN, INT_MAX
137#include <math.h> // sqrtf, powf, cosf, sinf, floorf, ceilf
138#include <stdio.h> // vsnprintf, sscanf, printf
139#include <stdlib.h> // NULL, malloc, free, atoi
140#include <stdint.h> // intptr_t
141#if !defined(_MSC_VER) || _MSC_VER >= 1800
142#include <inttypes.h> // PRId64/PRIu64, not avail in some MinGW headers.
143#endif
144#ifdef __EMSCRIPTEN__
145#include <emscripten/version.h> // __EMSCRIPTEN_major__ etc.
146#endif
147
148// Visual Studio warnings
149#ifdef _MSC_VER
150#pragma warning (disable: 4127) // condition expression is constant
151#pragma warning (disable: 4996) // 'This function or variable may be unsafe': strcpy, strdup, sprintf, vsnprintf, sscanf, fopen
152#pragma warning (disable: 26451) // [Static Analyzer] Arithmetic overflow : Using operator 'xxx' on a 4 byte value and then casting the result to an 8 byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'xxx' to avoid overflow(io.2).
153#endif
154
155// Clang/GCC warnings with -Weverything
156#if defined(__clang__)
157#if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option")
158#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx' // not all warnings are known by all Clang versions and they tend to be rename-happy.. so ignoring warnings triggers new warnings on some configuration. Great!
159#endif
160#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
161#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast" // warning: use of old-style cast // yes, they are more terse.
162#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations" // warning: 'xx' is deprecated: The POSIX name for this.. // for strdup used in demo code (so user can copy & paste the code)
163#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wint-to-void-pointer-cast" // warning: cast to 'void *' from smaller integer type
164#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wformat" // warning: format specifies type 'int' but the argument has type 'unsigned int'
165#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wformat-security" // warning: format string is not a string literal
166#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wexit-time-destructors" // warning: declaration requires an exit-time destructor // exit-time destruction order is undefined. if MemFree() leads to users code that has been disabled before exit it might cause problems. ImGui coding style welcomes static/globals.
167#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-macros" // warning: macro is not used // we define snprintf/vsnprintf on Windows so they are available, but not always used.
168#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant" // warning: zero as null pointer constant // some standard header variations use #define NULL 0
169#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdouble-promotion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'float' to 'double' when passing argument to function // using printf() is a misery with this as C++ va_arg ellipsis changes float to double.
170#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wreserved-id-macro" // warning: macro name is a reserved identifier
171#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wimplicit-int-float-conversion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'xxx' to 'float' may lose precision
172#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunsafe-buffer-usage" // warning: 'xxx' is an unsafe pointer used for buffer access
173#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wswitch-default" // warning: 'switch' missing 'default' label
174#elif defined(__GNUC__)
175#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas" // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind
176#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating-point with '==' or '!=' is unsafe
177#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wint-to-pointer-cast" // warning: cast to pointer from integer of different size
178#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wformat" // warning: format '%p' expects argument of type 'int'/'void*', but argument X has type 'unsigned int'/'ImGuiWindow*'
179#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wformat-security" // warning: format string is not a string literal (potentially insecure)
180#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdouble-promotion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'float' to 'double' when passing argument to function
181#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion" // warning: conversion to 'xxxx' from 'xxxx' may alter its value
182#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmisleading-indentation" // [__GNUC__ >= 6] warning: this 'if' clause does not guard this statement // GCC 6.0+ only. See #883 on GitHub.
183#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wstrict-overflow" // warning: assuming signed overflow does not occur when simplifying division / ..when changing X +- C1 cmp C2 to X cmp C2 -+ C1
184#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wcast-qual" // warning: cast from type 'const xxxx *' to type 'xxxx *' casts away qualifiers
185#endif
186
187// Play it nice with Windows users (Update: May 2018, Notepad now supports Unix-style carriage returns!)
188#ifdef _WIN32
189#define IM_NEWLINE "\r\n"
190#else
191#define IM_NEWLINE "\n"
192#endif
193
194// Helpers
195#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(snprintf)
196#define snprintf _snprintf
197#endif
198#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(vsnprintf)
199#define vsnprintf _vsnprintf
200#endif
201
202// Format specifiers for 64-bit values (hasn't been decently standardized before VS2013)
203#if !defined(PRId64) && defined(_MSC_VER)
204#define PRId64 "I64d"
205#define PRIu64 "I64u"
206#elif !defined(PRId64)
207#define PRId64 "lld"
208#define PRIu64 "llu"
209#endif
210
211// Helpers macros
212// We normally try to not use many helpers in imgui_demo.cpp in order to make code easier to copy and paste,
213// but making an exception here as those are largely simplifying code...
214// In other imgui sources we can use nicer internal functions from imgui_internal.h (ImMin/ImMax) but not in the demo.
215#define IM_MIN(A, B) (((A) < (B)) ? (A) : (B))
216#define IM_MAX(A, B) (((A) >= (B)) ? (A) : (B))
217#define IM_CLAMP(V, MN, MX) ((V) < (MN) ? (MN) : (V) > (MX) ? (MX) : (V))
218
219// Enforce cdecl calling convention for functions called by the standard library,
220// in case compilation settings changed the default to e.g. __vectorcall
221#ifndef IMGUI_CDECL
222#ifdef _MSC_VER
223#define IMGUI_CDECL __cdecl
224#else
225#define IMGUI_CDECL
226#endif
227#endif
228
229//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
230// [SECTION] Forward Declarations
231//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
232
233#if !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS)
234
235// Forward Declarations
236struct ImGuiDemoWindowData;
237static void ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar();
238static void ShowExampleAppAssetsBrowser(bool* p_open);
239static void ShowExampleAppConsole(bool* p_open);
240static void ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(bool* p_open);
241static void ShowExampleAppDockSpace(bool* p_open);
242static void ShowExampleAppDocuments(bool* p_open);
243static void ShowExampleAppLog(bool* p_open);
244static void ShowExampleAppLayout(bool* p_open);
245static void ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(bool* p_open, ImGuiDemoWindowData* demo_data);
246static void ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(bool* p_open);
247static void ShowExampleAppAutoResize(bool* p_open);
248static void ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(bool* p_open);
249static void ShowExampleAppFullscreen(bool* p_open);
250static void ShowExampleAppLongText(bool* p_open);
251static void ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(bool* p_open);
252static void ShowExampleMenuFile();
253
254// We split the contents of the big ShowDemoWindow() function into smaller functions
255// (because the link time of very large functions tends to grow non-linearly)
256static void DemoWindowMenuBar(ImGuiDemoWindowData* demo_data);
257static void DemoWindowWidgets(ImGuiDemoWindowData* demo_data);
258static void DemoWindowLayout();
259static void DemoWindowPopups();
260static void DemoWindowTables();
261static void DemoWindowColumns();
262static void DemoWindowInputs();
263
264// Helper tree functions used by Property Editor & Multi-Select demos
265struct ExampleTreeNode;
266static ExampleTreeNode* ExampleTree_CreateNode(const char* name, int uid, ExampleTreeNode* parent);
267static void ExampleTree_DestroyNode(ExampleTreeNode* node);
268
269//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
270// [SECTION] Helpers
271//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
272
273// Helper to display a little (?) mark which shows a tooltip when hovered.
274// In your own code you may want to display an actual icon if you are using a merged icon fonts (see docs/FONTS.md)
275static void HelpMarker(const char* desc)
276{
277 ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
278 if (ImGui::BeginItemTooltip())
279 {
280 ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);
281 ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);
282 ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
283 ImGui::EndTooltip();
284 }
285}
286
287static void ShowDockingDisabledMessage()
288{
289 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
290 ImGui::Text("ERROR: Docking is not enabled! See Demo > Configuration.");
291 ImGui::Text("Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable in your code, or ");
292 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f);
293 if (ImGui::SmallButton("click here"))
294 io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable;
295}
296
297// Helper to wire demo markers located in code to an interactive browser
298typedef void (*ImGuiDemoMarkerCallback)(const char* file, int line, const char* section, void* user_data);
299extern ImGuiDemoMarkerCallback GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback;
300extern void* GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData;
301ImGuiDemoMarkerCallback GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback = NULL;
302void* GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData = NULL;
303#define IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER(section) do { if (GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback != NULL) GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback(__FILE__, __LINE__, section, GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData); } while (0)
304
305//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
306// [SECTION] Demo Window / ShowDemoWindow()
307//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
308
309// Data to be shared across different functions of the demo.
310struct ImGuiDemoWindowData
311{
312 // Examples Apps (accessible from the "Examples" menu)
313 bool ShowMainMenuBar = false;
314 bool ShowAppAssetsBrowser = false;
315 bool ShowAppConsole = false;
316 bool ShowAppCustomRendering = false;
317 bool ShowAppDocuments = false;
318 bool ShowAppDockSpace = false;
319 bool ShowAppLog = false;
320 bool ShowAppLayout = false;
321 bool ShowAppPropertyEditor = false;
322 bool ShowAppSimpleOverlay = false;
323 bool ShowAppAutoResize = false;
324 bool ShowAppConstrainedResize = false;
325 bool ShowAppFullscreen = false;
326 bool ShowAppLongText = false;
327 bool ShowAppWindowTitles = false;
328
329 // Dear ImGui Tools (accessible from the "Tools" menu)
330 bool ShowMetrics = false;
331 bool ShowDebugLog = false;
332 bool ShowIDStackTool = false;
333 bool ShowStyleEditor = false;
334 bool ShowAbout = false;
335
336 // Other data
337 bool DisableSections = false;
338 ExampleTreeNode* DemoTree = NULL;
339
340 ~ImGuiDemoWindowData() { if (DemoTree) ExampleTree_DestroyNode(DemoTree); }
341};
342
343// Demonstrate most Dear ImGui features (this is big function!)
344// You may execute this function to experiment with the UI and understand what it does.
345// You may then search for keywords in the code when you are interested by a specific feature.
346void ImGui::ShowDemoWindow(bool* p_open)
347{
348 // Exceptionally add an extra assert here for people confused about initial Dear ImGui setup
349 // Most functions would normally just assert/crash if the context is missing.
350 IM_ASSERT(ImGui::GetCurrentContext() != NULL && "Missing Dear ImGui context. Refer to examples app!");
351
352 // Verify ABI compatibility between caller code and compiled version of Dear ImGui. This helps detects some build issues.
353 IMGUI_CHECKVERSION();
354
355 // Stored data
356 static ImGuiDemoWindowData demo_data;
357
358 // Examples Apps (accessible from the "Examples" menu)
359 if (demo_data.ShowMainMenuBar) { ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar(); }
360 if (demo_data.ShowAppDockSpace) { ShowExampleAppDockSpace(&demo_data.ShowAppDockSpace); } // Important: Process the Docking app first, as explicit DockSpace() nodes needs to be submitted early (read comments near the DockSpace function)
361 if (demo_data.ShowAppDocuments) { ShowExampleAppDocuments(&demo_data.ShowAppDocuments); } // ...process the Document app next, as it may also use a DockSpace()
362 if (demo_data.ShowAppAssetsBrowser) { ShowExampleAppAssetsBrowser(&demo_data.ShowAppAssetsBrowser); }
363 if (demo_data.ShowAppConsole) { ShowExampleAppConsole(&demo_data.ShowAppConsole); }
364 if (demo_data.ShowAppCustomRendering) { ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(&demo_data.ShowAppCustomRendering); }
365 if (demo_data.ShowAppLog) { ShowExampleAppLog(&demo_data.ShowAppLog); }
366 if (demo_data.ShowAppLayout) { ShowExampleAppLayout(&demo_data.ShowAppLayout); }
367 if (demo_data.ShowAppPropertyEditor) { ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(&demo_data.ShowAppPropertyEditor, &demo_data); }
368 if (demo_data.ShowAppSimpleOverlay) { ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(&demo_data.ShowAppSimpleOverlay); }
369 if (demo_data.ShowAppAutoResize) { ShowExampleAppAutoResize(&demo_data.ShowAppAutoResize); }
370 if (demo_data.ShowAppConstrainedResize) { ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(&demo_data.ShowAppConstrainedResize); }
371 if (demo_data.ShowAppFullscreen) { ShowExampleAppFullscreen(&demo_data.ShowAppFullscreen); }
372 if (demo_data.ShowAppLongText) { ShowExampleAppLongText(&demo_data.ShowAppLongText); }
373 if (demo_data.ShowAppWindowTitles) { ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(&demo_data.ShowAppWindowTitles); }
374
375 // Dear ImGui Tools (accessible from the "Tools" menu)
376 if (demo_data.ShowMetrics) { ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(&demo_data.ShowMetrics); }
377 if (demo_data.ShowDebugLog) { ImGui::ShowDebugLogWindow(&demo_data.ShowDebugLog); }
378 if (demo_data.ShowIDStackTool) { ImGui::ShowIDStackToolWindow(&demo_data.ShowIDStackTool); }
379 if (demo_data.ShowAbout) { ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(&demo_data.ShowAbout); }
380 if (demo_data.ShowStyleEditor)
381 {
382 ImGui::Begin("Dear ImGui Style Editor", &demo_data.ShowStyleEditor);
383 ImGui::ShowStyleEditor();
384 ImGui::End();
385 }
386
387 // Demonstrate the various window flags. Typically you would just use the default!
388 static bool no_titlebar = false;
389 static bool no_scrollbar = false;
390 static bool no_menu = false;
391 static bool no_move = false;
392 static bool no_resize = false;
393 static bool no_collapse = false;
394 static bool no_close = false;
395 static bool no_nav = false;
396 static bool no_background = false;
397 static bool no_bring_to_front = false;
398 static bool no_docking = false;
399 static bool unsaved_document = false;
400
401 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0;
402 if (no_titlebar) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;
403 if (no_scrollbar) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar;
404 if (!no_menu) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;
405 if (no_move) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
406 if (no_resize) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;
407 if (no_collapse) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse;
408 if (no_nav) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav;
409 if (no_background) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground;
410 if (no_bring_to_front) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus;
411 if (no_docking) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
412 if (unsaved_document) window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument;
413 if (no_close) p_open = NULL; // Don't pass our bool* to Begin
414
415 // We specify a default position/size in case there's no data in the .ini file.
416 // We only do it to make the demo applications a little more welcoming, but typically this isn't required.
417 const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
418 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(main_viewport->WorkPos.x + 650, main_viewport->WorkPos.y + 20), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
419 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(550, 680), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
420
421 // Main body of the Demo window starts here.
422 if (!ImGui::Begin("Dear ImGui Demo", p_open, window_flags))
423 {
424 // Early out if the window is collapsed, as an optimization.
425 ImGui::End();
426 return;
427 }
428
429 // Most framed widgets share a common width settings. Remaining width is used for the label.
430 // The width of the frame may be changed with PushItemWidth() or SetNextItemWidth().
431 // - Positive value for absolute size, negative value for right-alignment.
432 // - The default value is about GetWindowWidth() * 0.65f.
433 // - See 'Demo->Layout->Widgets Width' for details.
434 // Here we change the frame width based on how much width we want to give to the label.
435 const float label_width_base = ImGui::GetFontSize() * 12; // Some amount of width for label, based on font size.
436 const float label_width_max = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.40f; // ...but always leave some room for framed widgets.
437 const float label_width = IM_MIN(label_width_base, label_width_max);
438 ImGui::PushItemWidth(-label_width); // Right-align: framed items will leave 'label_width' available for the label.
439 //ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.40f); // e.g. Use 40% width for framed widgets, leaving 60% width for labels.
440 //ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.40f); // e.g. Use 40% width for labels, leaving 60% width for framed widgets.
441 //ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * -12); // e.g. Use XXX width for labels, leaving the rest for framed widgets.
442
443 // Menu Bar
444 DemoWindowMenuBar(&demo_data);
445
446 ImGui::Text("dear imgui says hello! (%s) (%d)", IMGUI_VERSION, IMGUI_VERSION_NUM);
447 ImGui::Spacing();
448
449 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Help");
450 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Help"))
451 {
452 ImGui::SeparatorText("ABOUT THIS DEMO:");
453 ImGui::BulletText("Sections below are demonstrating many aspects of the library.");
454 ImGui::BulletText("The \"Examples\" menu above leads to more demo contents.");
455 ImGui::BulletText("The \"Tools\" menu above gives access to: About Box, Style Editor,\n"
456 "and Metrics/Debugger (general purpose Dear ImGui debugging tool).");
457
458 ImGui::SeparatorText("PROGRAMMER GUIDE:");
459 ImGui::BulletText("See the ShowDemoWindow() code in imgui_demo.cpp. <- you are here!");
460 ImGui::BulletText("See comments in imgui.cpp.");
461 ImGui::BulletText("See example applications in the examples/ folder.");
462 ImGui::BulletText("Read the FAQ at ");
463 ImGui::SameLine(0, 0);
464 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("https://www.dearimgui.com/faq/");
465 ImGui::BulletText("Set 'io.ConfigFlags |= NavEnableKeyboard' for keyboard controls.");
466 ImGui::BulletText("Set 'io.ConfigFlags |= NavEnableGamepad' for gamepad controls.");
467
468 ImGui::SeparatorText("USER GUIDE:");
469 ImGui::ShowUserGuide();
470 }
471
472 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration");
473 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Configuration"))
474 {
475 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
476
477 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Configuration##2"))
478 {
479 ImGui::SeparatorText("General");
480 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NavEnableKeyboard", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard);
481 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable keyboard controls.");
482 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NavEnableGamepad", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad);
483 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable gamepad controls. Require backend to set io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.\n\nRead instructions in imgui.cpp for details.");
484 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NoMouse", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse);
485 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct dear imgui to disable mouse inputs and interactions.");
486
487 // The "NoMouse" option can get us stuck with a disabled mouse! Let's provide an alternative way to fix it:
488 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)
489 {
490 if (fmodf((float)ImGui::GetTime(), 0.40f) < 0.20f)
491 {
492 ImGui::SameLine();
493 ImGui::Text("<<PRESS SPACE TO DISABLE>>");
494 }
495 // Prevent both being checked
496 if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space) || (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoKeyboard))
497 io.ConfigFlags &= ~ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse;
498 }
499
500 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NoMouseCursorChange", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange);
501 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility.");
502 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: NoKeyboard", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_NoKeyboard);
503 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct dear imgui to disable keyboard inputs and interactions.");
504
505 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue", &io.ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue);
506 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving interactions with low framerates.");
507 ImGui::Checkbox("io.MouseDrawCursor", &io.MouseDrawCursor);
508 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Instruct Dear ImGui to render a mouse cursor itself. Note that a mouse cursor rendered via your application GPU rendering path will feel more laggy than hardware cursor, but will be more in sync with your other visuals.\n\nSome desktop applications may use both kinds of cursors (e.g. enable software cursor only when resizing/dragging something).");
509
510 ImGui::SeparatorText("Keyboard/Gamepad Navigation");
511 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavSwapGamepadButtons", &io.ConfigNavSwapGamepadButtons);
512 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos", &io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos);
513 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Directional/tabbing navigation teleports the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is difficult");
514 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard", &io.ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard);
515 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusItem", &io.ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusItem);
516 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Pressing Escape clears focused item.");
517 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusWindow", &io.ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusWindow);
518 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Pressing Escape clears focused window.");
519 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavCursorVisibleAuto", &io.ConfigNavCursorVisibleAuto);
520 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Using directional navigation key makes the cursor visible. Mouse click hides the cursor.");
521 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigNavCursorVisibleAlways", &io.ConfigNavCursorVisibleAlways);
522 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Navigation cursor is always visible.");
523
524 ImGui::SeparatorText("Docking");
525 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: DockingEnable", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable);
526 ImGui::SameLine();
527 if (io.ConfigDockingWithShift)
528 HelpMarker("Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to enable docking.\n\nDrag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).");
529 else
530 HelpMarker("Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to disable docking.\n\nDrag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).");
531 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable)
532 {
533 ImGui::Indent();
534 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingNoSplit", &io.ConfigDockingNoSplit);
535 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.");
536 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingWithShift", &io.ConfigDockingWithShift);
537 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable docking when holding Shift only (allow to drop in wider space, reduce visual noise)");
538 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar", &io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar);
539 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Create a docking node and tab-bar on single floating windows.");
540 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload", &io.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload);
541 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.");
542 ImGui::Unindent();
543 }
544
545 ImGui::SeparatorText("Multi-viewports");
546 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.ConfigFlags: ViewportsEnable", &io.ConfigFlags, ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable);
547 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("[beta] Enable beta multi-viewports support. See ImGuiPlatformIO for details.");
548 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
549 {
550 ImGui::Indent();
551 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge", &io.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge);
552 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when overlapping it.");
553 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon", &io.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon);
554 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Toggling this at runtime is normally unsupported (most platform backends won't refresh the task bar icon state right away).");
555 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration", &io.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration);
556 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Toggling this at runtime is normally unsupported (most platform backends won't refresh the decoration right away).");
557 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent", &io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent);
558 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Toggling this at runtime is normally unsupported (most platform backends won't refresh the parenting right away).");
559 ImGui::Unindent();
560 }
561
562 //ImGui::SeparatorText("DPI/Scaling");
563 //ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDpiScaleFonts", &io.ConfigDpiScaleFonts);
564 //ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Experimental: Automatically update style.FontScaleDpi when Monitor DPI changes. This will scale fonts but NOT style sizes/padding for now.");
565 //ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDpiScaleViewports", &io.ConfigDpiScaleViewports);
566 //ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Experimental: Scale Dear ImGui and Platform Windows when Monitor DPI changes.");
567
568 ImGui::SeparatorText("Windows");
569 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges", &io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges);
570 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner.\nThis requires ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors for better mouse cursor feedback.");
571 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly", &io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly);
572 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigWindowsCopyContentsWithCtrlC", &io.ConfigWindowsCopyContentsWithCtrlC); // [EXPERIMENTAL]
573 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("*EXPERIMENTAL* CTRL+C copy the contents of focused window into the clipboard.\n\nExperimental because:\n- (1) has known issues with nested Begin/End pairs.\n- (2) text output quality varies.\n- (3) text output is in submission order rather than spatial order.");
574 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigScrollbarScrollByPage", &io.ConfigScrollbarScrollByPage);
575 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable scrolling page by page when clicking outside the scrollbar grab.\nWhen disabled, always scroll to clicked location.\nWhen enabled, Shift+Click scrolls to clicked location.");
576
577 ImGui::SeparatorText("Widgets");
578 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink", &io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink);
579 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it to be distracting).");
580 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive", &io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive);
581 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Pressing Enter will keep item active and select contents (single-line only).");
582 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDragClickToInputText", &io.ConfigDragClickToInputText);
583 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable turning DragXXX widgets into text input with a simple mouse click-release (without moving).");
584 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors", &io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors);
585 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Swap Cmd<>Ctrl keys, enable various MacOS style behaviors.");
586 ImGui::Text("Also see Style->Rendering for rendering options.");
587
588 // Also read: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Error-Handling
589 ImGui::SeparatorText("Error Handling");
590
591 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigErrorRecovery", &io.ConfigErrorRecovery);
592 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
593 "Options to configure how we handle recoverable errors.\n"
594 "- Error recovery is not perfect nor guaranteed! It is a feature to ease development.\n"
595 "- You not are not supposed to rely on it in the course of a normal application run.\n"
596 "- Possible usage: facilitate recovery from errors triggered from a scripting language or after specific exceptions handlers.\n"
597 "- Always ensure that on programmers seat you have at minimum Asserts or Tooltips enabled when making direct imgui API call! "
598 "Otherwise it would severely hinder your ability to catch and correct mistakes!");
599 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert", &io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert);
600 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableDebugLog", &io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableDebugLog);
601 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableTooltip", &io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableTooltip);
602 if (!io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert && !io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableDebugLog && !io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableTooltip)
603 io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert = io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableDebugLog = io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableTooltip = true;
604
605 // Also read: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Debug-Tools
606 ImGui::SeparatorText("Debug");
607 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent", &io.ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent);
608 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable various tools calling IM_DEBUG_BREAK().\n\nRequires a debugger being attached, otherwise IM_DEBUG_BREAK() options will appear to crash your application.");
609 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflicts", &io.ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflicts);
610 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Highlight and show an error message when multiple items have conflicting identifiers.");
611 ImGui::BeginDisabled();
612 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueOnce", &io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueOnce);
613 ImGui::EndDisabled();
614 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("First calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.\n\nTHIS OPTION IS DISABLED because it needs to be set at application boot-time to make sense. Showing the disabled option is a way to make this feature easier to discover.");
615 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueLoop", &io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueLoop);
616 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Some calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.\n\nWill cycle through window depths then repeat. Windows should be flickering while running.");
617 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDebugIgnoreFocusLoss", &io.ConfigDebugIgnoreFocusLoss);
618 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Option to deactivate io.AddFocusEvent(false) handling. May facilitate interactions with a debugger when focus loss leads to clearing inputs data.");
619 ImGui::Checkbox("io.ConfigDebugIniSettings", &io.ConfigDebugIniSettings);
620 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Option to save .ini data with extra comments (particularly helpful for Docking, but makes saving slower).");
621
622 ImGui::TreePop();
623 ImGui::Spacing();
624 }
625
626 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration/Backend Flags");
627 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Backend Flags"))
628 {
629 HelpMarker(
630 "Those flags are set by the backends (imgui_impl_xxx files) to specify their capabilities.\n"
631 "Here we expose them as read-only fields to avoid breaking interactions with your backend.");
632
633 // Make a local copy to avoid modifying actual backend flags.
634 // FIXME: Maybe we need a BeginReadonly() equivalent to keep label bright?
635 ImGui::BeginDisabled();
636 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasGamepad", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad);
637 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseCursors", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors);
638 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasSetMousePos", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos);
639 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: PlatformHasViewports", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports);
640 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseHoveredViewport",&io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport);
641 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: RendererHasVtxOffset", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset);
642 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: RendererHasTextures", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasTextures);
643 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: RendererHasViewports", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports);
644 ImGui::EndDisabled();
645
646 ImGui::TreePop();
647 ImGui::Spacing();
648 }
649
650 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration/Style, Fonts");
651 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Style, Fonts"))
652 {
653 ImGui::Checkbox("Style Editor", &demo_data.ShowStyleEditor);
654 ImGui::SameLine();
655 HelpMarker("The same contents can be accessed in 'Tools->Style Editor' or by calling the ShowStyleEditor() function.");
656 ImGui::TreePop();
657 ImGui::Spacing();
658 }
659
660 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Configuration/Capture, Logging");
661 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Capture/Logging"))
662 {
663 HelpMarker(
664 "The logging API redirects all text output so you can easily capture the content of "
665 "a window or a block. Tree nodes can be automatically expanded.\n"
666 "Try opening any of the contents below in this window and then click one of the \"Log To\" button.");
667 ImGui::LogButtons();
668
669 HelpMarker("You can also call ImGui::LogText() to output directly to the log without a visual output.");
670 if (ImGui::Button("Copy \"Hello, world!\" to clipboard"))
671 {
672 ImGui::LogToClipboard();
673 ImGui::LogText("Hello, world!");
674 ImGui::LogFinish();
675 }
676 ImGui::TreePop();
677 }
678 }
679
680 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Window options");
681 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Window options"))
682 {
683 if (ImGui::BeginTable("split", 3))
684 {
685 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No titlebar", &no_titlebar);
686 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No scrollbar", &no_scrollbar);
687 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No menu", &no_menu);
688 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No move", &no_move);
689 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No resize", &no_resize);
690 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No collapse", &no_collapse);
691 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No close", &no_close);
692 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No nav", &no_nav);
693 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No background", &no_background);
694 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No bring to front", &no_bring_to_front);
695 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("No docking", &no_docking);
696 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Checkbox("Unsaved document", &unsaved_document);
697 ImGui::EndTable();
698 }
699 }
700
701 // All demo contents
702 DemoWindowWidgets(&demo_data);
703 DemoWindowLayout();
704 DemoWindowPopups();
705 DemoWindowTables();
706 DemoWindowInputs();
707
708 // End of ShowDemoWindow()
709 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
710 ImGui::End();
711}
712
713//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
714// [SECTION] DemoWindowMenuBar()
715//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
716
717static void DemoWindowMenuBar(ImGuiDemoWindowData* demo_data)
718{
719 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu");
720 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
721 {
722 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu"))
723 {
724 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu/File");
725 ShowExampleMenuFile();
726 ImGui::EndMenu();
727 }
728 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Examples"))
729 {
730 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu/Examples");
731 ImGui::MenuItem("Main menu bar", NULL, &demo_data->ShowMainMenuBar);
732
733 ImGui::SeparatorText("Mini apps");
734 ImGui::MenuItem("Assets Browser", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppAssetsBrowser);
735 ImGui::MenuItem("Console", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppConsole);
736 ImGui::MenuItem("Custom rendering", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppCustomRendering);
737 ImGui::MenuItem("Documents", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppDocuments);
738 ImGui::MenuItem("Dockspace", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppDockSpace);
739 ImGui::MenuItem("Log", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppLog);
740 ImGui::MenuItem("Property editor", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppPropertyEditor);
741 ImGui::MenuItem("Simple layout", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppLayout);
742 ImGui::MenuItem("Simple overlay", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppSimpleOverlay);
743
744 ImGui::SeparatorText("Concepts");
745 ImGui::MenuItem("Auto-resizing window", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppAutoResize);
746 ImGui::MenuItem("Constrained-resizing window", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppConstrainedResize);
747 ImGui::MenuItem("Fullscreen window", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppFullscreen);
748 ImGui::MenuItem("Long text display", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppLongText);
749 ImGui::MenuItem("Manipulating window titles", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAppWindowTitles);
750
751 ImGui::EndMenu();
752 }
753 //if (ImGui::MenuItem("MenuItem")) {} // You can also use MenuItem() inside a menu bar!
754 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Tools"))
755 {
756 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Menu/Tools");
757 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
758#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
759 const bool has_debug_tools = true;
760#else
761 const bool has_debug_tools = false;
762#endif
763 ImGui::MenuItem("Metrics/Debugger", NULL, &demo_data->ShowMetrics, has_debug_tools);
764 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Debug Options"))
765 {
766 ImGui::BeginDisabled(!has_debug_tools);
767 ImGui::Checkbox("Highlight ID Conflicts", &io.ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflicts);
768 ImGui::EndDisabled();
769 ImGui::Checkbox("Assert on error recovery", &io.ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert);
770 ImGui::TextDisabled("(see Demo->Configuration for details & more)");
771 ImGui::EndMenu();
772 }
773 ImGui::MenuItem("Debug Log", NULL, &demo_data->ShowDebugLog, has_debug_tools);
774 ImGui::MenuItem("ID Stack Tool", NULL, &demo_data->ShowIDStackTool, has_debug_tools);
775 bool is_debugger_present = io.ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent;
776 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Item Picker", NULL, false, has_debug_tools))// && is_debugger_present))
777 ImGui::DebugStartItemPicker();
778 if (!is_debugger_present)
779 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("Requires io.ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent=true to be set.\n\nWe otherwise disable some extra features to avoid casual users crashing the application.");
780 ImGui::MenuItem("Style Editor", NULL, &demo_data->ShowStyleEditor);
781 ImGui::MenuItem("About Dear ImGui", NULL, &demo_data->ShowAbout);
782
783 ImGui::EndMenu();
784 }
785 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
786 }
787}
788
789//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
790// [SECTION] Helpers: ExampleTreeNode, ExampleMemberInfo (for use by Property Editor & Multi-Select demos)
791//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
792
793// Simple representation for a tree
794// (this is designed to be simple to understand for our demos, not to be fancy or efficient etc.)
795struct ExampleTreeNode
796{
797 // Tree structure
798 char Name[28] = "";
799 int UID = 0;
800 ExampleTreeNode* Parent = NULL;
801 ImVector<ExampleTreeNode*> Childs;
802 unsigned short IndexInParent = 0; // Maintaining this allows us to implement linear traversal more easily
803
804 // Leaf Data
805 bool HasData = false; // All leaves have data
806 bool DataMyBool = true;
807 int DataMyInt = 128;
808 ImVec2 DataMyVec2 = ImVec2(0.0f, 3.141592f);
809};
810
811// Simple representation of struct metadata/serialization data.
812// (this is a minimal version of what a typical advanced application may provide)
813struct ExampleMemberInfo
814{
815 const char* Name; // Member name
816 ImGuiDataType DataType; // Member type
817 int DataCount; // Member count (1 when scalar)
818 int Offset; // Offset inside parent structure
819};
820
821// Metadata description of ExampleTreeNode struct.
822static const ExampleMemberInfo ExampleTreeNodeMemberInfos[]
823{
824 { "MyName", ImGuiDataType_String, 1, offsetof(ExampleTreeNode, Name) },
825 { "MyBool", ImGuiDataType_Bool, 1, offsetof(ExampleTreeNode, DataMyBool) },
826 { "MyInt", ImGuiDataType_S32, 1, offsetof(ExampleTreeNode, DataMyInt) },
827 { "MyVec2", ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, offsetof(ExampleTreeNode, DataMyVec2) },
828};
829
830static ExampleTreeNode* ExampleTree_CreateNode(const char* name, int uid, ExampleTreeNode* parent)
831{
832 ExampleTreeNode* node = IM_NEW(ExampleTreeNode);
833 snprintf(node->Name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(node->Name), "%s", name);
834 node->UID = uid;
835 node->Parent = parent;
836 node->IndexInParent = parent ? (unsigned short)parent->Childs.Size : 0;
837 if (parent)
838 parent->Childs.push_back(node);
839 return node;
840}
841
842static void ExampleTree_DestroyNode(ExampleTreeNode* node)
843{
844 for (ExampleTreeNode* child_node : node->Childs)
845 ExampleTree_DestroyNode(child_node);
846 IM_DELETE(node);
847}
848
849// Create example tree data
850// (this allocates _many_ more times than most other code in either Dear ImGui or others demo)
851static ExampleTreeNode* ExampleTree_CreateDemoTree()
852{
853 static const char* root_names[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi", "Mango", "Orange", "Pear", "Pineapple", "Strawberry", "Watermelon" };
854 const size_t NAME_MAX_LEN = sizeof(ExampleTreeNode::Name);
855 char name_buf[NAME_MAX_LEN];
856 int uid = 0;
857 ExampleTreeNode* node_L0 = ExampleTree_CreateNode("<ROOT>", ++uid, NULL);
858 const int root_items_multiplier = 2;
859 for (int idx_L0 = 0; idx_L0 < IM_ARRAYSIZE(root_names) * root_items_multiplier; idx_L0++)
860 {
861 snprintf(name_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name_buf), "%s %d", root_names[idx_L0 / root_items_multiplier], idx_L0 % root_items_multiplier);
862 ExampleTreeNode* node_L1 = ExampleTree_CreateNode(name_buf, ++uid, node_L0);
863 const int number_of_childs = (int)strlen(node_L1->Name);
864 for (int idx_L1 = 0; idx_L1 < number_of_childs; idx_L1++)
865 {
866 snprintf(name_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name_buf), "Child %d", idx_L1);
867 ExampleTreeNode* node_L2 = ExampleTree_CreateNode(name_buf, ++uid, node_L1);
868 node_L2->HasData = true;
869 if (idx_L1 == 0)
870 {
871 snprintf(name_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name_buf), "Sub-child %d", 0);
872 ExampleTreeNode* node_L3 = ExampleTree_CreateNode(name_buf, ++uid, node_L2);
873 node_L3->HasData = true;
874 }
875 }
876 }
877 return node_L0;
878}
879
880//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
881// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsBasic()
882//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
883
884static void DemoWindowWidgetsBasic()
885{
886 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic");
887 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
888 {
889 ImGui::SeparatorText("General");
890
891 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Button");
892 static int clicked = 0;
893 if (ImGui::Button("Button"))
894 clicked++;
895 if (clicked & 1)
896 {
897 ImGui::SameLine();
898 ImGui::Text("Thanks for clicking me!");
899 }
900
901 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Checkbox");
902 static bool check = true;
903 ImGui::Checkbox("checkbox", &check);
904
905 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/RadioButton");
906 static int e = 0;
907 ImGui::RadioButton("radio a", &e, 0); ImGui::SameLine();
908 ImGui::RadioButton("radio b", &e, 1); ImGui::SameLine();
909 ImGui::RadioButton("radio c", &e, 2);
910
911 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
912 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("Hyperlink", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Error-Handling");
913
914 // Color buttons, demonstrate using PushID() to add unique identifier in the ID stack, and changing style.
915 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Buttons (Colored)");
916 for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
917 {
918 if (i > 0)
919 ImGui::SameLine();
920 ImGui::PushID(i);
921 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.6f, 0.6f));
922 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.7f, 0.7f));
923 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.8f, 0.8f));
924 ImGui::Button("Click");
925 ImGui::PopStyleColor(3);
926 ImGui::PopID();
927 }
928
929 // Use AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text baseline to the baseline of framed widgets elements
930 // (otherwise a Text+SameLine+Button sequence will have the text a little too high by default!)
931 // See 'Demo->Layout->Text Baseline Alignment' for details.
932 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
933 ImGui::Text("Hold to repeat:");
934 ImGui::SameLine();
935
936 // Arrow buttons with Repeater
937 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Buttons (Repeating)");
938 static int counter = 0;
939 float spacing = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x;
940 ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, true);
941 if (ImGui::ArrowButton("##left", ImGuiDir_Left)) { counter--; }
942 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
943 if (ImGui::ArrowButton("##right", ImGuiDir_Right)) { counter++; }
944 ImGui::PopItemFlag();
945 ImGui::SameLine();
946 ImGui::Text("%d", counter);
947
948 ImGui::Button("Tooltip");
949 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("I am a tooltip");
950
951 ImGui::LabelText("label", "Value");
952
953 ImGui::SeparatorText("Inputs");
954
955 {
956 // To wire InputText() with std::string or any other custom string type,
957 // see the "Text Input > Resize Callback" section of this demo, and the misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h file.
958 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/InputText");
959 static char str0[128] = "Hello, world!";
960 ImGui::InputText("input text", str0, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str0));
961 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
962 "USER:\n"
963 "Hold SHIFT or use mouse to select text.\n"
964 "CTRL+Left/Right to word jump.\n"
965 "CTRL+A or Double-Click to select all.\n"
966 "CTRL+X,CTRL+C,CTRL+V for clipboard.\n"
967 "CTRL+Z to undo, CTRL+Y/CTRL+SHIFT+Z to redo.\n"
968 "ESCAPE to revert.\n\n"
969 "PROGRAMMER:\n"
970 "You can use the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize facility if you need to wire InputText() "
971 "to a dynamic string type. See misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example (this is not demonstrated "
972 "in imgui_demo.cpp).");
973
974 static char str1[128] = "";
975 ImGui::InputTextWithHint("input text (w/ hint)", "enter text here", str1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str1));
976
977 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/InputInt, InputFloat");
978 static int i0 = 123;
979 ImGui::InputInt("input int", &i0);
980
981 static float f0 = 0.001f;
982 ImGui::InputFloat("input float", &f0, 0.01f, 1.0f, "%.3f");
983
984 static double d0 = 999999.00000001;
985 ImGui::InputDouble("input double", &d0, 0.01f, 1.0f, "%.8f");
986
987 static float f1 = 1.e10f;
988 ImGui::InputFloat("input scientific", &f1, 0.0f, 0.0f, "%e");
989 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
990 "You can input value using the scientific notation,\n"
991 " e.g. \"1e+8\" becomes \"100000000\".");
992
993 static float vec4a[4] = { 0.10f, 0.20f, 0.30f, 0.44f };
994 ImGui::InputFloat3("input float3", vec4a);
995 }
996
997 ImGui::SeparatorText("Drags");
998
999 {
1000 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/DragInt, DragFloat");
1001 static int i1 = 50, i2 = 42, i3 = 128;
1002 ImGui::DragInt("drag int", &i1, 1);
1003 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1004 "Click and drag to edit value.\n"
1005 "Hold SHIFT/ALT for faster/slower edit.\n"
1006 "Double-click or CTRL+click to input value.");
1007 ImGui::DragInt("drag int 0..100", &i2, 1, 0, 100, "%d%%", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
1008 ImGui::DragInt("drag int wrap 100..200", &i3, 1, 100, 200, "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags_WrapAround);
1009
1010 static float f1 = 1.00f, f2 = 0.0067f;
1011 ImGui::DragFloat("drag float", &f1, 0.005f);
1012 ImGui::DragFloat("drag small float", &f2, 0.0001f, 0.0f, 0.0f, "%.06f ns");
1013 //ImGui::DragFloat("drag wrap -1..1", &f3, 0.005f, -1.0f, 1.0f, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_WrapAround);
1014 }
1015
1016 ImGui::SeparatorText("Sliders");
1017
1018 {
1019 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/SliderInt, SliderFloat");
1020 static int i1 = 0;
1021 ImGui::SliderInt("slider int", &i1, -1, 3);
1022 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("CTRL+click to input value.");
1023
1024 static float f1 = 0.123f, f2 = 0.0f;
1025 ImGui::SliderFloat("slider float", &f1, 0.0f, 1.0f, "ratio = %.3f");
1026 ImGui::SliderFloat("slider float (log)", &f2, -10.0f, 10.0f, "%.4f", ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic);
1027
1028 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/SliderAngle");
1029 static float angle = 0.0f;
1030 ImGui::SliderAngle("slider angle", &angle);
1031
1032 // Using the format string to display a name instead of an integer.
1033 // Here we completely omit '%d' from the format string, so it'll only display a name.
1034 // This technique can also be used with DragInt().
1035 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Slider (enum)");
1036 enum Element { Element_Fire, Element_Earth, Element_Air, Element_Water, Element_COUNT };
1037 static int elem = Element_Fire;
1038 const char* elems_names[Element_COUNT] = { "Fire", "Earth", "Air", "Water" };
1039 const char* elem_name = (elem >= 0 && elem < Element_COUNT) ? elems_names[elem] : "Unknown";
1040 ImGui::SliderInt("slider enum", &elem, 0, Element_COUNT - 1, elem_name); // Use ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput flag to disable CTRL+Click here.
1041 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Using the format string parameter to display a name instead of the underlying integer.");
1042 }
1043
1044 ImGui::SeparatorText("Selectors/Pickers");
1045
1046 {
1047 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/ColorEdit3, ColorEdit4");
1048 static float col1[3] = { 1.0f, 0.0f, 0.2f };
1049 static float col2[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
1050 ImGui::ColorEdit3("color 1", col1);
1051 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1052 "Click on the color square to open a color picker.\n"
1053 "Click and hold to use drag and drop.\n"
1054 "Right-click on the color square to show options.\n"
1055 "CTRL+click on individual component to input value.\n");
1056
1057 ImGui::ColorEdit4("color 2", col2);
1058 }
1059
1060 {
1061 // Using the _simplified_ one-liner Combo() api here
1062 // See "Combo" section for examples of how to use the more flexible BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api.
1063 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/Combo");
1064 const char* items[] = { "AAAA", "BBBB", "CCCC", "DDDD", "EEEE", "FFFF", "GGGG", "HHHH", "IIIIIII", "JJJJ", "KKKKKKK" };
1065 static int item_current = 0;
1066 ImGui::Combo("combo", &item_current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
1067 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1068 "Using the simplified one-liner Combo API here.\n"
1069 "Refer to the \"Combo\" section below for an explanation of how to use the more flexible and general BeginCombo/EndCombo API.");
1070 }
1071
1072 {
1073 // Using the _simplified_ one-liner ListBox() api here
1074 // See "List boxes" section for examples of how to use the more flexible BeginListBox()/EndListBox() api.
1075 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Basic/ListBox");
1076 const char* items[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi", "Mango", "Orange", "Pineapple", "Strawberry", "Watermelon" };
1077 static int item_current = 1;
1078 ImGui::ListBox("listbox", &item_current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items), 4);
1079 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1080 "Using the simplified one-liner ListBox API here.\n"
1081 "Refer to the \"List boxes\" section below for an explanation of how to use the more flexible and general BeginListBox/EndListBox API.");
1082 }
1083
1084 // Testing ImGuiOnceUponAFrame helper.
1085 //static ImGuiOnceUponAFrame once;
1086 //for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
1087 // if (once)
1088 // ImGui::Text("This will be displayed only once.");
1089
1090 ImGui::TreePop();
1091 }
1092}
1093
1094//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1095// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsBullets()
1096//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1097
1098static void DemoWindowWidgetsBullets()
1099{
1100 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Bullets");
1101 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Bullets"))
1102 {
1103 ImGui::BulletText("Bullet point 1");
1104 ImGui::BulletText("Bullet point 2\nOn multiple lines");
1105 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree node"))
1106 {
1107 ImGui::BulletText("Another bullet point");
1108 ImGui::TreePop();
1109 }
1110 ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::Text("Bullet point 3 (two calls)");
1111 ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::SmallButton("Button");
1112 ImGui::TreePop();
1113 }
1114}
1115
1116//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1117// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsCollapsingHeaders()
1118//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1119
1120static void DemoWindowWidgetsCollapsingHeaders()
1121{
1122 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Collapsing Headers");
1123 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Collapsing Headers"))
1124 {
1125 static bool closable_group = true;
1126 ImGui::Checkbox("Show 2nd header", &closable_group);
1127 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Header", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None))
1128 {
1129 ImGui::Text("IsItemHovered: %d", ImGui::IsItemHovered());
1130 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
1131 ImGui::Text("Some content %d", i);
1132 }
1133 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Header with a close button", &closable_group))
1134 {
1135 ImGui::Text("IsItemHovered: %d", ImGui::IsItemHovered());
1136 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
1137 ImGui::Text("More content %d", i);
1138 }
1139 /*
1140 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Header with a bullet", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet))
1141 ImGui::Text("IsItemHovered: %d", ImGui::IsItemHovered());
1142 */
1143 ImGui::TreePop();
1144 }
1145}
1146
1147//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1148// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsColorAndPickers()
1149//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1150
1151static void DemoWindowWidgetsColorAndPickers()
1152{
1153 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color");
1154 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Color/Picker Widgets"))
1155 {
1156 static ImVec4 color = ImVec4(114.0f / 255.0f, 144.0f / 255.0f, 154.0f / 255.0f, 200.0f / 255.0f);
1157 static ImGuiColorEditFlags base_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_None;
1158
1159 ImGui::SeparatorText("Options");
1160 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
1161 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque);
1162 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg);
1163 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf);
1164 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop);
1165 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Right-click on the individual color widget to show options.");
1166 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR", &base_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Currently all this does is to lift the 0..1 limits on dragging widgets.");
1167
1168 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorEdit");
1169 ImGui::SeparatorText("Inline color editor");
1170 ImGui::Text("Color widget:");
1171 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1172 "Click on the color square to open a color picker.\n"
1173 "CTRL+click on individual component to input value.\n");
1174 ImGui::ColorEdit3("MyColor##1", (float*)&color, base_flags);
1175
1176 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorEdit (HSV, with Alpha)");
1177 ImGui::Text("Color widget HSV with Alpha:");
1178 ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##2", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | base_flags);
1179
1180 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorEdit (float display)");
1181 ImGui::Text("Color widget with Float Display:");
1182 ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##2f", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float | base_flags);
1183
1184 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorButton (with Picker)");
1185 ImGui::Text("Color button with Picker:");
1186 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1187 "With the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs flag you can hide all the slider/text inputs.\n"
1188 "With the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel flag you can pass a non-empty label which will only "
1189 "be used for the tooltip and picker popup.");
1190 ImGui::ColorEdit4("MyColor##3", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | base_flags);
1191
1192 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorButton (with custom Picker popup)");
1193 ImGui::Text("Color button with Custom Picker Popup:");
1194
1195 // Generate a default palette. The palette will persist and can be edited.
1196 static bool saved_palette_init = true;
1197 static ImVec4 saved_palette[32] = {};
1198 if (saved_palette_init)
1199 {
1200 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(saved_palette); n++)
1201 {
1202 ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(n / 31.0f, 0.8f, 0.8f,
1203 saved_palette[n].x, saved_palette[n].y, saved_palette[n].z);
1204 saved_palette[n].w = 1.0f; // Alpha
1205 }
1206 saved_palette_init = false;
1207 }
1208
1209 static ImVec4 backup_color;
1210 bool open_popup = ImGui::ColorButton("MyColor##3b", color, base_flags);
1211 ImGui::SameLine(0, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
1212 open_popup |= ImGui::Button("Palette");
1213 if (open_popup)
1214 {
1215 ImGui::OpenPopup("mypicker");
1216 backup_color = color;
1217 }
1218 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("mypicker"))
1219 {
1220 ImGui::Text("MY CUSTOM COLOR PICKER WITH AN AMAZING PALETTE!");
1221 ImGui::Separator();
1222 ImGui::ColorPicker4("##picker", (float*)&color, base_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview);
1223 ImGui::SameLine();
1224
1225 ImGui::BeginGroup(); // Lock X position
1226 ImGui::Text("Current");
1227 ImGui::ColorButton("##current", color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf, ImVec2(60, 40));
1228 ImGui::Text("Previous");
1229 if (ImGui::ColorButton("##previous", backup_color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf, ImVec2(60, 40)))
1230 color = backup_color;
1231 ImGui::Separator();
1232 ImGui::Text("Palette");
1233 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(saved_palette); n++)
1234 {
1235 ImGui::PushID(n);
1236 if ((n % 8) != 0)
1237 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y);
1238
1239 ImGuiColorEditFlags palette_button_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip;
1240 if (ImGui::ColorButton("##palette", saved_palette[n], palette_button_flags, ImVec2(20, 20)))
1241 color = ImVec4(saved_palette[n].x, saved_palette[n].y, saved_palette[n].z, color.w); // Preserve alpha!
1242
1243 // Allow user to drop colors into each palette entry. Note that ColorButton() is already a
1244 // drag source by default, unless specifying the ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop flag.
1245 if (ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget())
1246 {
1247 if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F))
1248 memcpy((float*)&saved_palette[n], payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 3);
1249 if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F))
1250 memcpy((float*)&saved_palette[n], payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 4);
1251 ImGui::EndDragDropTarget();
1252 }
1253
1254 ImGui::PopID();
1255 }
1256 ImGui::EndGroup();
1257 ImGui::EndPopup();
1258 }
1259
1260 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorButton (simple)");
1261 ImGui::Text("Color button only:");
1262 static bool no_border = false;
1263 ImGui::Checkbox("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder", &no_border);
1264 ImGui::ColorButton("MyColor##3c", *(ImVec4*)&color, base_flags | (no_border ? ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder : 0), ImVec2(80, 80));
1265
1266 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Color/ColorPicker");
1267 ImGui::SeparatorText("Color picker");
1268
1269 static bool ref_color = false;
1270 static ImVec4 ref_color_v(1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 0.5f);
1271 static int picker_mode = 0;
1272 static int display_mode = 0;
1273 static ImGuiColorEditFlags color_picker_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar;
1274
1275 ImGui::PushID("Color picker");
1276 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha", &color_picker_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
1277 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar", &color_picker_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
1278 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview", &color_picker_flags, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview);
1279 if (color_picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview)
1280 {
1281 ImGui::SameLine();
1282 ImGui::Checkbox("With Ref Color", &ref_color);
1283 if (ref_color)
1284 {
1285 ImGui::SameLine();
1286 ImGui::ColorEdit4("##RefColor", &ref_color_v.x, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | base_flags);
1287 }
1288 }
1289
1290 ImGui::Combo("Picker Mode", &picker_mode, "Auto/Current\0ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar\0ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel\0");
1291 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When not specified explicitly, user can right-click the picker to change mode.");
1292
1293 ImGui::Combo("Display Mode", &display_mode, "Auto/Current\0ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs\0ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB\0ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV\0ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex\0");
1294 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1295 "ColorEdit defaults to displaying RGB inputs if you don't specify a display mode, "
1296 "but the user can change it with a right-click on those inputs.\n\nColorPicker defaults to displaying RGB+HSV+Hex "
1297 "if you don't specify a display mode.\n\nYou can change the defaults using SetColorEditOptions().");
1298
1299 ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = base_flags | color_picker_flags;
1300 if (picker_mode == 1) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar;
1301 if (picker_mode == 2) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel;
1302 if (display_mode == 1) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs; // Disable all RGB/HSV/Hex displays
1303 if (display_mode == 2) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB; // Override display mode
1304 if (display_mode == 3) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV;
1305 if (display_mode == 4) flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex;
1306 ImGui::ColorPicker4("MyColor##4", (float*)&color, flags, ref_color ? &ref_color_v.x : NULL);
1307
1308 ImGui::Text("Set defaults in code:");
1309 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1310 "SetColorEditOptions() is designed to allow you to set boot-time default.\n"
1311 "We don't have Push/Pop functions because you can force options on a per-widget basis if needed, "
1312 "and the user can change non-forced ones with the options menu.\nWe don't have a getter to avoid "
1313 "encouraging you to persistently save values that aren't forward-compatible.");
1314 if (ImGui::Button("Default: Uint8 + HSV + Hue Bar"))
1315 ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar);
1316 if (ImGui::Button("Default: Float + HDR + Hue Wheel"))
1317 ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel);
1318
1319 // Always display a small version of both types of pickers
1320 // (that's in order to make it more visible in the demo to people who are skimming quickly through it)
1321 ImGui::Text("Both types:");
1322 float w = (ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x - ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y) * 0.40f;
1323 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(w);
1324 ImGui::ColorPicker3("##MyColor##5", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
1325 ImGui::SameLine();
1326 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(w);
1327 ImGui::ColorPicker3("##MyColor##6", (float*)&color, ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
1328 ImGui::PopID();
1329
1330 // HSV encoded support (to avoid RGB<>HSV round trips and singularities when S==0 or V==0)
1331 static ImVec4 color_hsv(0.23f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f); // Stored as HSV!
1332 ImGui::Spacing();
1333 ImGui::Text("HSV encoded colors");
1334 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
1335 "By default, colors are given to ColorEdit and ColorPicker in RGB, but ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV "
1336 "allows you to store colors as HSV and pass them to ColorEdit and ColorPicker as HSV. This comes with the "
1337 "added benefit that you can manipulate hue values with the picker even when saturation or value are zero.");
1338 ImGui::Text("Color widget with InputHSV:");
1339 ImGui::ColorEdit4("HSV shown as RGB##1", (float*)&color_hsv, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float);
1340 ImGui::ColorEdit4("HSV shown as HSV##1", (float*)&color_hsv, ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float);
1341 ImGui::DragFloat4("Raw HSV values", (float*)&color_hsv, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1342
1343 ImGui::TreePop();
1344 }
1345}
1346
1347//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1348// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsComboBoxes()
1349//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1350
1351static void DemoWindowWidgetsComboBoxes()
1352{
1353 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Combo");
1354 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Combo"))
1355 {
1356 // Combo Boxes are also called "Dropdown" in other systems
1357 // Expose flags as checkbox for the demo
1358 static ImGuiComboFlags flags = 0;
1359 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft);
1360 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Only makes a difference if the popup is larger than the combo");
1361 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton))
1362 flags &= ~ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview; // Clear incompatible flags
1363 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview))
1364 flags &= ~(ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton | ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview); // Clear incompatible flags
1365 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview))
1366 flags &= ~ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview;
1367
1368 // Override default popup height
1369 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall))
1370 flags &= ~(ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_ & ~ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall);
1371 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular))
1372 flags &= ~(ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_ & ~ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular);
1373 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest", &flags, ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest))
1374 flags &= ~(ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_ & ~ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest);
1375
1376 // Using the generic BeginCombo() API, you have full control over how to display the combo contents.
1377 // (your selection data could be an index, a pointer to the object, an id for the object, a flag intrusively
1378 // stored in the object itself, etc.)
1379 const char* items[] = { "AAAA", "BBBB", "CCCC", "DDDD", "EEEE", "FFFF", "GGGG", "HHHH", "IIII", "JJJJ", "KKKK", "LLLLLLL", "MMMM", "OOOOOOO" };
1380 static int item_selected_idx = 0; // Here we store our selection data as an index.
1381
1382 // Pass in the preview value visible before opening the combo (it could technically be different contents or not pulled from items[])
1383 const char* combo_preview_value = items[item_selected_idx];
1384 if (ImGui::BeginCombo("combo 1", combo_preview_value, flags))
1385 {
1386 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(items); n++)
1387 {
1388 const bool is_selected = (item_selected_idx == n);
1389 if (ImGui::Selectable(items[n], is_selected))
1390 item_selected_idx = n;
1391
1392 // Set the initial focus when opening the combo (scrolling + keyboard navigation focus)
1393 if (is_selected)
1394 ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
1395 }
1396 ImGui::EndCombo();
1397 }
1398
1399 // Show case embedding a filter using a simple trick: displaying the filter inside combo contents.
1400 // See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/718 for advanced/esoteric alternatives.
1401 if (ImGui::BeginCombo("combo 2 (w/ filter)", combo_preview_value, flags))
1402 {
1403 static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
1404 if (ImGui::IsWindowAppearing())
1405 {
1406 ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
1407 filter.Clear();
1408 }
1409 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_F);
1410 filter.Draw("##Filter", -FLT_MIN);
1411
1412 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(items); n++)
1413 {
1414 const bool is_selected = (item_selected_idx == n);
1415 if (filter.PassFilter(items[n]))
1416 if (ImGui::Selectable(items[n], is_selected))
1417 item_selected_idx = n;
1418 }
1419 ImGui::EndCombo();
1420 }
1421
1422 ImGui::Spacing();
1423 ImGui::SeparatorText("One-liner variants");
1424 HelpMarker("The Combo() function is not greatly useful apart from cases were you want to embed all options in a single strings.\nFlags above don't apply to this section.");
1425
1426 // Simplified one-liner Combo() API, using values packed in a single constant string
1427 // This is a convenience for when the selection set is small and known at compile-time.
1428 static int item_current_2 = 0;
1429 ImGui::Combo("combo 3 (one-liner)", &item_current_2, "aaaa\0bbbb\0cccc\0dddd\0eeee\0\0");
1430
1431 // Simplified one-liner Combo() using an array of const char*
1432 // This is not very useful (may obsolete): prefer using BeginCombo()/EndCombo() for full control.
1433 static int item_current_3 = -1; // If the selection isn't within 0..count, Combo won't display a preview
1434 ImGui::Combo("combo 4 (array)", &item_current_3, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
1435
1436 // Simplified one-liner Combo() using an accessor function
1437 static int item_current_4 = 0;
1438 ImGui::Combo("combo 5 (function)", &item_current_4, [](void* data, int n) { return ((const char**)data)[n]; }, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
1439
1440 ImGui::TreePop();
1441 }
1442}
1443
1444//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1445// [SECTION] DemoWindowWidgetsDataTypes()
1446//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1447
1448static void DemoWindowWidgetsDataTypes()
1449{
1450 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Data Types");
1451 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Data Types"))
1452 {
1453 // DragScalar/InputScalar/SliderScalar functions allow various data types
1454 // - signed/unsigned
1455 // - 8/16/32/64-bits
1456 // - integer/float/double
1457 // To avoid polluting the public API with all possible combinations, we use the ImGuiDataType enum
1458 // to pass the type, and passing all arguments by pointer.
1459 // This is the reason the test code below creates local variables to hold "zero" "one" etc. for each type.
1460 // In practice, if you frequently use a given type that is not covered by the normal API entry points,
1461 // you can wrap it yourself inside a 1 line function which can take typed argument as value instead of void*,
1462 // and then pass their address to the generic function. For example:
1463 // bool MySliderU64(const char *label, u64* value, u64 min = 0, u64 max = 0, const char* format = "%lld")
1464 // {
1465 // return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_U64, value, &min, &max, format);
1466 // }
1467
1468 // Setup limits (as helper variables so we can take their address, as explained above)
1469 // Note: SliderScalar() functions have a maximum usable range of half the natural type maximum, hence the /2.
1470 #ifndef LLONG_MIN
1471 ImS64 LLONG_MIN = -9223372036854775807LL - 1;
1472 ImS64 LLONG_MAX = 9223372036854775807LL;
1473 ImU64 ULLONG_MAX = (2ULL * 9223372036854775807LL + 1);
1474 #endif
