4830 // Common mistake to avoid: if we want to SameLine after TreeNode we need to do it before we add
4831 // other contents below the node.
4832 bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Node##2");
4833 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##2");
4834 if (node_open)
4835 {
4836 // Placeholder tree data
4837 for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
4838 ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
4839 ImGui::TreePop();
4840 }
4841
4842 // Bullet
4843 ImGui::Button("Button##3");
4844 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
4845 ImGui::BulletText("Bullet text");
4846
4847 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
4848 ImGui::BulletText("Node");
4849 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##4");
4850 ImGui::Unindent();
4851 }
4852
4853 ImGui::TreePop();
4854 }
4855
4856 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling");
4857 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Scrolling"))
4858 {
4859 // Vertical scroll functions
4860 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Vertical");
4861 HelpMarker("Use SetScrollHereY() or SetScrollFromPosY() to scroll to a given vertical position.");
4862
4863 static int track_item = 50;
4864 static bool enable_track = true;
4865 static bool enable_extra_decorations = false;
4866 static float scroll_to_off_px = 0.0f;
4867 static float scroll_to_pos_px = 200.0f;
4868
4869 ImGui::Checkbox("Decoration", &enable_extra_decorations);
4870
4871 ImGui::Checkbox("Track", &enable_track);
4872 ImGui::PushItemWidth(100);
4873 ImGui::SameLine(140); enable_track |= ImGui::DragInt("##item", &track_item, 0.25f, 0, 99, "Item = %d");
4874
4875 bool scroll_to_off = ImGui::Button("Scroll Offset");
4876 ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_off |= ImGui::DragFloat("##off", &scroll_to_off_px, 1.00f, 0, FLT_MAX, "+%.0f px");
4877
4878 bool scroll_to_pos = ImGui::Button("Scroll To Pos");
4879 ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_pos |= ImGui::DragFloat("##pos", &scroll_to_pos_px, 1.00f, -10, FLT_MAX, "X/Y = %.0f px");
4880 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
4881
4882 if (scroll_to_off || scroll_to_pos)
4883 enable_track = false;
4884
4885 ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
4886 float child_w = (ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x - 4 * style.ItemSpacing.x) / 5;
4887 if (child_w < 1.0f)
4888 child_w = 1.0f;
4889 ImGui::PushID("##VerticalScrolling");
4890 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
4891 {
4892 if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
4893 ImGui::BeginGroup();
4894 const char* names[] = { "Top", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Bottom" };
4895 ImGui::TextUnformatted(names[i]);
4896
4897 const ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar : 0;
4898 const ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void*)(intptr_t)i);
4899 const bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(child_w, 200.0f), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, child_flags);
4900 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
4901 {
4902 ImGui::TextUnformatted("abc");
4903 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
4904 }
4905 if (scroll_to_off)
4906 ImGui::SetScrollY(scroll_to_off_px);
4907 if (scroll_to_pos)
4908 ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().y + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
4909 if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
4910 {
4911 for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
4912 {
4913 if (enable_track && item == track_item)
4914 {
4915 ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
4916 ImGui::SetScrollHereY(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:top, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:bottom
4917 }
4918 else
4919 {
4920 ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
4921 }
4922 }
4923 }
4924 float scroll_y = ImGui::GetScrollY();
4925 float scroll_max_y = ImGui::GetScrollMaxY();
4926 ImGui::EndChild();
4927 ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_y, scroll_max_y);
4928 ImGui::EndGroup();
4929 }
4930 ImGui::PopID();
4931
4932 // Horizontal scroll functions
4933 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Horizontal");
4934 ImGui::Spacing();
4935 HelpMarker(
4936 "Use SetScrollHereX() or SetScrollFromPosX() to scroll to a given horizontal position.\n\n"
4937 "Because the clipping rectangle of most window hides half worth of WindowPadding on the "
4938 "left/right, using SetScrollFromPosX(+1) will usually result in clipped text whereas the "
4939 "equivalent SetScrollFromPosY(+1) wouldn't.");
4940 ImGui::PushID("##HorizontalScrolling");
4941 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
4942 {
4943 float child_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() + style.ScrollbarSize + style.WindowPadding.y * 2.0f;
4944 ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar | (enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar : 0);
4945 ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void*)(intptr_t)i);
4946 bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(-100, child_height), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, child_flags);
4947 if (scroll_to_off)
4948 ImGui::SetScrollX(scroll_to_off_px);
4949 if (scroll_to_pos)
4950 ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().x + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
4951 if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
4952 {
4953 for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
4954 {
4955 if (item > 0)
4956 ImGui::SameLine();
4957 if (enable_track && item == track_item)
4958 {
4959 ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
4960 ImGui::SetScrollHereX(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:left, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:right
4961 }
4962 else
4963 {
4964 ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
4965 }
4966 }
4967 }
4968 float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
4969 float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
4970 ImGui::EndChild();
4971 ImGui::SameLine();
4972 const char* names[] = { "Left", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Right" };
4973 ImGui::Text("%s\n%.0f/%.0f", names[i], scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
4974 ImGui::Spacing();
4975 }
4976 ImGui::PopID();
4977
4978 // Miscellaneous Horizontal Scrolling Demo
4979 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Horizontal (more)");
4980 HelpMarker(
4981 "Horizontal scrolling for a window is enabled via the ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar flag.\n\n"
4982 "You may want to also explicitly specify content width by using SetNextWindowContentWidth() before Begin().");
4983 static int lines = 7;
4984 ImGui::SliderInt("Lines", &lines, 1, 15);
4985 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, 3.0f);
4986 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2.0f, 1.0f));
4987 ImVec2 scrolling_child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing() * 7 + 30);
4988 ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", scrolling_child_size, ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
4989 for (int line = 0; line < lines; line++)
4990 {
4991 // Display random stuff. For the sake of this trivial demo we are using basic Button() + SameLine()
4992 // If you want to create your own time line for a real application you may be better off manipulating
4993 // the cursor position yourself, aka using SetCursorPos/SetCursorScreenPos to position the widgets
4994 // yourself. You may also want to use the lower-level ImDrawList API.
4995 int num_buttons = 10 + ((line & 1) ? line * 9 : line * 3);
4996 for (int n = 0; n < num_buttons; n++)
4997 {
4998 if (n > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
4999 ImGui::PushID(n + line * 1000);
5000 char num_buf[16];
5001 sprintf(num_buf, "%d", n);
5002 const char* label = (!(n % 15)) ? "FizzBuzz" : (!(n % 3)) ? "Fizz" : (!(n % 5)) ? "Buzz" : num_buf;
5003 float hue = n * 0.05f;
5004 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.6f, 0.6f));
5005 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.7f, 0.7f));
5006 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.8f, 0.8f));
5007 ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(40.0f + sinf((float)(line + n)) * 20.0f, 0.0f));
5008 ImGui::PopStyleColor(3);
5009 ImGui::PopID();
5010 }
5011 }
5012 float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
5013 float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
5014 ImGui::EndChild();
5015 ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
5016 float scroll_x_delta = 0.0f;
5017 ImGui::SmallButton("<<");
5018 if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
5019 scroll_x_delta = -ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime * 1000.0f;
5020 ImGui::SameLine();
5021 ImGui::Text("Scroll from code"); ImGui::SameLine();
5022 ImGui::SmallButton(">>");
5023 if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
5024 scroll_x_delta = +ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime * 1000.0f;
5025 ImGui::SameLine();
5026 ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
5027 if (scroll_x_delta != 0.0f)
5028 {
5029 // Demonstrate a trick: you can use Begin to set yourself in the context of another window
5030 // (here we are already out of your child window)
5031 ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling");
5032 ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGui::GetScrollX() + scroll_x_delta);
5033 ImGui::EndChild();
5034 }
5035 ImGui::Spacing();
5036
5037 static bool show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window = false;
5038 ImGui::Checkbox("Show Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window);
5039
5040 if (show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window)
5041 {
5042 static bool show_h_scrollbar = true;
5043 static bool show_button = true;
5044 static bool show_tree_nodes = true;
5045 static bool show_text_wrapped = false;
5046 static bool show_columns = true;
5047 static bool show_tab_bar = true;
5048 static bool show_child = false;
5049 static bool explicit_content_size = false;
5050 static float contents_size_x = 300.0f;
5051 if (explicit_content_size)
5052 ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(contents_size_x, 0.0f));
5053 ImGui::Begin("Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window, show_h_scrollbar ? ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar : 0);
5054 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Horizontal contents size demo window");
5055 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(2, 0));
5056 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2, 0));
5057 HelpMarker(
5058 "Test how different widgets react and impact the work rectangle growing when horizontal scrolling is enabled.\n\n"
5059 "Use 'Metrics->Tools->Show windows rectangles' to visualize rectangles.");
5060 ImGui::Checkbox("H-scrollbar", &show_h_scrollbar);
5061 ImGui::Checkbox("Button", &show_button); // Will grow contents size (unless explicitly overwritten)
5062 ImGui::Checkbox("Tree nodes", &show_tree_nodes); // Will grow contents size and display highlight over full width
5063 ImGui::Checkbox("Text wrapped", &show_text_wrapped);// Will grow and use contents size
5064 ImGui::Checkbox("Columns", &show_columns); // Will use contents size
5065 ImGui::Checkbox("Tab bar", &show_tab_bar); // Will use contents size
5066 ImGui::Checkbox("Child", &show_child); // Will grow and use contents size
5067 ImGui::Checkbox("Explicit content size", &explicit_content_size);
5068 ImGui::Text("Scroll %.1f/%.1f %.1f/%.1f", ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollY(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());
5069 if (explicit_content_size)
5070 {
5071 ImGui::SameLine();
5072 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(100);
5073 ImGui::DragFloat("##csx", &contents_size_x);
5074 ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
5075 ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(p, ImVec2(p.x + 10, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
5076 ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x - 10, p.y), ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
5077 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(0, 10));
5078 }
5079 ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
5080 ImGui::Separator();
5081 if (show_button)
5082 {
5083 ImGui::Button("this is a 300-wide button", ImVec2(300, 0));
5084 }
5085 if (show_tree_nodes)
5086 {
5087 bool open = true;
5088 if (ImGui::TreeNode("this is a tree node"))
5089 {
5090 if (ImGui::TreeNode("another one of those tree node..."))
5091 {
5092 ImGui::Text("Some tree contents");
5093 ImGui::TreePop();
5094 }
5095 ImGui::TreePop();
5096 }
5097 ImGui::CollapsingHeader("CollapsingHeader", &open);
5098 }
5099 if (show_text_wrapped)
5100 {
5101 ImGui::TextWrapped("This text should automatically wrap on the edge of the work rectangle.");
5102 }
5103 if (show_columns)
5104 {
5105 ImGui::Text("Tables:");
5106 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table", 4, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
5107 {
5108 for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5109 {
5110 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5111 ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
5112 }
5113 ImGui::EndTable();
5114 }
5115 ImGui::Text("Columns:");
5116 ImGui::Columns(4);
5117 for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5118 {
5119 ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
5120 ImGui::NextColumn();
5121 }
5122 ImGui::Columns(1);
5123 }
5124 if (show_tab_bar && ImGui::BeginTabBar("Hello"))
5125 {
5126 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("OneOneOne")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5127 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("TwoTwoTwo")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5128 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("ThreeThreeThree")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5129 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("FourFourFour")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5130 ImGui::EndTabBar();
5131 }
5132 if (show_child)
5133 {
5134 ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders);
5135 ImGui::EndChild();
5136 }
5137 ImGui::End();
5138 }
5139
5140 ImGui::TreePop();
5141 }
5142
5143 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Text Clipping");
5144 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Text Clipping"))
5145 {
5146 static ImVec2 size(100.0f, 100.0f);
5147 static ImVec2 offset(30.0f, 30.0f);
5148 ImGui::DragFloat2("size", (float*)&size, 0.5f, 1.0f, 200.0f, "%.0f");
5149 ImGui::TextWrapped("(Click and drag to scroll)");
5150
5151 HelpMarker(
5152 "(Left) Using ImGui::PushClipRect():\n"
5153 "Will alter ImGui hit-testing logic + ImDrawList rendering.\n"
5154 "(use this if you want your clipping rectangle to affect interactions)\n\n"
5155 "(Center) Using ImDrawList::PushClipRect():\n"
5156 "Will alter ImDrawList rendering only.\n"
5157 "(use this as a shortcut if you are only using ImDrawList calls)\n\n"
5158 "(Right) Using ImDrawList::AddText() with a fine ClipRect:\n"
5159 "Will alter only this specific ImDrawList::AddText() rendering.\n"
5160 "This is often used internally to avoid altering the clipping rectangle and minimize draw calls.");
5161
5162 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
5163 {
5164 if (n > 0)
5165 ImGui::SameLine();
5166
5167 ImGui::PushID(n);
5168 ImGui::InvisibleButton("##canvas", size);
5169 if (ImGui::IsItemActive() && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
5170 {
5171 offset.x += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.x;
5172 offset.y += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.y;
5173 }
5174 ImGui::PopID();
5175 if (!ImGui::IsItemVisible()) // Skip rendering as ImDrawList elements are not clipped.
5176 continue;
5177
5178 const ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetItemRectMin();
5179 const ImVec2 p1 = ImGui::GetItemRectMax();
5180 const char* text_str = "Line 1 hello\nLine 2 clip me!";
5181 const ImVec2 text_pos = ImVec2(p0.x + offset.x, p0.y + offset.y);
5182 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
5183 switch (n)
5184 {
5185 case 0:
5186 ImGui::PushClipRect(p0, p1, true);
5187 draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
5188 draw_list->AddText(text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str);
5189 ImGui::PopClipRect();
5190 break;
5191 case 1:
5192 draw_list->PushClipRect(p0, p1, true);
5193 draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
5194 draw_list->AddText(text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str);
5195 draw_list->PopClipRect();
5196 break;
5197 case 2:
5198 ImVec4 clip_rect(p0.x, p0.y, p1.x, p1.y); // AddText() takes a ImVec4* here so let's convert.
5199 draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
5200 draw_list->AddText(ImGui::GetFont(), ImGui::GetFontSize(), text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str, NULL, 0.0f, &clip_rect);
5201 break;
5202 }
5203 }
5204
5205 ImGui::TreePop();
5206 }
5207
5208 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Overlap Mode");
5209 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Overlap Mode"))
5210 {
5211 static bool enable_allow_overlap = true;
5212
5213 HelpMarker(
5214 "Hit-testing is by default performed in item submission order, which generally is perceived as 'back-to-front'.\n\n"
5215 "By using SetNextItemAllowOverlap() you can notify that an item may be overlapped by another. "
5216 "Doing so alters the hovering logic: items using AllowOverlap mode requires an extra frame to accept hovered state.");
5217 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable AllowOverlap", &enable_allow_overlap);
5218
5219 ImVec2 button1_pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
5220 ImVec2 button2_pos = ImVec2(button1_pos.x + 50.0f, button1_pos.y + 50.0f);
5221 if (enable_allow_overlap)
5222 ImGui::SetNextItemAllowOverlap();
5223 ImGui::Button("Button 1", ImVec2(80, 80));
5224 ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(button2_pos);
5225 ImGui::Button("Button 2", ImVec2(80, 80));
5226
5227 // This is typically used with width-spanning items.
5228 // (note that Selectable() has a dedicated flag ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap, which is a shortcut
5229 // for using SetNextItemAllowOverlap(). For demo purpose we use SetNextItemAllowOverlap() here.)
5230 if (enable_allow_overlap)
5231 ImGui::SetNextItemAllowOverlap();
5232 ImGui::Selectable("Some Selectable", false);
5233 ImGui::SameLine();
5234 ImGui::SmallButton("++");
5235
5236 ImGui::TreePop();
5237 }
5238}
5239
5240//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5241// [SECTION] DemoWindowPopups()
5242//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5243
5244static void DemoWindowPopups()
5245{
5246 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups");
5247 if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Popups & Modal windows"))
5248 return;
5249
5250 // The properties of popups windows are:
5251 // - They block normal mouse hovering detection outside them. (*)
5252 // - Unless modal, they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
5253 // - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally by Dear ImGui instead of being held by the programmer as
5254 // we are used to with regular Begin() calls. User can manipulate the visibility state by calling OpenPopup().
5255 // (*) One can use IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) to bypass it and detect hovering even
5256 // when normally blocked by a popup.
5257 // Those three properties are connected. The library needs to hold their visibility state BECAUSE it can close
5258 // popups at any time.
5259
5260 // Typical use for regular windows:
5261 // bool my_tool_is_active = false; if (ImGui::Button("Open")) my_tool_is_active = true; [...] if (my_tool_is_active) Begin("My Tool", &my_tool_is_active) { [...] } End();
5262 // Typical use for popups:
5263 // if (ImGui::Button("Open")) ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup"); if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup") { [...] EndPopup(); }
5264
5265 // With popups we have to go through a library call (here OpenPopup) to manipulate the visibility state.
5266 // This may be a bit confusing at first but it should quickly make sense. Follow on the examples below.
5267
5268 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Popups");
5269 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Popups"))
5270 {
5271 ImGui::TextWrapped(
5272 "When a popup is active, it inhibits interacting with windows that are behind the popup. "
5273 "Clicking outside the popup closes it.");
5274
5275 static int selected_fish = -1;
5276 const char* names[] = { "Bream", "Haddock", "Mackerel", "Pollock", "Tilefish" };
5277 static bool toggles[] = { true, false, false, false, false };
5278
5279 // Simple selection popup (if you want to show the current selection inside the Button itself,
5280 // you may want to build a string using the "###" operator to preserve a constant ID with a variable label)
5281 if (ImGui::Button("Select.."))
5282 ImGui::OpenPopup("my_select_popup");
5283 ImGui::SameLine();
5284 ImGui::TextUnformatted(selected_fish == -1 ? "<None>" : names[selected_fish]);
5285 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_select_popup"))
5286 {
5287 ImGui::SeparatorText("Aquarium");
5288 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
5289 if (ImGui::Selectable(names[i]))
5290 selected_fish = i;
5291 ImGui::EndPopup();
5292 }
5293
5294 // Showing a menu with toggles
5295 if (ImGui::Button("Toggle.."))
5296 ImGui::OpenPopup("my_toggle_popup");
5297 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_toggle_popup"))
5298 {
5299 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
5300 ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
5301 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
5302 {
5303 ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
5304 ImGui::EndMenu();
5305 }
5306
5307 ImGui::Separator();
5308 ImGui::Text("Tooltip here");
5309 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("I am a tooltip over a popup");
5310
5311 if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
5312 ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
5313 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
5314 {
5315 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
5316 ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
5317 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
5318 {
5319 ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
5320 if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
5321 ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
5322 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
5323 {
5324 ImGui::Text("I am the last one here.");
5325 ImGui::EndPopup();
5326 }
5327 ImGui::EndMenu();
5328 }
5329 ImGui::EndPopup();
5330 }
5331 ImGui::EndPopup();
5332 }
5333
5334 // Call the more complete ShowExampleMenuFile which we use in various places of this demo
5335 if (ImGui::Button("With a menu.."))
5336 ImGui::OpenPopup("my_file_popup");
5337 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_file_popup", ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
5338 {
5339 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
5340 {
5341 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
5342 {
5343 ShowExampleMenuFile();
5344 ImGui::EndMenu();
5345 }
5346 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Edit"))
5347 {
5348 ImGui::MenuItem("Dummy");
5349 ImGui::EndMenu();
5350 }
5351 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
5352 }
5353 ImGui::Text("Hello from popup!");
5354 ImGui::Button("This is a dummy button..");
5355 ImGui::EndPopup();
5356 }
5357
5358 ImGui::TreePop();
5359 }
5360
5361 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Context menus");
5362 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))
5363 {
5364 HelpMarker("\"Context\" functions are simple helpers to associate a Popup to a given Item or Window identifier.");
5365
5366 // BeginPopupContextItem() is a helper to provide common/simple popup behavior of essentially doing:
5367 // if (id == 0)
5368 // id = GetItemID(); // Use last item id
5369 // if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
5370 // OpenPopup(id);
5371 // return BeginPopup(id);
5372 // For advanced uses you may want to replicate and customize this code.
5373 // See more details in BeginPopupContextItem().
5374
5375 // Example 1
5376 // When used after an item that has an ID (e.g. Button), we can skip providing an ID to BeginPopupContextItem(),
5377 // and BeginPopupContextItem() will use the last item ID as the popup ID.
5378 {
5379 const char* names[5] = { "Label1", "Label2", "Label3", "Label4", "Label5" };
5380 static int selected = -1;
5381 for (int n = 0; n < 5; n++)
5382 {
5383 if (ImGui::Selectable(names[n], selected == n))
5384 selected = n;
5385 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem()) // <-- use last item id as popup id
5386 {
5387 selected = n;
5388 ImGui::Text("This a popup for \"%s\"!", names[n]);
5389 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5390 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5391 ImGui::EndPopup();
5392 }
5393 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("Right-click to open popup");
5394 }
5395 }
5396
5397 // Example 2
5398 // Popup on a Text() element which doesn't have an identifier: we need to provide an identifier to BeginPopupContextItem().
5399 // Using an explicit identifier is also convenient if you want to activate the popups from different locations.
5400 {
5401 HelpMarker("Text() elements don't have stable identifiers so we need to provide one.");
5402 static float value = 0.5f;
5403 ImGui::Text("Value = %.3f <-- (1) right-click this text", value);
5404 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem("my popup"))
5405 {
5406 if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to zero")) value = 0.0f;
5407 if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to PI")) value = 3.1415f;
5408 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
5409 ImGui::DragFloat("##Value", &value, 0.1f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
5410 ImGui::EndPopup();
5411 }
5412
5413 // We can also use OpenPopupOnItemClick() to toggle the visibility of a given popup.
5414 // Here we make it that right-clicking this other text element opens the same popup as above.
5415 // The popup itself will be submitted by the code above.
5416 ImGui::Text("(2) Or right-click this text");
5417 ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick("my popup", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5418
5419 // Back to square one: manually open the same popup.
5420 if (ImGui::Button("(3) Or click this button"))
5421 ImGui::OpenPopup("my popup");
5422 }
5423
5424 // Example 3
5425 // When using BeginPopupContextItem() with an implicit identifier (NULL == use last item ID),
5426 // we need to make sure your item identifier is stable.
5427 // In this example we showcase altering the item label while preserving its identifier, using the ### operator (see FAQ).
5428 {
5429 HelpMarker("Showcase using a popup ID linked to item ID, with the item having a changing label + stable ID using the ### operator.");
5430 static char name[32] = "Label1";
5431 char buf[64];
5432 sprintf(buf, "Button: %s###Button", name); // ### operator override ID ignoring the preceding label
5433 ImGui::Button(buf);
5434 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
5435 {
5436 ImGui::Text("Edit name:");
5437 ImGui::InputText("##edit", name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name));
5438 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5439 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5440 ImGui::EndPopup();
5441 }
5442 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("(<-- right-click here)");
5443 }
5444
5445 ImGui::TreePop();
5446 }
5447
5448 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Modals");
5449 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Modals"))
5450 {
5451 ImGui::TextWrapped("Modal windows are like popups but the user cannot close them by clicking outside.");
5452
5453 if (ImGui::Button("Delete.."))
5454 ImGui::OpenPopup("Delete?");
5455
5456 // Always center this window when appearing
5457 ImVec2 center = ImGui::GetMainViewport()->GetCenter();
5458 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(center, ImGuiCond_Appearing, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
5459
5460 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Delete?", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
5461 {
5462 ImGui::Text("All those beautiful files will be deleted.\nThis operation cannot be undone!");
5463 ImGui::Separator();
5464
5465 //static int unused_i = 0;
5466 //ImGui::Combo("Combo", &unused_i, "Delete\0Delete harder\0");
5467
5468 static bool dont_ask_me_next_time = false;
5469 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
5470 ImGui::Checkbox("Don't ask me next time", &dont_ask_me_next_time);
5471 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
5472
5473 if (ImGui::Button("OK", ImVec2(120, 0))) { ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup(); }
5474 ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
5475 ImGui::SameLine();
5476 if (ImGui::Button("Cancel", ImVec2(120, 0))) { ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup(); }
5477 ImGui::EndPopup();
5478 }
5479
5480 if (ImGui::Button("Stacked modals.."))
5481 ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 1");
5482 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 1", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
5483 {
5484 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
5485 {
5486 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
5487 {
5488 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Some menu item")) {}
5489 ImGui::EndMenu();
5490 }
5491 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
5492 }
5493 ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The First\nUsing style.Colors[ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg] behind it.");
5494
5495 // Testing behavior of widgets stacking their own regular popups over the modal.
5496 static int item = 1;
5497 static float color[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
5498 ImGui::Combo("Combo", &item, "aaaa\0bbbb\0cccc\0dddd\0eeee\0\0");
5499 ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", color);
5500
5501 if (ImGui::Button("Add another modal.."))
5502 ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 2");
5503
5504 // Also demonstrate passing a bool* to BeginPopupModal(), this will create a regular close button which
5505 // will close the popup. Note that the visibility state of popups is owned by imgui, so the input value
5506 // of the bool actually doesn't matter here.
5507 bool unused_open = true;
5508 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 2", &unused_open))
5509 {
5510 ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The Second!");
5511 ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", color); // Allow opening another nested popup
5512 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5513 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5514 ImGui::EndPopup();
5515 }
5516
5517 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5518 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5519 ImGui::EndPopup();
5520 }
5521
5522 ImGui::TreePop();
5523 }
5524
5525 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Menus inside a regular window");
5526 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Menus inside a regular window"))
5527 {
5528 ImGui::TextWrapped("Below we are testing adding menu items to a regular window. It's rather unusual but should work!");
5529 ImGui::Separator();
5530
5531 ImGui::MenuItem("Menu item", "CTRL+M");
5532 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu inside a regular window"))
5533 {
5534 ShowExampleMenuFile();
5535 ImGui::EndMenu();
5536 }
5537 ImGui::Separator();
5538 ImGui::TreePop();
5539 }
5540}
5541
5542// Dummy data structure that we use for the Table demo.
5543// (pre-C++11 doesn't allow us to instantiate ImVector<MyItem> template if this structure is defined inside the demo function)
5544namespace
5545{
5546// We are passing our own identifier to TableSetupColumn() to facilitate identifying columns in the sorting code.
5547// This identifier will be passed down into ImGuiTableSortSpec::ColumnUserID.
5548// But it is possible to omit the user id parameter of TableSetupColumn() and just use the column index instead! (ImGuiTableSortSpec::ColumnIndex)
5549// If you don't use sorting, you will generally never care about giving column an ID!
5550enum MyItemColumnID
5551{
5552 MyItemColumnID_ID,
5553 MyItemColumnID_Name,
5554 MyItemColumnID_Action,
5555 MyItemColumnID_Quantity,
5556 MyItemColumnID_Description
5557};
5558
5559struct MyItem
5560{
5561 int ID;
5562 const char* Name;
5563 int Quantity;
5564
5565 // We have a problem which is affecting _only this demo_ and should not affect your code:
5566 // As we don't rely on std:: or other third-party library to compile dear imgui, we only have reliable access to qsort(),
5567 // however qsort doesn't allow passing user data to comparing function.
5568 // As a workaround, we are storing the sort specs in a static/global for the comparing function to access.
5569 // In your own use case you would probably pass the sort specs to your sorting/comparing functions directly and not use a global.
5570 // We could technically call ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs() in CompareWithSortSpecs(), but considering that this function is called
5571 // very often by the sorting algorithm it would be a little wasteful.
5572 static const ImGuiTableSortSpecs* s_current_sort_specs;
5573
5574 static void SortWithSortSpecs(ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sort_specs, MyItem* items, int items_count)
5575 {
5576 s_current_sort_specs = sort_specs; // Store in variable accessible by the sort function.
5577 if (items_count > 1)
5578 qsort(items, (size_t)items_count, sizeof(items[0]), MyItem::CompareWithSortSpecs);
5579 s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
5580 }
5581
5582 // Compare function to be used by qsort()
5583 static int IMGUI_CDECL CompareWithSortSpecs(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
5584 {
5585 const MyItem* a = (const MyItem*)lhs;
5586 const MyItem* b = (const MyItem*)rhs;
5587 for (int n = 0; n < s_current_sort_specs->SpecsCount; n++)
5588 {
5589 // Here we identify columns using the ColumnUserID value that we ourselves passed to TableSetupColumn()
5590 // We could also choose to identify columns based on their index (sort_spec->ColumnIndex), which is simpler!
5591 const ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs* sort_spec = &s_current_sort_specs->Specs[n];
5592 int delta = 0;
5593 switch (sort_spec->ColumnUserID)
5594 {
5595 case MyItemColumnID_ID: delta = (a->ID - b->ID); break;
5596 case MyItemColumnID_Name: delta = (strcmp(a->Name, b->Name)); break;
5597 case MyItemColumnID_Quantity: delta = (a->Quantity - b->Quantity); break;
5598 case MyItemColumnID_Description: delta = (strcmp(a->Name, b->Name)); break;
5599 default: IM_ASSERT(0); break;
5600 }
5601 if (delta > 0)
5602 return (sort_spec->SortDirection == ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending) ? +1 : -1;
5603 if (delta < 0)
5604 return (sort_spec->SortDirection == ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending) ? -1 : +1;
5605 }
5606
5607 // qsort() is instable so always return a way to differentiate items.
5608 // Your own compare function may want to avoid fallback on implicit sort specs.
5609 // e.g. a Name compare if it wasn't already part of the sort specs.
5610 return (a->ID - b->ID);
5611 }
5612};
5613const ImGuiTableSortSpecs* MyItem::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
5614}
5615
5616// Make the UI compact because there are so many fields
5617static void PushStyleCompact()
5618{
5619 ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
5620 ImGui::PushStyleVarY(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, (float)(int)(style.FramePadding.y * 0.60f));
5621 ImGui::PushStyleVarY(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, (float)(int)(style.ItemSpacing.y * 0.60f));
5622}
5623
5624static void PopStyleCompact()
5625{
5626 ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
5627}
5628
5629// Show a combo box with a choice of sizing policies
5630static void EditTableSizingFlags(ImGuiTableFlags* p_flags)
5631{
5632 struct EnumDesc { ImGuiTableFlags Value; const char* Name; const char* Tooltip; };
5633 static const EnumDesc policies[] =
5634 {
5635 { ImGuiTableFlags_None, "Default", "Use default sizing policy:\n- ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit if ScrollX is on or if host window has ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize.\n- ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame otherwise." },
5636 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit", "Columns default to _WidthFixed (if resizable) or _WidthAuto (if not resizable), matching contents width." },
5637 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame", "Columns are all the same width, matching the maximum contents width.\nImplicitly disable ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable and enable ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible." },
5638 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp", "Columns default to _WidthStretch with weights proportional to their widths." },
5639 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame", "Columns default to _WidthStretch with same weights." }
5640 };
5641 int idx;
5642 for (idx = 0; idx < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); idx++)
5643 if (policies[idx].Value == (*p_flags & ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_))
5644 break;
5645 const char* preview_text = (idx < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies)) ? policies[idx].Name + (idx > 0 ? strlen("ImGuiTableFlags") : 0) : "";
5646 if (ImGui::BeginCombo("Sizing Policy", preview_text))
5647 {
5648 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); n++)
5649 if (ImGui::Selectable(policies[n].Name, idx == n))
5650 *p_flags = (*p_flags & ~ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_) | policies[n].Value;
5651 ImGui::EndCombo();
5652 }
5653 ImGui::SameLine();
5654 ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
5655 if (ImGui::BeginItemTooltip())
5656 {
5657 ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 50.0f);
5658 for (int m = 0; m < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); m++)
5659 {
5660 ImGui::Separator();
5661 ImGui::Text("%s:", policies[m].Name);
5662 ImGui::Separator();
5663 ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + ImGui::GetStyle().IndentSpacing * 0.5f);
5664 ImGui::TextUnformatted(policies[m].Tooltip);
5665 }
5666 ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
5667 ImGui::EndTooltip();
5668 }
5669}
5670
5671static void EditTableColumnsFlags(ImGuiTableColumnFlags* p_flags)
5672{
5673 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_Disabled", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_Disabled); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Master disable flag (also hide from context menu)");
5674 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_DefaultHide", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);
5675 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_DefaultSort", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort);
5676 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_WidthStretch", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch))
5677 *p_flags &= ~(ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ ^ ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
5678 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_WidthFixed", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed))
5679 *p_flags &= ~(ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ ^ ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
5680 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoResize", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoResize);
5681 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoReorder", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoReorder);
5682 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoHide", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide);
5683 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoClip", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoClip);
5684 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoSort", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort);
5685 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoSortAscending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending);
5686 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoSortDescending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending);
5687 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoHeaderLabel", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel);
5688 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoHeaderWidth", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth);
5689 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_PreferSortAscending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending);
5690 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_PreferSortDescending", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending);
5691 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IndentEnable", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Default for column 0");
5692 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IndentDisable", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Default for column >0");
5693 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_AngledHeader", p_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader);
5694}
5695
5696static void ShowTableColumnsStatusFlags(ImGuiTableColumnFlags flags)
5697{
5698 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsEnabled", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled);
5699 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsVisible", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible);
5700 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsSorted", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted);
5701 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_IsHovered", &flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered);
5702}
5703
5704//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5705// [SECTION] DemoWindowTables()
5706//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5707
5708static void DemoWindowTables()
5709{
5710 //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
5711 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables");
5712 if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Tables & Columns"))
5713 return;
5714
5715 // Using those as a base value to create width/height that are factor of the size of our font
5716 const float TEXT_BASE_WIDTH = ImGui::CalcTextSize("A").x;
5717 const float TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
5718
5719 ImGui::PushID("Tables");
5720
5721 int open_action = -1;
5722 if (ImGui::Button("Expand all"))
5723 open_action = 1;
5724 ImGui::SameLine();
5725 if (ImGui::Button("Collapse all"))
5726 open_action = 0;
5727 ImGui::SameLine();
5728
5729 // Options
5730 static bool disable_indent = false;
5731 ImGui::Checkbox("Disable tree indentation", &disable_indent);
5732 ImGui::SameLine();
5733 HelpMarker("Disable the indenting of tree nodes so demo tables can use the full window width.");
5734 ImGui::Separator();
5735 if (disable_indent)
5736 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, 0.0f);
5737
5738 // About Styling of tables
5739 // Most settings are configured on a per-table basis via the flags passed to BeginTable() and TableSetupColumns APIs.
5740 // There are however a few settings that a shared and part of the ImGuiStyle structure:
5741 // style.CellPadding // Padding within each cell
5742 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg] // Table header background
5743 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong] // Table outer and header borders
5744 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight] // Table inner borders
5745 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableRowBg] // Table row background when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is enabled (even rows)
5746 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt] // Table row background when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is enabled (odds rows)
5747
5748 // Demos
5749 if (open_action != -1)
5750 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5751 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Basic");
5752 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
5753 {
5754 // Here we will showcase three different ways to output a table.
5755 // They are very simple variations of a same thing!
5756
5757 // [Method 1] Using TableNextRow() to create a new row, and TableSetColumnIndex() to select the column.
5758 // In many situations, this is the most flexible and easy to use pattern.
5759 HelpMarker("Using TableNextRow() + calling TableSetColumnIndex() _before_ each cell, in a loop.");
5760 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3))
5761 {
5762 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
5763 {
5764 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5765 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5766 {
5767 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5768 ImGui::Text("Row %d Column %d", row, column);
5769 }
5770 }
5771 ImGui::EndTable();
5772 }
5773
5774 // [Method 2] Using TableNextColumn() called multiple times, instead of using a for loop + TableSetColumnIndex().
5775 // This is generally more convenient when you have code manually submitting the contents of each column.
5776 HelpMarker("Using TableNextRow() + calling TableNextColumn() _before_ each cell, manually.");
5777 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3))
5778 {
5779 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
5780 {
5781 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5782 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5783 ImGui::Text("Row %d", row);
5784 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5785 ImGui::Text("Some contents");
5786 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5787 ImGui::Text("123.456");
5788 }
5789 ImGui::EndTable();
5790 }
5791
5792 // [Method 3] We call TableNextColumn() _before_ each cell. We never call TableNextRow(),
5793 // as TableNextColumn() will automatically wrap around and create new rows as needed.
5794 // This is generally more convenient when your cells all contains the same type of data.
5795 HelpMarker(
5796 "Only using TableNextColumn(), which tends to be convenient for tables where every cell contains "
5797 "the same type of contents.\n This is also more similar to the old NextColumn() function of the "
5798 "Columns API, and provided to facilitate the Columns->Tables API transition.");
5799 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table3", 3))
5800 {
5801 for (int item = 0; item < 14; item++)
5802 {
5803 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5804 ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
5805 }
5806 ImGui::EndTable();
5807 }
5808
5809 ImGui::TreePop();
5810 }
5811
5812 if (open_action != -1)
5813 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5814 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Borders, background");
5815 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders, background"))
5816 {
5817 // Expose a few Borders related flags interactively
5818 enum ContentsType { CT_Text, CT_FillButton };
5819 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
5820 static bool display_headers = false;
5821 static int contents_type = CT_Text;
5822
5823 PushStyleCompact();
5824 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
5825 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
5826 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders\n = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH");
5827 ImGui::Indent();
5828
5829 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
5830 ImGui::Indent();
5831 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH);
5832 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH);
5833 ImGui::Unindent();
5834
5835 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
5836 ImGui::Indent();
5837 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
5838 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
5839 ImGui::Unindent();
5840
5841 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter);
5842 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner);
5843 ImGui::Unindent();
5844
5845 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); ImGui::Text("Cell contents:");
5846 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::RadioButton("Text", &contents_type, CT_Text);
5847 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::RadioButton("FillButton", &contents_type, CT_FillButton);
5848 ImGui::Checkbox("Display headers", &display_headers);
5849 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appear in Headers");
5850 PopStyleCompact();
5851
5852 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
5853 {
5854 // Display headers so we can inspect their interaction with borders
5855 // (Headers are not the main purpose of this section of the demo, so we are not elaborating on them now. See other sections for details)
5856 if (display_headers)
5857 {
5858 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
5859 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
5860 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
5861 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
5862 }
5863
5864 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
5865 {
5866 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5867 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5868 {
5869 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5870 char buf[32];
5871 sprintf(buf, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
5872 if (contents_type == CT_Text)
5873 ImGui::TextUnformatted(buf);
5874 else if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)
5875 ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
5876 }
5877 }
5878 ImGui::EndTable();
5879 }
5880 ImGui::TreePop();
5881 }
5882
5883 if (open_action != -1)
5884 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5885 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Resizable, stretch");
5886 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, stretch"))
5887 {
5888 // By default, if we don't enable ScrollX the sizing policy for each column is "Stretch"
5889 // All columns maintain a sizing weight, and they will occupy all available width.
5890 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
5891 PushStyleCompact();
5892 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
5893 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
5894 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
5895 "Using the _Resizable flag automatically enables the _BordersInnerV flag as well, "
5896 "this is why the resize borders are still showing when unchecking this.");
5897 PopStyleCompact();
5898
5899 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
5900 {
5901 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
5902 {
5903 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5904 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5905 {
5906 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5907 ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
5908 }
5909 }
5910 ImGui::EndTable();
5911 }
5912 ImGui::TreePop();
5913 }
5914
5915 if (open_action != -1)
5916 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5917 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Resizable, fixed");
5918 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, fixed"))
5919 {
5920 // Here we use ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit (even though _ScrollX is not set)
5921 // So columns will adopt the "Fixed" policy and will maintain a fixed width regardless of the whole available width (unless table is small)
5922 // If there is not enough available width to fit all columns, they will however be resized down.
5923 // FIXME-TABLE: Providing a stretch-on-init would make sense especially for tables which don't have saved settings
5924 HelpMarker(
5925 "Using _Resizable + _SizingFixedFit flags.\n"
5926 "Fixed-width columns generally makes more sense if you want to use horizontal scrolling.\n\n"
5927 "Double-click a column border to auto-fit the column to its contents.");
5928 PushStyleCompact();
5929 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
5930 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
5931 PopStyleCompact();
5932
5933 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
5934 {
5935 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
5936 {
5937 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5938 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5939 {
5940 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5941 ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
5942 }
5943 }
5944 ImGui::EndTable();
5945 }
5946 ImGui::TreePop();
5947 }
5948
5949 if (open_action != -1)
5950 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5951 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Resizable, mixed");
5952 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, mixed"))
5953 {
5954 HelpMarker(
5955 "Using TableSetupColumn() to alter resizing policy on a per-column basis.\n\n"
5956 "When combining Fixed and Stretch columns, generally you only want one, maybe two trailing columns to use _WidthStretch.");
5957 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;
5958
5959 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
5960 {
5961 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("AAA", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
5962 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("BBB", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
5963 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("CCC", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
5964 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
5965 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
5966 {
5967 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5968 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5969 {
5970 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5971 ImGui::Text("%s %d,%d", (column == 2) ? "Stretch" : "Fixed", column, row);
5972 }
5973 }
5974 ImGui::EndTable();
5975 }
5976 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 6, flags))
5977 {
5978 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("AAA", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
5979 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("BBB", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
5980 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("CCC", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);
5981 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("DDD", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
5982 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("EEE", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch);
5983 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("FFF", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide);
5984 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
5985 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
5986 {
5987 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5988 for (int column = 0; column < 6; column++)
5989 {
5990 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5991 ImGui::Text("%s %d,%d", (column >= 3) ? "Stretch" : "Fixed", column, row);
5992 }
5993 }
5994 ImGui::EndTable();
5995 }
5996 ImGui::TreePop();
5997 }
5998
5999 if (open_action != -1)
6000 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6001 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Reorderable, hideable, with headers");
6002 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Reorderable, hideable, with headers"))
6003 {
6004 HelpMarker(
6005 "Click and drag column headers to reorder columns.\n\n"
6006 "Right-click on a header to open a context menu.");
6007 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV;
6008 PushStyleCompact();
6009 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6010 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable);
6011 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable);
6012 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody);
6013 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appear in Headers)");
6014 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn);
6015 PopStyleCompact();
6016
6017 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
6018 {
6019 // Submit columns name with TableSetupColumn() and call TableHeadersRow() to create a row with a header in each column.
6020 // (Later we will show how TableSetupColumn() has other uses, optional flags, sizing weight etc.)
6021 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
6022 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
6023 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
6024 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6025 for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)
6026 {
6027 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6028 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6029 {
6030 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6031 ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
6032 }
6033 }
6034 ImGui::EndTable();
6035 }
6036
6037 // Use outer_size.x == 0.0f instead of default to make the table as tight as possible
6038 // (only valid when no scrolling and no stretch column)
6039 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, flags | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f)))
6040 {
6041 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
6042 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
6043 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
6044 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6045 for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)
6046 {
6047 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6048 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6049 {
6050 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6051 ImGui::Text("Fixed %d,%d", column, row);
6052 }
6053 }
6054 ImGui::EndTable();
6055 }
6056 ImGui::TreePop();
6057 }
6058
6059 if (open_action != -1)
6060 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6061 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Padding");
6062 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Padding"))
6063 {
6064 // First example: showcase use of padding flags and effect of BorderOuterV/BorderInnerV on X padding.
6065 // We don't expose BorderOuterH/BorderInnerH here because they have no effect on X padding.
6066 HelpMarker(
6067 "We often want outer padding activated when any using features which makes the edges of a column visible:\n"
6068 "e.g.:\n"
6069 "- BorderOuterV\n"
6070 "- any form of row selection\n"
6071 "Because of this, activating BorderOuterV sets the default to PadOuterX. "
6072 "Using PadOuterX or NoPadOuterX you can override the default.\n\n"
6073 "Actual padding values are using style.CellPadding.\n\n"
6074 "In this demo we don't show horizontal borders to emphasize how they don't affect default horizontal padding.");
6075
6076 static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV;
6077 PushStyleCompact();
6078 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX);
6079 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable outer-most padding (default if ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV is set)");
6080 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);
6081 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable outer-most padding (default if ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV is not set)");
6082 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX);
6083 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off)");
6084 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
6085 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
6086 static bool show_headers = false;
6087 ImGui::Checkbox("show_headers", &show_headers);
6088 PopStyleCompact();
6089
6090 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_padding", 3, flags1))
6091 {
6092 if (show_headers)
6093 {
6094 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
6095 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
6096 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
6097 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6098 }
6099
6100 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
6101 {
6102 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6103 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6104 {
6105 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6106 if (row == 0)
6107 {
6108 ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
6109 }
6110 else
6111 {
6112 char buf[32];
6113 sprintf(buf, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
6114 ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
6115 }
6116 //if (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags() & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)
6117 // ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, IM_COL32(0, 100, 0, 255));
6118 }
6119 }
6120 ImGui::EndTable();
6121 }
6122
6123 // Second example: set style.CellPadding to (0.0) or a custom value.
6124 // FIXME-TABLE: Vertical border effectively not displayed the same way as horizontal one...
6125 HelpMarker("Setting style.CellPadding to (0,0) or a custom value.");
6126 static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
6127 static ImVec2 cell_padding(0.0f, 0.0f);
6128 static bool show_widget_frame_bg = true;
6129
6130 PushStyleCompact();
6131 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
6132 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
6133 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
6134 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner);
6135 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter);
6136 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
6137 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6138 ImGui::Checkbox("show_widget_frame_bg", &show_widget_frame_bg);
6139 ImGui::SliderFloat2("CellPadding", &cell_padding.x, 0.0f, 10.0f, "%.0f");
6140 PopStyleCompact();
6141
6142 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, cell_padding);
6143 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_padding_2", 3, flags2))
6144 {
6145 static char text_bufs[3 * 5][16]; // Mini text storage for 3x5 cells
6146 static bool init = true;
6147 if (!show_widget_frame_bg)
6148 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBg, 0);
6149 for (int cell = 0; cell < 3 * 5; cell++)
6150 {
6151 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6152 if (init)
6153 strcpy(text_bufs[cell], "edit me");
6154 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
6155 ImGui::PushID(cell);
6156 ImGui::InputText("##cell", text_bufs[cell], IM_ARRAYSIZE(text_bufs[cell]));
6157 ImGui::PopID();
6158 }
6159 if (!show_widget_frame_bg)
6160 ImGui::PopStyleColor();
6161 init = false;
6162 ImGui::EndTable();
6163 }
6164 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
6165
6166 ImGui::TreePop();
6167 }
6168
6169 if (open_action != -1)
6170 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6171 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Explicit widths");
6172 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Sizing policies"))
6173 {
6174 static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
6175 PushStyleCompact();
6176 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6177 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
6178 PopStyleCompact();
6179
6180 static ImGuiTableFlags sizing_policy_flags[4] = { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame };
6181 for (int table_n = 0; table_n < 4; table_n++)
6182 {
6183 ImGui::PushID(table_n);
6184 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);
6185 EditTableSizingFlags(&sizing_policy_flags[table_n]);
6186
6187 // To make it easier to understand the different sizing policy,
6188 // For each policy: we display one table where the columns have equal contents width,
6189 // and one where the columns have different contents width.
6190 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, sizing_policy_flags[table_n] | flags1))
6191 {
6192 for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
6193 {
6194 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6195 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");
6196 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");
6197 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("Oh dear");
6198 }
6199 ImGui::EndTable();
6200 }
6201 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, sizing_policy_flags[table_n] | flags1))
6202 {
6203 for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
6204 {
6205 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6206 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("AAAA");
6207 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("BBBBBBBB");
6208 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("CCCCCCCCCCCC");
6209 }
6210 ImGui::EndTable();
6211 }
6212 ImGui::PopID();
6213 }
6214
6215 ImGui::Spacing();
6216 ImGui::TextUnformatted("Advanced");
6217 ImGui::SameLine();
6218 HelpMarker(
6219 "This section allows you to interact and see the effect of various sizing policies "
6220 "depending on whether Scroll is enabled and the contents of your columns.");
6221
6222 enum ContentsType { CT_ShowWidth, CT_ShortText, CT_LongText, CT_Button, CT_FillButton, CT_InputText };
6223 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable;
6224 static int contents_type = CT_ShowWidth;
6225 static int column_count = 3;
6226
6227 PushStyleCompact();
6228 ImGui::PushID("Advanced");
6229 ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);
6230 EditTableSizingFlags(&flags);
6231 ImGui::Combo("Contents", &contents_type, "Show width\0Short Text\0Long Text\0Button\0Fill Button\0InputText\0");
6232 if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)
6233 {
6234 ImGui::SameLine();
6235 HelpMarker(
6236 "Be mindful that using right-alignment (e.g. size.x = -FLT_MIN) creates a feedback loop "
6237 "where contents width can feed into auto-column width can feed into contents width.");
6238 }
6239 ImGui::DragInt("Columns", &column_count, 0.1f, 1, 64, "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
6240 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6241 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths);
6242 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.");
6243 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
6244 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
6245 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip);
6246 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
6247 ImGui::PopID();
6248 PopStyleCompact();
6249
6250 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", column_count, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 7)))
6251 {
6252 for (int cell = 0; cell < 10 * column_count; cell++)
6253 {
6254 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6255 int column = ImGui::TableGetColumnIndex();
6256 int row = ImGui::TableGetRowIndex();
6257
6258 ImGui::PushID(cell);
6259 char label[32];
6260 static char text_buf[32] = "";
6261 sprintf(label, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
6262 switch (contents_type)
6263 {
6264 case CT_ShortText: ImGui::TextUnformatted(label); break;
6265 case CT_LongText: ImGui::Text("Some %s text %d,%d\nOver two lines..", column == 0 ? "long" : "longeeer", column, row); break;
6266 case CT_ShowWidth: ImGui::Text("W: %.1f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x); break;
6267 case CT_Button: ImGui::Button(label); break;
6268 case CT_FillButton: ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f)); break;
6269 case CT_InputText: ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN); ImGui::InputText("##", text_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(text_buf)); break;
6270 }
6271 ImGui::PopID();
6272 }
6273 ImGui::EndTable();
6274 }
6275 ImGui::TreePop();
6276 }
6277
6278 if (open_action != -1)
6279 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6280 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Vertical scrolling, with clipping");
6281 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Vertical scrolling, with clipping"))
6282 {
6283 HelpMarker(
6284 "Here we activate ScrollY, which will create a child window container to allow hosting scrollable contents.\n\n"
6285 "We also demonstrate using ImGuiListClipper to virtualize the submission of many items.");
6286 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;
6287
6288 PushStyleCompact();
6289 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
6290 PopStyleCompact();
6291
6292 // When using ScrollX or ScrollY we need to specify a size for our table container!
6293 // Otherwise by default the table will fit all available space, like a BeginChild() call.
6294 ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 8);
6295 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_scrolly", 3, flags, outer_size))
6296 {
6297 ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(0, 1); // Make top row always visible
6298 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);
6299 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);
6300 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None);
6301 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6302
6303 // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
6304 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
6305 clipper.Begin(1000);
6306 while (clipper.Step())
6307 {
6308 for (int row = clipper.DisplayStart; row < clipper.DisplayEnd; row++)
6309 {
6310 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6311 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6312 {
6313 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6314 ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
6315 }
6316 }
6317 }
6318 ImGui::EndTable();
6319 }
6320 ImGui::TreePop();
6321 }
6322
6323 if (open_action != -1)
6324 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6325 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Horizontal scrolling");
6326 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal scrolling"))
6327 {
6328 HelpMarker(
6329 "When ScrollX is enabled, the default sizing policy becomes ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, "
6330 "as automatically stretching columns doesn't make much sense with horizontal scrolling.\n\n"
6331 "Also note that as of the current version, you will almost always want to enable ScrollY along with ScrollX, "
6332 "because the container window won't automatically extend vertically to fix contents "
6333 "(this may be improved in future versions).");
6334 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable;
6335 static int freeze_cols = 1;
6336 static int freeze_rows = 1;
6337
6338 PushStyleCompact();
6339 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6340 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
6341 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
6342 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
6343 ImGui::DragInt("freeze_cols", &freeze_cols, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
6344 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
6345 ImGui::DragInt("freeze_rows", &freeze_rows, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
6346 PopStyleCompact();
6347
6348 // When using ScrollX or ScrollY we need to specify a size for our table container!
6349 // Otherwise by default the table will fit all available space, like a BeginChild() call.
6350 ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 8);
6351 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_scrollx", 7, flags, outer_size))
6352 {
6353 ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(freeze_cols, freeze_rows);
6354 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Line #", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide); // Make the first column not hideable to match our use of TableSetupScrollFreeze()
6355 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
6356 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
6357 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
6358 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Four");
6359 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Five");
6360 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Six");
6361 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6362 for (int row = 0; row < 20; row++)
6363 {
6364 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6365 for (int column = 0; column < 7; column++)
6366 {
6367 // Both TableNextColumn() and TableSetColumnIndex() return true when a column is visible or performing width measurement.
6368 // Because here we know that:
6369 // - A) all our columns are contributing the same to row height
6370 // - B) column 0 is always visible,
6371 // We only always submit this one column and can skip others.
6372 // More advanced per-column clipping behaviors may benefit from polling the status flags via TableGetColumnFlags().
6373 if (!ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column) && column > 0)
6374 continue;
6375 if (column == 0)
6376 ImGui::Text("Line %d", row);
6377 else
6378 ImGui::Text("Hello world %d,%d", column, row);
6379 }
6380 }
6381 ImGui::EndTable();
6382 }
6383
6384 ImGui::Spacing();
6385 ImGui::TextUnformatted("Stretch + ScrollX");
6386 ImGui::SameLine();
6387 HelpMarker(
6388 "Showcase using Stretch columns + ScrollX together: "
6389 "this is rather unusual and only makes sense when specifying an 'inner_width' for the table!\n"
6390 "Without an explicit value, inner_width is == outer_size.x and therefore using Stretch columns "
6391 "along with ScrollX doesn't make sense.");
6392 static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
6393 static float inner_width = 1000.0f;
6394 PushStyleCompact();
6395 ImGui::PushID("flags3");
6396 ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30);
6397 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
6398 ImGui::DragFloat("inner_width", &inner_width, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX, "%.1f");
6399 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
6400 ImGui::PopID();
6401 PopStyleCompact();
6402 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 7, flags2, outer_size, inner_width))
6403 {
6404 for (int cell = 0; cell < 20 * 7; cell++)
6405 {
6406 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6407 ImGui::Text("Hello world %d,%d", ImGui::TableGetColumnIndex(), ImGui::TableGetRowIndex());
6408 }
6409 ImGui::EndTable();
6410 }
6411 ImGui::TreePop();
6412 }
6413
6414 if (open_action != -1)
6415 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6416 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Columns flags");
6417 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Columns flags"))
6418 {
6419 // Create a first table just to show all the options/flags we want to make visible in our example!
6420 const int column_count = 3;
6421 const char* column_names[column_count] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
6422 static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags[column_count] = { ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide };
6423 static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags_out[column_count] = { 0, 0, 0 }; // Output from TableGetColumnFlags()
6424
6425 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_columns_flags_checkboxes", column_count, ImGuiTableFlags_None))
6426 {
6427 PushStyleCompact();
6428 for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
6429 {
6430 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6431 ImGui::PushID(column);
6432 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); // FIXME-TABLE: Workaround for wrong text baseline propagation across columns
6433 ImGui::Text("'%s'", column_names[column]);
6434 ImGui::Spacing();
6435 ImGui::Text("Input flags:");
6436 EditTableColumnsFlags(&column_flags[column]);
6437 ImGui::Spacing();
6438 ImGui::Text("Output flags:");
6439 ImGui::BeginDisabled();
6440 ShowTableColumnsStatusFlags(column_flags_out[column]);
6441 ImGui::EndDisabled();
6442 ImGui::PopID();
6443 }
6444 PopStyleCompact();
6445 ImGui::EndTable();
6446 }
6447
6448 // Create the real table we care about for the example!
6449 // We use a scrolling table to be able to showcase the difference between the _IsEnabled and _IsVisible flags above,
6450 // otherwise in a non-scrolling table columns are always visible (unless using ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible
6451 // + resizing the parent window down).
6452 const ImGuiTableFlags flags
6453 = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY
6454 | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV
6455 | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable;
6456 ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 9);
6457 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_columns_flags", column_count, flags, outer_size))
6458 {
6459 bool has_angled_header = false;
6460 for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
6461 {
6462 has_angled_header |= (column_flags[column] & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader) != 0;
6463 ImGui::TableSetupColumn(column_names[column], column_flags[column]);
6464 }
6465 if (has_angled_header)
6466 ImGui::TableAngledHeadersRow();
6467 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6468 for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
6469 column_flags_out[column] = ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(column);
6470 float indent_step = (float)((int)TEXT_BASE_WIDTH / 2);
6471 for (int row = 0; row < 8; row++)
6472 {
6473 // Add some indentation to demonstrate usage of per-column IndentEnable/IndentDisable flags.
6474 ImGui::Indent(indent_step);
6475 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6476 for (int column = 0; column < column_count; column++)
6477 {
6478 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6479 ImGui::Text("%s %s", (column == 0) ? "Indented" : "Hello", ImGui::TableGetColumnName(column));
6480 }
6481 }
6482 ImGui::Unindent(indent_step * 8.0f);
6483
6484 ImGui::EndTable();
6485 }
6486 ImGui::TreePop();
6487 }
6488
6489 if (open_action != -1)
6490 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6491 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Columns widths");
6492 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Columns widths"))
6493 {
6494 HelpMarker("Using TableSetupColumn() to setup default width.");
6495
6496 static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize;
6497 PushStyleCompact();
6498 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6499 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize);
6500 PopStyleCompact();
6501 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags1))
6502 {
6503 // We could also set ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit on the table and all columns will default to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed.
6504 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("one", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 100.0f); // Default to 100.0f
6505 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("two", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 200.0f); // Default to 200.0f
6506 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("three", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed); // Default to auto
6507 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6508 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
6509 {
6510 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6511 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6512 {
6513 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6514 if (row == 0)
6515 ImGui::Text("(w: %5.1f)", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
6516 else
6517 ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
6518 }
6519 }
6520 ImGui::EndTable();
6521 }
6522
6523 HelpMarker(
6524 "Using TableSetupColumn() to setup explicit width.\n\nUnless _NoKeepColumnsVisible is set, "
6525 "fixed columns with set width may still be shrunk down if there's not enough space in the host.");
6526
6527 static ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_None;
6528 PushStyleCompact();
6529 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible);
6530 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
6531 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags2, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
6532 PopStyleCompact();
6533 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 4, flags2))
6534 {
6535 // We could also set ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit on the table and then all columns
6536 // will default to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed.
6537 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 100.0f);
6538 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 15.0f);
6539 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30.0f);
6540 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 15.0f);
6541 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
6542 {
6543 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6544 for (int column = 0; column < 4; column++)
6545 {
6546 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6547 if (row == 0)
6548 ImGui::Text("(w: %5.1f)", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
6549 else
6550 ImGui::Text("Hello %d,%d", column, row);
6551 }
6552 }
6553 ImGui::EndTable();
6554 }
6555 ImGui::TreePop();
6556 }
6557
6558 if (open_action != -1)
6559 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6560 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Nested tables");
6561 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Nested tables"))
6562 {
6563 HelpMarker("This demonstrates embedding a table into another table cell.");
6564
6565 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_nested1", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))
6566 {
6567 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("A0");
6568 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("A1");
6569 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6570
6571 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6572 ImGui::Text("A0 Row 0");
6573 {
6574 float rows_height = TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 2;
6575 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_nested2", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))
6576 {
6577 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("B0");
6578 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("B1");
6579 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6580
6581 ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, rows_height);
6582 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6583 ImGui::Text("B0 Row 0");
6584 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6585 ImGui::Text("B1 Row 0");
6586 ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, rows_height);
6587 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6588 ImGui::Text("B0 Row 1");
6589 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6590 ImGui::Text("B1 Row 1");
6591
6592 ImGui::EndTable();
6593 }
6594 }
6595 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("A1 Row 0");
6596 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("A0 Row 1");
6597 ImGui::TableNextColumn(); ImGui::Text("A1 Row 1");
6598 ImGui::EndTable();
6599 }
6600 ImGui::TreePop();
6601 }
6602
6603 if (open_action != -1)
6604 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6605 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Row height");
6606 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Row height"))
6607 {
6608 HelpMarker(
6609 "You can pass a 'min_row_height' to TableNextRow().\n\nRows are padded with 'style.CellPadding.y' on top and bottom, "
6610 "so effectively the minimum row height will always be >= 'style.CellPadding.y * 2.0f'.\n\n"
6611 "We cannot honor a _maximum_ row height as that would require a unique clipping rectangle per row.");
6612 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_row_height", 1, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
6613 {
6614 for (int row = 0; row < 8; row++)
6615 {
6616 float min_row_height = (float)(int)(TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 0.30f * row);
6617 ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, min_row_height);
6618 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6619 ImGui::Text("min_row_height = %.2f", min_row_height);
6620 }
6621 ImGui::EndTable();
6622 }
6623
6624 HelpMarker(
6625 "Showcase using SameLine(0,0) to share Current Line Height between cells.\n\n"
6626 "Please note that Tables Row Height is not the same thing as Current Line Height, "
6627 "as a table cell may contains multiple lines.");
6628 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_share_lineheight", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
6629 {
6630 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6631 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6632 ImGui::ColorButton("##1", ImVec4(0.13f, 0.26f, 0.40f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_None, ImVec2(40, 40));
6633 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6634 ImGui::Text("Line 1");
6635 ImGui::Text("Line 2");
6636
6637 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6638 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6639 ImGui::ColorButton("##2", ImVec4(0.13f, 0.26f, 0.40f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_None, ImVec2(40, 40));
6640 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6641 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f); // Reuse line height from previous column
6642 ImGui::Text("Line 1, with SameLine(0,0)");
6643 ImGui::Text("Line 2");
6644
6645 ImGui::EndTable();
6646 }
6647
6648 HelpMarker("Showcase altering CellPadding.y between rows. Note that CellPadding.x is locked for the entire table.");
6649 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_changing_cellpadding_y", 1, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
6650 {
6651 ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
6652 for (int row = 0; row < 8; row++)
6653 {
6654 if ((row % 3) == 2)
