6655 ImGui::PushStyleVarY(ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, 20.0f);
6656 ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None);
6657 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6658 ImGui::Text("CellPadding.y = %.2f", style.CellPadding.y);
6659 if ((row % 3) == 2)
6660 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
6661 }
6662 ImGui::EndTable();
6663 }
6664
6665 ImGui::TreePop();
6666 }
6667
6668 if (open_action != -1)
6669 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6670 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Outer size");
6671 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Outer size"))
6672 {
6673 // Showcasing use of ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX and ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY
6674 // Important to that note how the two flags have slightly different behaviors!
6675 ImGui::Text("Using NoHostExtendX and NoHostExtendY:");
6676 PushStyleCompact();
6677 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX;
6678 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
6679 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value.\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.");
6680 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY);
6681 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit).\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.");
6682 PopStyleCompact();
6683
6684 ImVec2 outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 5.5f);
6685 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags, outer_size))
6686 {
6687 for (int row = 0; row < 10; row++)
6688 {
6689 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6690 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6691 {
6692 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6693 ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
6694 }
6695 }
6696 ImGui::EndTable();
6697 }
6698 ImGui::SameLine();
6699 ImGui::Text("Hello!");
6700
6701 ImGui::Spacing();
6702
6703 ImGui::Text("Using explicit size:");
6704 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg, ImVec2(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30, 0.0f)))
6705 {
6706 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
6707 {
6708 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6709 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6710 {
6711 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6712 ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
6713 }
6714 }
6715 ImGui::EndTable();
6716 }
6717 ImGui::SameLine();
6718 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table3", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg, ImVec2(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 30, 0.0f)))
6719 {
6720 for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
6721 {
6722 ImGui::TableNextRow(0, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 1.5f);
6723 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6724 {
6725 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6726 ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
6727 }
6728 }
6729 ImGui::EndTable();
6730 }
6731
6732 ImGui::TreePop();
6733 }
6734
6735 if (open_action != -1)
6736 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6737 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Background color");
6738 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Background color"))
6739 {
6740 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
6741 static int row_bg_type = 1;
6742 static int row_bg_target = 1;
6743 static int cell_bg_type = 1;
6744
6745 PushStyleCompact();
6746 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
6747 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
6748 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg automatically sets RowBg0 to alternative colors pulled from the Style.");
6749 ImGui::Combo("row bg type", (int*)&row_bg_type, "None\0Red\0Gradient\0");
6750 ImGui::Combo("row bg target", (int*)&row_bg_target, "RowBg0\0RowBg1\0"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Target RowBg0 to override the alternating odd/even colors,\nTarget RowBg1 to blend with them.");
6751 ImGui::Combo("cell bg type", (int*)&cell_bg_type, "None\0Blue\0"); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("We are colorizing cells to B1->C2 here.");
6752 IM_ASSERT(row_bg_type >= 0 && row_bg_type <= 2);
6753 IM_ASSERT(row_bg_target >= 0 && row_bg_target <= 1);
6754 IM_ASSERT(cell_bg_type >= 0 && cell_bg_type <= 1);
6755 PopStyleCompact();
6756
6757 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 5, flags))
6758 {
6759 for (int row = 0; row < 6; row++)
6760 {
6761 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6762
6763 // Demonstrate setting a row background color with 'ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBgX, ...)'
6764 // We use a transparent color so we can see the one behind in case our target is RowBg1 and RowBg0 was already targeted by the ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg flag.
6765 if (row_bg_type != 0)
6766 {
6767 ImU32 row_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(row_bg_type == 1 ? ImVec4(0.7f, 0.3f, 0.3f, 0.65f) : ImVec4(0.2f + row * 0.1f, 0.2f, 0.2f, 0.65f)); // Flat or Gradient?
6768 ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg0 + row_bg_target, row_bg_color);
6769 }
6770
6771 // Fill cells
6772 for (int column = 0; column < 5; column++)
6773 {
6774 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6775 ImGui::Text("%c%c", 'A' + row, '0' + column);
6776
6777 // Change background of Cells B1->C2
6778 // Demonstrate setting a cell background color with 'ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, ...)'
6779 // (the CellBg color will be blended over the RowBg and ColumnBg colors)
6780 // We can also pass a column number as a third parameter to TableSetBgColor() and do this outside the column loop.
6781 if (row >= 1 && row <= 2 && column >= 1 && column <= 2 && cell_bg_type == 1)
6782 {
6783 ImU32 cell_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(ImVec4(0.3f, 0.3f, 0.7f, 0.65f));
6784 ImGui::TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg, cell_bg_color);
6785 }
6786 }
6787 }
6788 ImGui::EndTable();
6789 }
6790 ImGui::TreePop();
6791 }
6792
6793 if (open_action != -1)
6794 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6795 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Tree view");
6796 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree view"))
6797 {
6798 static ImGuiTableFlags table_flags = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody;
6799
6800 static ImGuiTreeNodeFlags tree_node_flags_base = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull;
6801 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth", &tree_node_flags_base, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);
6802 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth", &tree_node_flags_base, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth);
6803 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns", &tree_node_flags_base, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns);
6804 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_LabelSpanAllColumns", &tree_node_flags_base, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_LabelSpanAllColumns);
6805 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Useful if you know that you aren't displaying contents in other columns");
6806
6807 HelpMarker("See \"Columns flags\" section to configure how indentation is applied to individual columns.");
6808 if (ImGui::BeginTable("3ways", 3, table_flags))
6809 {
6810 // The first column will use the default _WidthStretch when ScrollX is Off and _WidthFixed when ScrollX is On
6811 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide);
6812 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Size", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 12.0f);
6813 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Type", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 18.0f);
6814 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6815
6816 // Simple storage to output a dummy file-system.
6817 struct MyTreeNode
6818 {
6819 const char* Name;
6820 const char* Type;
6821 int Size;
6822 int ChildIdx;
6823 int ChildCount;
6824 static void DisplayNode(const MyTreeNode* node, const MyTreeNode* all_nodes)
6825 {
6826 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6827 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6828 const bool is_folder = (node->ChildCount > 0);
6829
6830 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags node_flags = tree_node_flags_base;
6831 if (node != &all_nodes[0])
6832 node_flags &= ~ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_LabelSpanAllColumns; // Only demonstrate this on the root node.
6833
6834 if (is_folder)
6835 {
6836 bool open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, node_flags);
6837 if ((node_flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_LabelSpanAllColumns) == 0)
6838 {
6839 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6840 ImGui::TextDisabled("--");
6841 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6842 ImGui::TextUnformatted(node->Type);
6843 }
6844 if (open)
6845 {
6846 for (int child_n = 0; child_n < node->ChildCount; child_n++)
6847 DisplayNode(&all_nodes[node->ChildIdx + child_n], all_nodes);
6848 ImGui::TreePop();
6849 }
6850 }
6851 else
6852 {
6853 ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, node_flags | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen);
6854 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6855 ImGui::Text("%d", node->Size);
6856 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
6857 ImGui::TextUnformatted(node->Type);
6858 }
6859 }
6860 };
6861 static const MyTreeNode nodes[] =
6862 {
6863 { "Root with Long Name", "Folder", -1, 1, 3 }, // 0
6864 { "Music", "Folder", -1, 4, 2 }, // 1
6865 { "Textures", "Folder", -1, 6, 3 }, // 2
6866 { "desktop.ini", "System file", 1024, -1,-1 }, // 3
6867 { "File1_a.wav", "Audio file", 123000, -1,-1 }, // 4
6868 { "File1_b.wav", "Audio file", 456000, -1,-1 }, // 5
6869 { "Image001.png", "Image file", 203128, -1,-1 }, // 6
6870 { "Copy of Image001.png", "Image file", 203256, -1,-1 }, // 7
6871 { "Copy of Image001 (Final2).png","Image file", 203512, -1,-1 }, // 8
6872 };
6873
6874 MyTreeNode::DisplayNode(&nodes[0], nodes);
6875
6876 ImGui::EndTable();
6877 }
6878 ImGui::TreePop();
6879 }
6880
6881 if (open_action != -1)
6882 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6883 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Item width");
6884 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Item width"))
6885 {
6886 HelpMarker(
6887 "Showcase using PushItemWidth() and how it is preserved on a per-column basis.\n\n"
6888 "Note that on auto-resizing non-resizable fixed columns, querying the content width for "
6889 "e.g. right-alignment doesn't make sense.");
6890 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_item_width", 3, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
6891 {
6892 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("small");
6893 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("half");
6894 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("right-align");
6895 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
6896
6897 for (int row = 0; row < 3; row++)
6898 {
6899 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6900 if (row == 0)
6901 {
6902 // Setup ItemWidth once (instead of setting up every time, which is also possible but less efficient)
6903 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
6904 ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 3.0f); // Small
6905 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);
6906 ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f);
6907 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2);
6908 ImGui::PushItemWidth(-FLT_MIN); // Right-aligned
6909 }
6910
6911 // Draw our contents
6912 static float dummy_f = 0.0f;
6913 ImGui::PushID(row);
6914 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
6915 ImGui::SliderFloat("float0", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
6916 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1);
6917 ImGui::SliderFloat("float1", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
6918 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2);
6919 ImGui::SliderFloat("##float2", &dummy_f, 0.0f, 1.0f); // No visible label since right-aligned
6920 ImGui::PopID();
6921 }
6922 ImGui::EndTable();
6923 }
6924 ImGui::TreePop();
6925 }
6926
6927 // Demonstrate using TableHeader() calls instead of TableHeadersRow()
6928 if (open_action != -1)
6929 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6930 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Custom headers");
6931 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Custom headers"))
6932 {
6933 const int COLUMNS_COUNT = 3;
6934 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_custom_headers", COLUMNS_COUNT, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable))
6935 {
6936 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Apricot");
6937 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Banana");
6938 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Cherry");
6939
6940 // Dummy entire-column selection storage
6941 // FIXME: It would be nice to actually demonstrate full-featured selection using those checkbox.
6942 static bool column_selected[3] = {};
6943
6944 // Instead of calling TableHeadersRow() we'll submit custom headers ourselves.
6945 // (A different approach is also possible:
6946 // - Specify ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel in some TableSetupColumn() call.
6947 // - Call TableHeadersRow() normally. This will submit TableHeader() with no name.
6948 // - Then call TableSetColumnIndex() to position yourself in the column and submit your stuff e.g. Checkbox().)
6949 ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers);
6950 for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)
6951 {
6952 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6953 const char* column_name = ImGui::TableGetColumnName(column); // Retrieve name passed to TableSetupColumn()
6954 ImGui::PushID(column);
6955 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
6956 ImGui::Checkbox("##checkall", &column_selected[column]);
6957 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
6958 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
6959 ImGui::TableHeader(column_name);
6960 ImGui::PopID();
6961 }
6962
6963 // Submit table contents
6964 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
6965 {
6966 ImGui::TableNextRow();
6967 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
6968 {
6969 char buf[32];
6970 sprintf(buf, "Cell %d,%d", column, row);
6971 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
6972 ImGui::Selectable(buf, column_selected[column]);
6973 }
6974 }
6975 ImGui::EndTable();
6976 }
6977 ImGui::TreePop();
6978 }
6979
6980 // Demonstrate using ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader flag to create angled headers
6981 if (open_action != -1)
6982 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
6983 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Angled headers");
6984 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Angled headers"))
6985 {
6986 const char* column_names[] = { "Track", "cabasa", "ride", "smash", "tom-hi", "tom-mid", "tom-low", "hihat-o", "hihat-c", "snare-s", "snare-c", "clap", "rim", "kick" };
6987 const int columns_count = IM_ARRAYSIZE(column_names);
6988 const int rows_count = 12;
6989
6990 static ImGuiTableFlags table_flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn;
6991 static ImGuiTableColumnFlags column_flags = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed;
6992 static bool bools[columns_count * rows_count] = {}; // Dummy storage selection storage
6993 static int frozen_cols = 1;
6994 static int frozen_rows = 2;
6995 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_ScrollX", &table_flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
6996 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_ScrollY", &table_flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
6997 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_Resizable", &table_flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
6998 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_Sortable", &table_flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable);
6999 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_NoBordersInBody", &table_flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody);
7000 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("_HighlightHoveredColumn", &table_flags, ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn);
7001 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
7002 ImGui::SliderInt("Frozen columns", &frozen_cols, 0, 2);
7003 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
7004 ImGui::SliderInt("Frozen rows", &frozen_rows, 0, 2);
7005 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("Disable header contributing to column width", &column_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth);
7006
7007 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Style settings"))
7008 {
7009 ImGui::SameLine();
7010 HelpMarker("Giving access to some ImGuiStyle value in this demo for convenience.");
7011 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
7012 ImGui::SliderAngle("style.TableAngledHeadersAngle", &ImGui::GetStyle().TableAngledHeadersAngle, -50.0f, +50.0f);
7013 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
7014 ImGui::SliderFloat2("style.TableAngledHeadersTextAlign", (float*)&ImGui::GetStyle().TableAngledHeadersTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
7015 ImGui::TreePop();
7016 }
7017
7018 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_angled_headers", columns_count, table_flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 12)))
7019 {
7020 ImGui::TableSetupColumn(column_names[0], ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoReorder);
7021 for (int n = 1; n < columns_count; n++)
7022 ImGui::TableSetupColumn(column_names[n], column_flags);
7023 ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(frozen_cols, frozen_rows);
7024
7025 ImGui::TableAngledHeadersRow(); // Draw angled headers for all columns with the ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader flag.
7026 ImGui::TableHeadersRow(); // Draw remaining headers and allow access to context-menu and other functions.
7027 for (int row = 0; row < rows_count; row++)
7028 {
7029 ImGui::PushID(row);
7030 ImGui::TableNextRow();
7031 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
7032 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
7033 ImGui::Text("Track %d", row);
7034 for (int column = 1; column < columns_count; column++)
7035 if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column))
7036 {
7037 ImGui::PushID(column);
7038 ImGui::Checkbox("", &bools[row * columns_count + column]);
7039 ImGui::PopID();
7040 }
7041 ImGui::PopID();
7042 }
7043 ImGui::EndTable();
7044 }
7045 ImGui::TreePop();
7046 }
7047
7048 // Demonstrate creating custom context menus inside columns,
7049 // while playing it nice with context menus provided by TableHeadersRow()/TableHeader()
7050 if (open_action != -1)
7051 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
7052 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Context menus");
7053 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))
7054 {
7055 HelpMarker(
7056 "By default, right-clicking over a TableHeadersRow()/TableHeader() line will open the default context-menu.\n"
7057 "Using ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody we also allow right-clicking over columns body.");
7058 static ImGuiTableFlags flags1 = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
7059
7060 PushStyleCompact();
7061 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody", &flags1, ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody);
7062 PopStyleCompact();
7063
7064 // Context Menus: first example
7065 // [1.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
7066 // [1.2] Right-click in columns also open the default table context menu (if ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody is set)
7067 const int COLUMNS_COUNT = 3;
7068 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_context_menu", COLUMNS_COUNT, flags1))
7069 {
7070 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
7071 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
7072 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
7073
7074 // [1.1]] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
7075 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
7076
7077 // Submit dummy contents
7078 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
7079 {
7080 ImGui::TableNextRow();
7081 for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)
7082 {
7083 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
7084 ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
7085 }
7086 }
7087 ImGui::EndTable();
7088 }
7089
7090 // Context Menus: second example
7091 // [2.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
7092 // [2.2] Right-click on the ".." to open a custom popup
7093 // [2.3] Right-click in columns to open another custom popup
7094 HelpMarker(
7095 "Demonstrate mixing table context menu (over header), item context button (over button) "
7096 "and custom per-colunm context menu (over column body).");
7097 ImGuiTableFlags flags2 = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders;
7098 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_context_menu_2", COLUMNS_COUNT, flags2))
7099 {
7100 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
7101 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
7102 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
7103
7104 // [2.1] Right-click on the TableHeadersRow() line to open the default table context menu.
7105 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
7106 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
7107 {
7108 ImGui::TableNextRow();
7109 for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT; column++)
7110 {
7111 // Submit dummy contents
7112 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
7113 ImGui::Text("Cell %d,%d", column, row);
7114 ImGui::SameLine();
7115
7116 // [2.2] Right-click on the ".." to open a custom popup
7117 ImGui::PushID(row * COLUMNS_COUNT + column);
7118 ImGui::SmallButton("..");
7119 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
7120 {
7121 ImGui::Text("This is the popup for Button(\"..\") in Cell %d,%d", column, row);
7122 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
7123 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
7124 ImGui::EndPopup();
7125 }
7126 ImGui::PopID();
7127 }
7128 }
7129
7130 // [2.3] Right-click anywhere in columns to open another custom popup
7131 // (instead of testing for !IsAnyItemHovered() we could also call OpenPopup() with ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup
7132 // to manage popup priority as the popups triggers, here "are we hovering a column" are overlapping)
7133 int hovered_column = -1;
7134 for (int column = 0; column < COLUMNS_COUNT + 1; column++)
7135 {
7136 ImGui::PushID(column);
7137 if (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(column) & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)
7138 hovered_column = column;
7139 if (hovered_column == column && !ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered() && ImGui::IsMouseReleased(1))
7140 ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup");
7141 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup"))
7142 {
7143 if (column == COLUMNS_COUNT)
7144 ImGui::Text("This is a custom popup for unused space after the last column.");
7145 else
7146 ImGui::Text("This is a custom popup for Column %d", column);
7147 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
7148 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
7149 ImGui::EndPopup();
7150 }
7151 ImGui::PopID();
7152 }
7153
7154 ImGui::EndTable();
7155 ImGui::Text("Hovered column: %d", hovered_column);
7156 }
7157 ImGui::TreePop();
7158 }
7159
7160 // Demonstrate creating multiple tables with the same ID
7161 if (open_action != -1)
7162 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
7163 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Synced instances");
7164 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Synced instances"))
7165 {
7166 HelpMarker("Multiple tables with the same identifier will share their settings, width, visibility, order etc.");
7167
7168 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings;
7169 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
7170 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
7171 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit);
7172 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn);
7173 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
7174 {
7175 char buf[32];
7176 sprintf(buf, "Synced Table %d", n);
7177 bool open = ImGui::CollapsingHeader(buf, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen);
7178 if (open && ImGui::BeginTable("Table", 3, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 5)))
7179 {
7180 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
7181 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
7182 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
7183 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
7184 const int cell_count = (n == 1) ? 27 : 9; // Make second table have a scrollbar to verify that additional decoration is not affecting column positions.
7185 for (int cell = 0; cell < cell_count; cell++)
7186 {
7187 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
7188 ImGui::Text("this cell %d", cell);
7189 }
7190 ImGui::EndTable();
7191 }
7192 }
7193 ImGui::TreePop();
7194 }
7195
7196 // Demonstrate using Sorting facilities
7197 // This is a simplified version of the "Advanced" example, where we mostly focus on the code necessary to handle sorting.
7198 // Note that the "Advanced" example also showcase manually triggering a sort (e.g. if item quantities have been modified)
7199 static const char* template_items_names[] =
7200 {
7201 "Banana", "Apple", "Cherry", "Watermelon", "Grapefruit", "Strawberry", "Mango",
7202 "Kiwi", "Orange", "Pineapple", "Blueberry", "Plum", "Coconut", "Pear", "Apricot"
7203 };
7204 if (open_action != -1)
7205 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
7206 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Sorting");
7207 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Sorting"))
7208 {
7209 // Create item list
7210 static ImVector<MyItem> items;
7211 if (items.Size == 0)
7212 {
7213 items.resize(50, MyItem());
7214 for (int n = 0; n < items.Size; n++)
7215 {
7216 const int template_n = n % IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names);
7217 MyItem& item = items[n];
7218 item.ID = n;
7219 item.Name = template_items_names[template_n];
7220 item.Quantity = (n * n - n) % 20; // Assign default quantities
7221 }
7222 }
7223
7224 // Options
7225 static ImGuiTableFlags flags =
7226 ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti
7227 | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody
7228 | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY;
7229 PushStyleCompact();
7230 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti);
7231 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).");
7232 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate);
7233 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).");
7234 PopStyleCompact();
7235
7236 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_sorting", 4, flags, ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 15), 0.0f))
7237 {
7238 // Declare columns
7239 // We use the "user_id" parameter of TableSetupColumn() to specify a user id that will be stored in the sort specifications.
7240 // This is so our sort function can identify a column given our own identifier. We could also identify them based on their index!
7241 // Demonstrate using a mixture of flags among available sort-related flags:
7242 // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort
7243 // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending
7244 // - ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending / ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending
7245 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("ID", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_ID);
7246 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Name);
7247 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Action", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Action);
7248 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Quantity", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Quantity);
7249 ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(0, 1); // Make row always visible
7250 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
7251
7252 // Sort our data if sort specs have been changed!
7253 if (ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sort_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs())
7254 if (sort_specs->SpecsDirty)
7255 {
7256 MyItem::SortWithSortSpecs(sort_specs, items.Data, items.Size);
7257 sort_specs->SpecsDirty = false;
7258 }
7259
7260 // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
7261 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
7262 clipper.Begin(items.Size);
7263 while (clipper.Step())
7264 for (int row_n = clipper.DisplayStart; row_n < clipper.DisplayEnd; row_n++)
7265 {
7266 // Display a data item
7267 MyItem* item = &items[row_n];
7268 ImGui::PushID(item->ID);
7269 ImGui::TableNextRow();
7270 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
7271 ImGui::Text("%04d", item->ID);
7272 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
7273 ImGui::TextUnformatted(item->Name);
7274 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
7275 ImGui::SmallButton("None");
7276 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
7277 ImGui::Text("%d", item->Quantity);
7278 ImGui::PopID();
7279 }
7280 ImGui::EndTable();
7281 }
7282 ImGui::TreePop();
7283 }
7284
7285 // In this example we'll expose most table flags and settings.
7286 // For specific flags and settings refer to the corresponding section for more detailed explanation.
7287 // This section is mostly useful to experiment with combining certain flags or settings with each others.
7288 //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once); // [DEBUG]
7289 if (open_action != -1)
7290 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
7291 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Advanced");
7292 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced"))
7293 {
7294 static ImGuiTableFlags flags =
7295 ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable
7296 | ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti
7297 | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody
7298 | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY
7299 | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit;
7300 static ImGuiTableColumnFlags columns_base_flags = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None;
7301
7302 enum ContentsType { CT_Text, CT_Button, CT_SmallButton, CT_FillButton, CT_Selectable, CT_SelectableSpanRow };
7303 static int contents_type = CT_SelectableSpanRow;
7304 const char* contents_type_names[] = { "Text", "Button", "SmallButton", "FillButton", "Selectable", "Selectable (span row)" };
7305 static int freeze_cols = 1;
7306 static int freeze_rows = 1;
7307 static int items_count = IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names) * 2;
7308 static ImVec2 outer_size_value = ImVec2(0.0f, TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT * 12);
7309 static float row_min_height = 0.0f; // Auto
7310 static float inner_width_with_scroll = 0.0f; // Auto-extend
7311 static bool outer_size_enabled = true;
7312 static bool show_headers = true;
7313 static bool show_wrapped_text = false;
7314 //static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
7315 //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once); // FIXME-TABLE: Enabling this results in initial clipped first pass on table which tend to affect column sizing
7316 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Options"))
7317 {
7318 // Make the UI compact because there are so many fields
7319 PushStyleCompact();
7320 ImGui::PushItemWidth(TEXT_BASE_WIDTH * 28.0f);
7321
7322 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Features:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7323 {
7324 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
7325 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable);
7326 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable);
7327 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable);
7328 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings);
7329 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody);
7330 ImGui::TreePop();
7331 }
7332
7333 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Decorations:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7334 {
7335 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
7336 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
7337 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
7338 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
7339 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
7340 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH);
7341 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH);
7342 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appear in Headers");
7343 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appear in Headers)");
7344 ImGui::TreePop();
7345 }
7346
7347 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Sizing:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7348 {
7349 EditTableSizingFlags(&flags);
7350 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("In the Advanced demo we override the policy of each column so those table-wide settings have less effect that typical.");
7351 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX);
7352 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value.\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.");
7353 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY);
7354 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit).\n\nOnly available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.");
7355 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible);
7356 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Only available if ScrollX is disabled.");
7357 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths);
7358 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.");
7359 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip);
7360 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns (reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns). Generally incompatible with ScrollFreeze options.");
7361 ImGui::TreePop();
7362 }
7363
7364 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Padding:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7365 {
7366 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX);
7367 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);
7368 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX);
7369 ImGui::TreePop();
7370 }
7371
7372 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Scrolling:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7373 {
7374 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX);
7375 ImGui::SameLine();
7376 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
7377 ImGui::DragInt("freeze_cols", &freeze_cols, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
7378 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY);
7379 ImGui::SameLine();
7380 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
7381 ImGui::DragInt("freeze_rows", &freeze_rows, 0.2f, 0, 9, NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput);
7382 ImGui::TreePop();
7383 }
7384
7385 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Sorting:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7386 {
7387 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti);
7388 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).");
7389 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate);
7390 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When sorting is enabled: allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).");
7391 ImGui::TreePop();
7392 }
7393
7394 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Headers:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7395 {
7396 ImGui::Checkbox("show_headers", &show_headers);
7397 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn);
7398 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader", &columns_base_flags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader);
7399 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Enable AngledHeader on all columns. Best enabled on selected narrow columns (see \"Angled headers\" section of the demo).");
7400 ImGui::TreePop();
7401 }
7402
7403 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Other:", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen))
7404 {
7405 ImGui::Checkbox("show_wrapped_text", &show_wrapped_text);
7406
7407 ImGui::DragFloat2("##OuterSize", &outer_size_value.x);
7408 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
7409 ImGui::Checkbox("outer_size", &outer_size_enabled);
7410 ImGui::SameLine();
7411 HelpMarker("If scrolling is disabled (ScrollX and ScrollY not set):\n"
7412 "- The table is output directly in the parent window.\n"
7413 "- OuterSize.x < 0.0f will right-align the table.\n"
7414 "- OuterSize.x = 0.0f will narrow fit the table unless there are any Stretch columns.\n"
7415 "- OuterSize.y then becomes the minimum size for the table, which will extend vertically if there are more rows (unless NoHostExtendY is set).");
7416
7417 // From a user point of view we will tend to use 'inner_width' differently depending on whether our table is embedding scrolling.
7418 // To facilitate toying with this demo we will actually pass 0.0f to the BeginTable() when ScrollX is disabled.
7419 ImGui::DragFloat("inner_width (when ScrollX active)", &inner_width_with_scroll, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX);
7420
7421 ImGui::DragFloat("row_min_height", &row_min_height, 1.0f, 0.0f, FLT_MAX);
7422 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Specify height of the Selectable item.");
7423
7424 ImGui::DragInt("items_count", &items_count, 0.1f, 0, 9999);
7425 ImGui::Combo("items_type (first column)", &contents_type, contents_type_names, IM_ARRAYSIZE(contents_type_names));
7426 //filter.Draw("filter");
7427 ImGui::TreePop();
7428 }
7429
7430 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
7431 PopStyleCompact();
7432 ImGui::Spacing();
7433 ImGui::TreePop();
7434 }
7435
7436 // Update item list if we changed the number of items
7437 static ImVector<MyItem> items;
7438 static ImVector<int> selection;
7439 static bool items_need_sort = false;
7440 if (items.Size != items_count)
7441 {
7442 items.resize(items_count, MyItem());
7443 for (int n = 0; n < items_count; n++)
7444 {
7445 const int template_n = n % IM_ARRAYSIZE(template_items_names);
7446 MyItem& item = items[n];
7447 item.ID = n;
7448 item.Name = template_items_names[template_n];
7449 item.Quantity = (template_n == 3) ? 10 : (template_n == 4) ? 20 : 0; // Assign default quantities
7450 }
7451 }
7452
7453 const ImDrawList* parent_draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
7454 const int parent_draw_list_draw_cmd_count = parent_draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;
7455 ImVec2 table_scroll_cur, table_scroll_max; // For debug display
7456 const ImDrawList* table_draw_list = NULL; // "
7457
7458 // Submit table
7459 const float inner_width_to_use = (flags & ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX) ? inner_width_with_scroll : 0.0f;
7460 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table_advanced", 6, flags, outer_size_enabled ? outer_size_value : ImVec2(0, 0), inner_width_to_use))
7461 {
7462 // Declare columns
7463 // We use the "user_id" parameter of TableSetupColumn() to specify a user id that will be stored in the sort specifications.
7464 // This is so our sort function can identify a column given our own identifier. We could also identify them based on their index!
7465 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("ID", columns_base_flags | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_ID);
7466 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Name", columns_base_flags | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Name);
7467 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Action", columns_base_flags | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Action);
7468 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Quantity", columns_base_flags | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending, 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Quantity);
7469 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Description", columns_base_flags | ((flags & ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX) ? 0 : ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch), 0.0f, MyItemColumnID_Description);
7470 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Hidden", columns_base_flags | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort);
7471 ImGui::TableSetupScrollFreeze(freeze_cols, freeze_rows);
7472
7473 // Sort our data if sort specs have been changed!
7474 ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sort_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs();
7475 if (sort_specs && sort_specs->SpecsDirty)
7476 items_need_sort = true;
7477 if (sort_specs && items_need_sort && items.Size > 1)
7478 {
7479 MyItem::SortWithSortSpecs(sort_specs, items.Data, items.Size);
7480 sort_specs->SpecsDirty = false;
7481 }
7482 items_need_sort = false;
7483
7484 // Take note of whether we are currently sorting based on the Quantity field,
7485 // we will use this to trigger sorting when we know the data of this column has been modified.
7486 const bool sorts_specs_using_quantity = (ImGui::TableGetColumnFlags(3) & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted) != 0;
7487
7488 // Show headers
7489 if (show_headers && (columns_base_flags & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader) != 0)
7490 ImGui::TableAngledHeadersRow();
7491 if (show_headers)
7492 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
7493
7494 // Show data
7495 // FIXME-TABLE FIXME-NAV: How we can get decent up/down even though we have the buttons here?
7496#if 1
7497 // Demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
7498 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
7499 clipper.Begin(items.Size);
7500 while (clipper.Step())
7501 {
7502 for (int row_n = clipper.DisplayStart; row_n < clipper.DisplayEnd; row_n++)
7503#else
7504 // Without clipper
7505 {
7506 for (int row_n = 0; row_n < items.Size; row_n++)
7507#endif
7508 {
7509 MyItem* item = &items[row_n];
7510 //if (!filter.PassFilter(item->Name))
7511 // continue;
7512
7513 const bool item_is_selected = selection.contains(item->ID);
7514 ImGui::PushID(item->ID);
7515 ImGui::TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags_None, row_min_height);
7516
7517 // For the demo purpose we can select among different type of items submitted in the first column
7518 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(0);
7519 char label[32];
7520 sprintf(label, "%04d", item->ID);
7521 if (contents_type == CT_Text)
7522 ImGui::TextUnformatted(label);
7523 else if (contents_type == CT_Button)
7524 ImGui::Button(label);
7525 else if (contents_type == CT_SmallButton)
7526 ImGui::SmallButton(label);
7527 else if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)
7528 ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
7529 else if (contents_type == CT_Selectable || contents_type == CT_SelectableSpanRow)
7530 {
7531 ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = (contents_type == CT_SelectableSpanRow) ? ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns | ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap : ImGuiSelectableFlags_None;
7532 if (ImGui::Selectable(label, item_is_selected, selectable_flags, ImVec2(0, row_min_height)))
7533 {
7534 if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl)
7535 {
7536 if (item_is_selected)
7537 selection.find_erase_unsorted(item->ID);
7538 else
7539 selection.push_back(item->ID);
7540 }
7541 else
7542 {
7543 selection.clear();
7544 selection.push_back(item->ID);
7545 }
7546 }
7547 }
7548
7549 if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(1))
7550 ImGui::TextUnformatted(item->Name);
7551
7552 // Here we demonstrate marking our data set as needing to be sorted again if we modified a quantity,
7553 // and we are currently sorting on the column showing the Quantity.
7554 // To avoid triggering a sort while holding the button, we only trigger it when the button has been released.
7555 // You will probably need some extra logic if you want to automatically sort when a specific entry changes.
7556 if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(2))
7557 {
7558 if (ImGui::SmallButton("Chop")) { item->Quantity += 1; }
7559 if (sorts_specs_using_quantity && ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()) { items_need_sort = true; }
7560 ImGui::SameLine();
7561 if (ImGui::SmallButton("Eat")) { item->Quantity -= 1; }
7562 if (sorts_specs_using_quantity && ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()) { items_need_sort = true; }
7563 }
7564
7565 if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(3))
7566 ImGui::Text("%d", item->Quantity);
7567
7568 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(4);
7569 if (show_wrapped_text)
7570 ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet");
7571 else
7572 ImGui::Text("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet");
7573
7574 if (ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(5))
7575 ImGui::Text("1234");
7576
7577 ImGui::PopID();
7578 }
7579 }
7580
7581 // Store some info to display debug details below
7582 table_scroll_cur = ImVec2(ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollY());
7583 table_scroll_max = ImVec2(ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());
7584 table_draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
7585 ImGui::EndTable();
7586 }
7587 static bool show_debug_details = false;
7588 ImGui::Checkbox("Debug details", &show_debug_details);
7589 if (show_debug_details && table_draw_list)
7590 {
7591 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f);
7592 const int table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count = table_draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;
7593 if (table_draw_list == parent_draw_list)
7594 ImGui::Text(": DrawCmd: +%d (in same window)",
7595 table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count - parent_draw_list_draw_cmd_count);
7596 else
7597 ImGui::Text(": DrawCmd: +%d (in child window), Scroll: (%.f/%.f) (%.f/%.f)",
7598 table_draw_list_draw_cmd_count - 1, table_scroll_cur.x, table_scroll_max.x, table_scroll_cur.y, table_scroll_max.y);
7599 }
7600 ImGui::TreePop();
7601 }
7602
7603 ImGui::PopID();
7604
7605 DemoWindowColumns();
7606
7607 if (disable_indent)
7608 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
7609}
7610
7611// Demonstrate old/legacy Columns API!
7612// [2020: Columns are under-featured and not maintained. Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!]
7613static void DemoWindowColumns()
7614{
7615 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)");
7616 bool open = ImGui::TreeNode("Legacy Columns API");
7617 ImGui::SameLine();
7618 HelpMarker("Columns() is an old API! Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!");
7619 if (!open)
7620 return;
7621
7622 // Basic columns
7623 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Basic");
7624 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
7625 {
7626 ImGui::Text("Without border:");
7627 ImGui::Columns(3, "mycolumns3", false); // 3-ways, no border
7628 ImGui::Separator();
7629 for (int n = 0; n < 14; n++)
7630 {
7631 char label[32];
7632 sprintf(label, "Item %d", n);
7633 if (ImGui::Selectable(label)) {}
7634 //if (ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN,0.0f))) {}
7635 ImGui::NextColumn();
7636 }
7637 ImGui::Columns(1);
7638 ImGui::Separator();
7639
7640 ImGui::Text("With border:");
7641 ImGui::Columns(4, "mycolumns"); // 4-ways, with border
7642 ImGui::Separator();
7643 ImGui::Text("ID"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7644 ImGui::Text("Name"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7645 ImGui::Text("Path"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7646 ImGui::Text("Hovered"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7647 ImGui::Separator();
7648 const char* names[3] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
7649 const char* paths[3] = { "/path/one", "/path/two", "/path/three" };
7650 static int selected = -1;
7651 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
7652 {
7653 char label[32];
7654 sprintf(label, "%04d", i);
7655 if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns))
7656 selected = i;
7657 bool hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();
7658 ImGui::NextColumn();
7659 ImGui::Text(names[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
7660 ImGui::Text(paths[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
7661 ImGui::Text("%d", hovered); ImGui::NextColumn();
7662 }
7663 ImGui::Columns(1);
7664 ImGui::Separator();
7665 ImGui::TreePop();
7666 }
7667
7668 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Borders");
7669 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders"))
7670 {
7671 // NB: Future columns API should allow automatic horizontal borders.
7672 static bool h_borders = true;
7673 static bool v_borders = true;
7674 static int columns_count = 4;
7675 const int lines_count = 3;
7676 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
7677 ImGui::DragInt("##columns_count", &columns_count, 0.1f, 2, 10, "%d columns");
7678 if (columns_count < 2)
7679 columns_count = 2;
7680 ImGui::SameLine();
7681 ImGui::Checkbox("horizontal", &h_borders);
7682 ImGui::SameLine();
7683 ImGui::Checkbox("vertical", &v_borders);
7684 ImGui::Columns(columns_count, NULL, v_borders);
7685 for (int i = 0; i < columns_count * lines_count; i++)
7686 {
7687 if (h_borders && ImGui::GetColumnIndex() == 0)
7688 ImGui::Separator();
7689 ImGui::PushID(i);
7690 ImGui::Text("%c%c%c", 'a' + i, 'a' + i, 'a' + i);
7691 ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
7692 ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
7693 ImGui::Text("Offset %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnOffset());
7694 ImGui::Text("Long text that is likely to clip");
7695 ImGui::Button("Button", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
7696 ImGui::PopID();
7697 ImGui::NextColumn();
7698 }
7699 ImGui::Columns(1);
7700 if (h_borders)
7701 ImGui::Separator();
7702 ImGui::TreePop();
7703 }
7704
7705 // Create multiple items in a same cell before switching to next column
7706 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Mixed items");
7707 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mixed items"))
7708 {
7709 ImGui::Columns(3, "mixed");
7710 ImGui::Separator();
7711
7712 ImGui::Text("Hello");
7713 ImGui::Button("Banana");
7714 ImGui::NextColumn();
7715
7716 ImGui::Text("ImGui");
7717 ImGui::Button("Apple");
7718 static float foo = 1.0f;
7719 ImGui::InputFloat("red", &foo, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");
7720 ImGui::Text("An extra line here.");
7721 ImGui::NextColumn();
7722
7723 ImGui::Text("Sailor");
7724 ImGui::Button("Corniflower");
7725 static float bar = 1.0f;
7726 ImGui::InputFloat("blue", &bar, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");
7727 ImGui::NextColumn();
7728
7729 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category A")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();
7730 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category B")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();
7731 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category C")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();
7732 ImGui::Columns(1);
7733 ImGui::Separator();
7734 ImGui::TreePop();
7735 }
7736
7737 // Word wrapping
7738 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Word-wrapping");
7739 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Word-wrapping"))
7740 {
7741 ImGui::Columns(2, "word-wrapping");
7742 ImGui::Separator();
7743 ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");
7744 ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Left");
7745 ImGui::NextColumn();
7746 ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");
7747 ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Right");
7748 ImGui::Columns(1);
7749 ImGui::Separator();
7750 ImGui::TreePop();
7751 }
7752
7753 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Horizontal Scrolling");
7754 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal Scrolling"))
7755 {
7756 ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(1500.0f, 0.0f));
7757 ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20.0f);
7758 ImGui::BeginChild("##ScrollingRegion", child_size, ImGuiChildFlags_None, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
7759 ImGui::Columns(10);
7760
7761 // Also demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
7762 int ITEMS_COUNT = 2000;
7763 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
7764 clipper.Begin(ITEMS_COUNT);
7765 while (clipper.Step())
7766 {
7767 for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
7768 for (int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
7769 {
7770 ImGui::Text("Line %d Column %d...", i, j);
7771 ImGui::NextColumn();
7772 }
7773 }
7774 ImGui::Columns(1);
7775 ImGui::EndChild();
7776 ImGui::TreePop();
7777 }
7778
7779 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Tree");
7780 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree"))
7781 {
7782 ImGui::Columns(2, "tree", true);
7783 for (int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
7784 {
7785 bool open1 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)x, "Node%d", x);
7786 ImGui::NextColumn();
7787 ImGui::Text("Node contents");
7788 ImGui::NextColumn();
7789 if (open1)
7790 {
7791 for (int y = 0; y < 3; y++)
7792 {
7793 bool open2 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)y, "Node%d.%d", x, y);
7794 ImGui::NextColumn();
7795 ImGui::Text("Node contents");
7796 if (open2)
7797 {
7798 ImGui::Text("Even more contents");
7799 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree in column"))
7800 {
7801 ImGui::Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");
7802 ImGui::TreePop();
7803 }
7804 }
7805 ImGui::NextColumn();
7806 if (open2)
7807 ImGui::TreePop();
7808 }
7809 ImGui::TreePop();
7810 }
7811 }
7812 ImGui::Columns(1);
7813 ImGui::TreePop();
7814 }
7815
7816 ImGui::TreePop();
7817}
7818
7819//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7820// [SECTION] DemoWindowInputs()
7821//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7822
7823static void DemoWindowInputs()
7824{
7825 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus");
7826 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Inputs & Focus"))
7827 {
7828 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
7829
7830 // Display inputs submitted to ImGuiIO
7831 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Inputs");
7832 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
7833 bool inputs_opened = ImGui::TreeNode("Inputs");
7834 ImGui::SameLine();
7835 HelpMarker(
7836 "This is a simplified view. See more detailed input state:\n"
7837 "- in 'Tools->Metrics/Debugger->Inputs'.\n"
7838 "- in 'Tools->Debug Log->IO'.");
7839 if (inputs_opened)
7840 {
7841 if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
7842 ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: (%g, %g)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
7843 else
7844 ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: <INVALID>");
7845 ImGui::Text("Mouse delta: (%g, %g)", io.MouseDelta.x, io.MouseDelta.y);
7846 ImGui::Text("Mouse down:");
7847 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseDown(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d (%.02f secs)", i, io.MouseDownDuration[i]); }
7848 ImGui::Text("Mouse wheel: %.1f", io.MouseWheel);
7849 ImGui::Text("Mouse clicked count:");
7850 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (io.MouseClickedCount[i] > 0) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d: %d", i, io.MouseClickedCount[i]); }
7851
7852 // We iterate both legacy native range and named ImGuiKey ranges. This is a little unusual/odd but this allows
7853 // displaying the data for old/new backends.
7854 // User code should never have to go through such hoops!
7855 // You can generally iterate between ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN and ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END.
7856 struct funcs { static bool IsLegacyNativeDupe(ImGuiKey) { return false; } };
7857 ImGuiKey start_key = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN;
7858 ImGui::Text("Keys down:"); for (ImGuiKey key = start_key; key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key) || !ImGui::IsKeyDown(key)) continue; ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text((key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN) ? "\"%s\"" : "\"%s\" %d", ImGui::GetKeyName(key), key); }
7859 ImGui::Text("Keys mods: %s%s%s%s", io.KeyCtrl ? "CTRL " : "", io.KeyShift ? "SHIFT " : "", io.KeyAlt ? "ALT " : "", io.KeySuper ? "SUPER " : "");
7860 ImGui::Text("Chars queue:"); for (int i = 0; i < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; i++) { ImWchar c = io.InputQueueCharacters[i]; ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\'%c\' (0x%04X)", (c > ' ' && c <= 255) ? (char)c : '?', c); } // FIXME: We should convert 'c' to UTF-8 here but the functions are not public.
7861
7862 ImGui::TreePop();
7863 }
7864
7865 // Display ImGuiIO output flags
7866 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Outputs");
7867 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
7868 bool outputs_opened = ImGui::TreeNode("Outputs");
7869 ImGui::SameLine();
7870 HelpMarker(
7871 "The value of io.WantCaptureMouse and io.WantCaptureKeyboard are normally set by Dear ImGui "
7872 "to instruct your application of how to route inputs. Typically, when a value is true, it means "
7873 "Dear ImGui wants the corresponding inputs and we expect the underlying application to ignore them.\n\n"
7874 "The most typical case is: when hovering a window, Dear ImGui set io.WantCaptureMouse to true, "
7875 "and underlying application should ignore mouse inputs (in practice there are many and more subtle "
7876 "rules leading to how those flags are set).");
7877 if (outputs_opened)
7878 {
7879 ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouse: %d", io.WantCaptureMouse);
7880 ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose: %d", io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose);
7881 ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureKeyboard: %d", io.WantCaptureKeyboard);
7882 ImGui::Text("io.WantTextInput: %d", io.WantTextInput);
7883 ImGui::Text("io.WantSetMousePos: %d", io.WantSetMousePos);
7884 ImGui::Text("io.NavActive: %d, io.NavVisible: %d", io.NavActive, io.NavVisible);
7885
7886 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Outputs/WantCapture override");
7887 if (ImGui::TreeNode("WantCapture override"))
7888 {
7889 HelpMarker(
7890 "Hovering the colored canvas will override io.WantCaptureXXX fields.\n"
7891 "Notice how normally (when set to none), the value of io.WantCaptureKeyboard would be false when hovering "
7892 "and true when clicking.");
7893 static int capture_override_mouse = -1;
7894 static int capture_override_keyboard = -1;
7895 const char* capture_override_desc[] = { "None", "Set to false", "Set to true" };
7896 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
7897 ImGui::SliderInt("SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse() on hover", &capture_override_mouse, -1, +1, capture_override_desc[capture_override_mouse + 1], ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
7898 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
7899 ImGui::SliderInt("SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard() on hover", &capture_override_keyboard, -1, +1, capture_override_desc[capture_override_keyboard + 1], ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
7900
7901 ImGui::ColorButton("##panel", ImVec4(0.7f, 0.1f, 0.7f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, ImVec2(128.0f, 96.0f)); // Dummy item
7902 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && capture_override_mouse != -1)
7903 ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse(capture_override_mouse == 1);
7904 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && capture_override_keyboard != -1)
7905 ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard(capture_override_keyboard == 1);
7906
7907 ImGui::TreePop();
7908 }
7909 ImGui::TreePop();
7910 }
7911
7912 // Demonstrate using Shortcut() and Routing Policies.
7913 // The general flow is:
7914 // - Code interested in a chord (e.g. "Ctrl+A") declares their intent.
7915 // - Multiple locations may be interested in same chord! Routing helps find a winner.
7916 // - Every frame, we resolve all claims and assign one owner if the modifiers are matching.
7917 // - The lower-level function is 'bool SetShortcutRouting()', returns true when caller got the route.
7918 // - Most of the times, SetShortcutRouting() is not called directly. User mostly calls Shortcut() with routing flags.
7919 // - If you call Shortcut() WITHOUT any routing option, it uses ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused.
7920 // TL;DR: Most uses will simply be:
7921 // - Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_A); // Use ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused policy.
7922 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Shortcuts");
7923 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Shortcuts"))
7924 {
7925 static ImGuiInputFlags route_options = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat;
7926 static ImGuiInputFlags route_type = ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused;
7927 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat);
7928 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive);
7929 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (default)", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused);
7930 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal);
7931 ImGui::Indent();
7932 ImGui::BeginDisabled(route_type != ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal);
7933 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused);
7934 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive);
7935 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused);
7936 ImGui::EndDisabled();
7937 ImGui::Unindent();
7938 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways);
7939 ImGuiInputFlags flags = route_type | route_options; // Merged flags
7940 if (route_type != ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal)
7941 flags &= ~(ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused);
7942
7943 ImGui::SeparatorText("Using SetNextItemShortcut()");
7944 ImGui::Text("Ctrl+S");
7945 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_S, flags | ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
7946 ImGui::Button("Save");
7947 ImGui::Text("Alt+F");
7948 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Alt | ImGuiKey_F, flags | ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
7949 static float f = 0.5f;
7950 ImGui::SliderFloat("Factor", &f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
7951
7952 ImGui::SeparatorText("Using Shortcut()");
7953 const float line_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
7954 const ImGuiKeyChord key_chord = ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_A;
7955
7956 ImGui::Text("Ctrl+A");
7957 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7958
7959 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, ImVec4(1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 0.1f));
7960
7961 ImGui::BeginChild("WindowA", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, line_height * 14), true);
7962 ImGui::Text("Press CTRL+A and see who receives it!");
7963 ImGui::Separator();
7964
7965 // 1: Window polling for CTRL+A
7966 ImGui::Text("(in WindowA)");
7967 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7968
7969 // 2: InputText also polling for CTRL+A: it always uses _RouteFocused internally (gets priority when active)
7970 // (Commented because the owner-aware version of Shortcut() is still in imgui_internal.h)
7971 //char str[16] = "Press CTRL+A";
7972 //ImGui::Spacing();
7973 //ImGui::InputText("InputTextB", str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
7974 //ImGuiID item_id = ImGui::GetItemID();
7975 //ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Internal widgets always use _RouteFocused");
7976 //ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags, item_id) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7977
7978 // 3: Dummy child is not claiming the route: focusing them shouldn't steal route away from WindowA
7979 ImGui::BeginChild("ChildD", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, line_height * 4), true);
7980 ImGui::Text("(in ChildD: not using same Shortcut)");
7981 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d", ImGui::IsWindowFocused());
7982 ImGui::EndChild();
7983
7984 // 4: Child window polling for CTRL+A. It is deeper than WindowA and gets priority when focused.
7985 ImGui::BeginChild("ChildE", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, line_height * 4), true);
7986 ImGui::Text("(in ChildE: using same Shortcut)");
7987 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7988 ImGui::EndChild();
7989
7990 // 5: In a popup
7991 if (ImGui::Button("Open Popup"))
7992 ImGui::OpenPopup("PopupF");
7993 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("PopupF"))
7994 {
7995 ImGui::Text("(in PopupF)");
7996 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7997 // (Commented because the owner-aware version of Shortcut() is still in imgui_internal.h)
7998 //ImGui::InputText("InputTextG", str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
7999 //ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags, ImGui::GetItemID()) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
8000 ImGui::EndPopup();
8001 }
8002 ImGui::EndChild();
8003 ImGui::PopStyleColor();
8004
8005 ImGui::TreePop();
8006 }
8007
8008 // Display mouse cursors
8009 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Mouse Cursors");
8010 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse Cursors"))
8011 {
8012 const char* mouse_cursors_names[] = { "Arrow", "TextInput", "ResizeAll", "ResizeNS", "ResizeEW", "ResizeNESW", "ResizeNWSE", "Hand", "Wait", "Progress", "NotAllowed" };
8013 IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(mouse_cursors_names) == ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT);
8014
8015 ImGuiMouseCursor current = ImGui::GetMouseCursor();
8016 const char* cursor_name = (current >= ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow) && (current < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT) ? mouse_cursors_names[current] : "N/A";
8017 ImGui::Text("Current mouse cursor = %d: %s", current, cursor_name);
8018 ImGui::BeginDisabled(true);
8019 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseCursors", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors);
8020 ImGui::EndDisabled();
8021
8022 ImGui::Text("Hover to see mouse cursors:");
8023 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
8024 "Your application can render a different mouse cursor based on what ImGui::GetMouseCursor() returns. "
8025 "If software cursor rendering (io.MouseDrawCursor) is set ImGui will draw the right cursor for you, "
8026 "otherwise your backend needs to handle it.");
8027 for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT; i++)
8028 {
8029 char label[32];
8030 sprintf(label, "Mouse cursor %d: %s", i, mouse_cursors_names[i]);
8031 ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::Selectable(label, false);
8032 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
8033 ImGui::SetMouseCursor(i);
8034 }
8035 ImGui::TreePop();
8036 }
8037
8038 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Tabbing");
8039 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tabbing"))
8040 {
8041 ImGui::Text("Use TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");
8042 static char buf[32] = "hello";
8043 ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8044 ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8045 ImGui::InputText("3", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8046 ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, true);
8047 ImGui::InputText("4 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8048 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");
8049 ImGui::PopItemFlag();
8050 ImGui::InputText("5", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8051 ImGui::TreePop();
8052 }
8053
8054 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Focus from code");
8055 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Focus from code"))
8056 {
8057 bool focus_1 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 1"); ImGui::SameLine();
8058 bool focus_2 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 2"); ImGui::SameLine();
8059 bool focus_3 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 3");
8060 int has_focus = 0;
8061 static char buf[128] = "click on a button to set focus";
8062
8063 if (focus_1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
8064 ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8065 if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 1;
8066
8067 if (focus_2) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
8068 ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8069 if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 2;
8070
8071 ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, true);
8072 if (focus_3) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
8073 ImGui::InputText("3 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8074 if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 3;
8075 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");
8076 ImGui::PopItemFlag();
8077
8078 if (has_focus)
8079 ImGui::Text("Item with focus: %d", has_focus);
8080 else
8081 ImGui::Text("Item with focus: <none>");
8082
8083 // Use >= 0 parameter to SetKeyboardFocusHere() to focus an upcoming item
8084 static float f3[3] = { 0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f };
8085 int focus_ahead = -1;
8086 if (ImGui::Button("Focus on X")) { focus_ahead = 0; } ImGui::SameLine();
8087 if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Y")) { focus_ahead = 1; } ImGui::SameLine();
8088 if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Z")) { focus_ahead = 2; }
8089 if (focus_ahead != -1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(focus_ahead);
8090 ImGui::SliderFloat3("Float3", &f3[0], 0.0f, 1.0f);
8091
8092 ImGui::TextWrapped("NB: Cursor & selection are preserved when refocusing last used item in code.");
8093 ImGui::TreePop();
8094 }
8095
8096 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Dragging");
8097 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Dragging"))
8098 {
8099 ImGui::TextWrapped("You can use ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0) to query for the dragged amount on any widget.");
8100 for (int button = 0; button < 3; button++)
8101 {
8102 ImGui::Text("IsMouseDragging(%d):", button);
8103 ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button));
8104 ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 0.0f));
8105 ImGui::Text(" w/ large threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 20.0f));
8106 }
8107
8108 ImGui::Button("Drag Me");
8109 if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
8110 ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddLine(io.MouseClickedPos[0], io.MousePos, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Button), 4.0f); // Draw a line between the button and the mouse cursor
8111
8112 // Drag operations gets "unlocked" when the mouse has moved past a certain threshold
8113 // (the default threshold is stored in io.MouseDragThreshold). You can request a lower or higher
8114 // threshold using the second parameter of IsMouseDragging() and GetMouseDragDelta().
8115 ImVec2 value_raw = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0, 0.0f);
8116 ImVec2 value_with_lock_threshold = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0);
8117 ImVec2 mouse_delta = io.MouseDelta;
8118 ImGui::Text("GetMouseDragDelta(0):");
8119 ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_with_lock_threshold.x, value_with_lock_threshold.y);
8120 ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_raw.x, value_raw.y);
8121 ImGui::Text("io.MouseDelta: (%.1f, %.1f)", mouse_delta.x, mouse_delta.y);
8122 ImGui::TreePop();
8123 }
8124 }
8125}
8126
8127//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8128// [SECTION] About Window / ShowAboutWindow()
8129// Access from Dear ImGui Demo -> Tools -> About
8130//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8131
8132void ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(bool* p_open)
8133{
8134 if (!ImGui::Begin("About Dear ImGui", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
8135 {
8136 ImGui::End();
8137 return;
8138 }
8139 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tools/About Dear ImGui");
8140 ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui %s (%d)", IMGUI_VERSION, IMGUI_VERSION_NUM);
8141
8142 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("Homepage", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui");
8143 ImGui::SameLine();
8144 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("FAQ", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md");
8145 ImGui::SameLine();
8146 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("Wiki", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki");
8147 ImGui::SameLine();
8148 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("Extensions", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Useful-Extensions");
8149 ImGui::SameLine();
8150 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("Releases", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/releases");
8151 ImGui::SameLine();
8152 ImGui::TextLinkOpenURL("Funding", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Funding");
8153
8154 ImGui::Separator();
8155 ImGui::Text("(c) 2014-2025 Omar Cornut");
8156 ImGui::Text("Developed by Omar Cornut and all Dear ImGui contributors.");
8157 ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui is licensed under the MIT License, see LICENSE for more information.");
8158 ImGui::Text("If your company uses this, please consider funding the project.");
8159
8160 static bool show_config_info = false;
8161 ImGui::Checkbox("Config/Build Information", &show_config_info);
8162 if (show_config_info)
8163 {
8164 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
8165 ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
8166
8167 bool copy_to_clipboard = ImGui::Button("Copy to clipboard");
8168 ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 18);
8169 ImGui::BeginChild(ImGui::GetID("cfg_infos"), child_size, ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle);
8170 if (copy_to_clipboard)
8171 {
8172 ImGui::LogToClipboard();
8173 ImGui::LogText("```cpp\n"); // Back quotes will make text appears without formatting when pasting on GitHub
8174 }
8175
8176 ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui %s (%d)", IMGUI_VERSION, IMGUI_VERSION_NUM);
8177 ImGui::Separator();
8178 ImGui::Text("sizeof(size_t): %d, sizeof(ImDrawIdx): %d, sizeof(ImDrawVert): %d", (int)sizeof(size_t), (int)sizeof(ImDrawIdx), (int)sizeof(ImDrawVert));
8179 ImGui::Text("define: __cplusplus=%d", (int)__cplusplus);
8180#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
8181 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS");
8182#endif
8183#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS
8184 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS");
8185#endif
8186#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS
8187 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS");
8188#endif
8189#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS
8190 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS");
8191#endif
8192#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_SHELL_FUNCTIONS
8193 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_SHELL_FUNCTIONS");
8194#endif
8195#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS
8196 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS");
8197#endif
8198#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS
8199 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS");
8200#endif
8201#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS
8202 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS");
8203#endif
8204#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_FILE_FUNCTIONS
8205 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_FILE_FUNCTIONS");
8206#endif
8207#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_ALLOCATORS
8208 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_ALLOCATORS");
8209#endif
8210#ifdef IMGUI_USE_BGRA_PACKED_COLOR
8211 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_USE_BGRA_PACKED_COLOR");
8212#endif
8213#ifdef _WIN32
8214 ImGui::Text("define: _WIN32");
8215#endif
8216#ifdef _WIN64
8217 ImGui::Text("define: _WIN64");
8218#endif
8219#ifdef __linux__
8220 ImGui::Text("define: __linux__");
8221#endif
8222#ifdef __APPLE__
8223 ImGui::Text("define: __APPLE__");
8224#endif
8225#ifdef _MSC_VER
8226 ImGui::Text("define: _MSC_VER=%d", _MSC_VER);
8227#endif
8228#ifdef _MSVC_LANG
8229 ImGui::Text("define: _MSVC_LANG=%d", (int)_MSVC_LANG);
8230#endif
8231#ifdef __MINGW32__
8232 ImGui::Text("define: __MINGW32__");
8233#endif
8234#ifdef __MINGW64__
8235 ImGui::Text("define: __MINGW64__");
8236#endif
8237#ifdef __GNUC__
8238 ImGui::Text("define: __GNUC__=%d", (int)__GNUC__);
8239#endif
8240#ifdef __clang_version__
8241 ImGui::Text("define: __clang_version__=%s", __clang_version__);
8242#endif
8243#ifdef __EMSCRIPTEN__
8244 ImGui::Text("define: __EMSCRIPTEN__");
8245 ImGui::Text("Emscripten: %d.%d.%d", __EMSCRIPTEN_major__, __EMSCRIPTEN_minor__, __EMSCRIPTEN_tiny__);
8246#endif
8247#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_VIEWPORT
8248 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_HAS_VIEWPORT");
8249#endif
8250#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
8251 ImGui::Text("define: IMGUI_HAS_DOCK");
8252#endif
8253 ImGui::Separator();
8254 ImGui::Text("io.BackendPlatformName: %s", io.BackendPlatformName ? io.BackendPlatformName : "NULL");
8255 ImGui::Text("io.BackendRendererName: %s", io.BackendRendererName ? io.BackendRendererName : "NULL");
8256 ImGui::Text("io.ConfigFlags: 0x%08X", io.ConfigFlags);
8257 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) ImGui::Text(" NavEnableKeyboard");
8258 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) ImGui::Text(" NavEnableGamepad");
8259 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse) ImGui::Text(" NoMouse");
8260 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange) ImGui::Text(" NoMouseCursorChange");
8261 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoKeyboard) ImGui::Text(" NoKeyboard");
8262 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable) ImGui::Text(" DockingEnable");
8263 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) ImGui::Text(" ViewportsEnable");
8264 if (io.MouseDrawCursor) ImGui::Text("io.MouseDrawCursor");
8265 if (io.ConfigDpiScaleFonts) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigDpiScaleFonts");
8266 if (io.ConfigDpiScaleViewports) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigDpiScaleViewports");
8267 if (io.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge");
8268 if (io.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon");
8269 if (io.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration");
8270 if (io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent");
8271 if (io.ConfigDockingNoSplit) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigDockingNoSplit");
8272 if (io.ConfigDockingWithShift) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigDockingWithShift");
8273 if (io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar");
8274 if (io.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload");
8275 if (io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors");
8276 if (io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos");
8277 if (io.ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard");
8278 if (io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink");
8279 if (io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges");
8280 if (io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly");
8281 if (io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer >= 0.0f) ImGui::Text("io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer = %.1f", io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer);
8282 ImGui::Text("io.BackendFlags: 0x%08X", io.BackendFlags);
8283 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) ImGui::Text(" HasGamepad");
8284 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors) ImGui::Text(" HasMouseCursors");
8285 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos) ImGui::Text(" HasSetMousePos");
8286 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports) ImGui::Text(" PlatformHasViewports");
8287 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport)ImGui::Text(" HasMouseHoveredViewport");
8288 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset) ImGui::Text(" RendererHasVtxOffset");
8289 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasTextures) ImGui::Text(" RendererHasTextures");
8290 if (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports) ImGui::Text(" RendererHasViewports");
8291 ImGui::Separator();
8292 ImGui::Text("io.Fonts: %d fonts, Flags: 0x%08X, TexSize: %d,%d", io.Fonts->Fonts.Size, io.Fonts->Flags, io.Fonts->TexData->Width, io.Fonts->TexData->Height);
8293 ImGui::Text("io.Fonts->FontLoaderName: %s", io.Fonts->FontLoaderName ? io.Fonts->FontLoaderName : "NULL");
8294 ImGui::Text("io.DisplaySize: %.2f,%.2f", io.DisplaySize.x, io.DisplaySize.y);
8295 ImGui::Text("io.DisplayFramebufferScale: %.2f,%.2f", io.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, io.DisplayFramebufferScale.y);
8296 ImGui::Separator();
8297 ImGui::Text("style.WindowPadding: %.2f,%.2f", style.WindowPadding.x, style.WindowPadding.y);
8298 ImGui::Text("style.WindowBorderSize: %.2f", style.WindowBorderSize);
8299 ImGui::Text("style.FramePadding: %.2f,%.2f", style.FramePadding.x, style.FramePadding.y);
8300 ImGui::Text("style.FrameRounding: %.2f", style.FrameRounding);
8301 ImGui::Text("style.FrameBorderSize: %.2f", style.FrameBorderSize);
8302 ImGui::Text("style.ItemSpacing: %.2f,%.2f", style.ItemSpacing.x, style.ItemSpacing.y);
8303 ImGui::Text("style.ItemInnerSpacing: %.2f,%.2f", style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, style.ItemInnerSpacing.y);
8304
8305 if (copy_to_clipboard)
8306 {
8307 ImGui::LogText("\n```\n");
8308 ImGui::LogFinish();
8309 }
8310 ImGui::EndChild();
8311 }
8312 ImGui::End();
8313}
8314
8315//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8316// [SECTION] Style Editor / ShowStyleEditor()
8317//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8318// - ShowStyleSelector()
8319// - ShowStyleEditor()
8320//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8321
8322// Demo helper function to select among default colors. See ShowStyleEditor() for more advanced options.
8323// Here we use the simplified Combo() api that packs items into a single literal string.
8324// Useful for quick combo boxes where the choices are known locally.
8325bool ImGui::ShowStyleSelector(const char* label)
8326{
8327 static int style_idx = -1;
8328 if (ImGui::Combo(label, &style_idx, "Dark\0Light\0Classic\0"))
8329 {
8330 switch (style_idx)
8331 {
8332 case 0: ImGui::StyleColorsDark(); break;
