8333 case 1: ImGui::StyleColorsLight(); break;
8334 case 2: ImGui::StyleColorsClassic(); break;
8335 }
8336 return true;
8337 }
8338 return false;
8339}
8340
8341static const char* GetTreeLinesFlagsName(ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
8342{
8343 if (flags == ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone) return "DrawLinesNone";
8344 if (flags == ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull) return "DrawLinesFull";
8345 if (flags == ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes) return "DrawLinesToNodes";
8346 return "";
8347}
8348
8349// We omit the ImGui:: prefix in this function, as we don't expect user to be copy and pasting this code.
8350void ImGui::ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle* ref)
8351{
8352 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tools/Style Editor");
8353 // You can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure to compare to, revert to and save to
8354 // (without a reference style pointer, we will use one compared locally as a reference)
8355 ImGuiStyle& style = GetStyle();
8356 static ImGuiStyle ref_saved_style;
8357
8358 // Default to using internal storage as reference
8359 static bool init = true;
8360 if (init && ref == NULL)
8361 ref_saved_style = style;
8362 init = false;
8363 if (ref == NULL)
8364 ref = &ref_saved_style;
8365
8366 PushItemWidth(GetWindowWidth() * 0.50f);
8367
8368 {
8369 // General
8370 SeparatorText("General");
8371 if ((GetIO().BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasTextures) == 0)
8372 {
8373 BulletText("Warning: Font scaling will NOT be smooth, because\nImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasTextures is not set!");
8374 BulletText("For instructions, see:");
8375 SameLine();
8376 TextLinkOpenURL("docs/BACKENDS.md", "https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/BACKENDS.md");
8377 }
8378
8379 if (ShowStyleSelector("Colors##Selector"))
8380 ref_saved_style = style;
8381 ShowFontSelector("Fonts##Selector");
8382 if (DragFloat("FontSizeBase", &style.FontSizeBase, 0.20f, 5.0f, 100.0f, "%.0f"))
8383 style._NextFrameFontSizeBase = style.FontSizeBase; // FIXME: Temporary hack until we finish remaining work.
8384 SameLine(0.0f, 0.0f); Text(" (out %.2f)", GetFontSize());
8385 DragFloat("FontScaleMain", &style.FontScaleMain, 0.02f, 0.5f, 4.0f);
8386 //BeginDisabled(GetIO().ConfigDpiScaleFonts);
8387 DragFloat("FontScaleDpi", &style.FontScaleDpi, 0.02f, 0.5f, 4.0f);
8388 //SetItemTooltip("When io.ConfigDpiScaleFonts is set, this value is automatically overwritten.");
8389 //EndDisabled();
8390
8391 // Simplified Settings (expose floating-pointer border sizes as boolean representing 0.0f or 1.0f)
8392 if (SliderFloat("FrameRounding", &style.FrameRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f"))
8393 style.GrabRounding = style.FrameRounding; // Make GrabRounding always the same value as FrameRounding
8394 { bool border = (style.WindowBorderSize > 0.0f); if (Checkbox("WindowBorder", &border)) { style.WindowBorderSize = border ? 1.0f : 0.0f; } }
8395 SameLine();
8396 { bool border = (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f); if (Checkbox("FrameBorder", &border)) { style.FrameBorderSize = border ? 1.0f : 0.0f; } }
8397 SameLine();
8398 { bool border = (style.PopupBorderSize > 0.0f); if (Checkbox("PopupBorder", &border)) { style.PopupBorderSize = border ? 1.0f : 0.0f; } }
8399 }
8400
8401 // Save/Revert button
8402 if (Button("Save Ref"))
8403 *ref = ref_saved_style = style;
8404 SameLine();
8405 if (Button("Revert Ref"))
8406 style = *ref;
8407 SameLine();
8408 HelpMarker(
8409 "Save/Revert in local non-persistent storage. Default Colors definition are not affected. "
8410 "Use \"Export\" below to save them somewhere.");
8411
8412 SeparatorText("Details");
8413 if (BeginTabBar("##tabs", ImGuiTabBarFlags_None))
8414 {
8415 if (BeginTabItem("Sizes"))
8416 {
8417 SeparatorText("Main");
8418 SliderFloat2("WindowPadding", (float*)&style.WindowPadding, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8419 SliderFloat2("FramePadding", (float*)&style.FramePadding, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8420 SliderFloat2("ItemSpacing", (float*)&style.ItemSpacing, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8421 SliderFloat2("ItemInnerSpacing", (float*)&style.ItemInnerSpacing, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8422 SliderFloat2("TouchExtraPadding", (float*)&style.TouchExtraPadding, 0.0f, 10.0f, "%.0f");
8423 SliderFloat("IndentSpacing", &style.IndentSpacing, 0.0f, 30.0f, "%.0f");
8424 SliderFloat("ScrollbarSize", &style.ScrollbarSize, 1.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8425 SliderFloat("GrabMinSize", &style.GrabMinSize, 1.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8426
8427 SeparatorText("Borders");
8428 SliderFloat("WindowBorderSize", &style.WindowBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
8429 SliderFloat("ChildBorderSize", &style.ChildBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
8430 SliderFloat("PopupBorderSize", &style.PopupBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
8431 SliderFloat("FrameBorderSize", &style.FrameBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
8432
8433 SeparatorText("Rounding");
8434 SliderFloat("WindowRounding", &style.WindowRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8435 SliderFloat("ChildRounding", &style.ChildRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8436 SliderFloat("FrameRounding", &style.FrameRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8437 SliderFloat("PopupRounding", &style.PopupRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8438 SliderFloat("ScrollbarRounding", &style.ScrollbarRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8439 SliderFloat("GrabRounding", &style.GrabRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8440
8441 SeparatorText("Tabs");
8442 SliderFloat("TabBorderSize", &style.TabBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
8443 SliderFloat("TabBarBorderSize", &style.TabBarBorderSize, 0.0f, 2.0f, "%.0f");
8444 SliderFloat("TabBarOverlineSize", &style.TabBarOverlineSize, 0.0f, 3.0f, "%.0f");
8445 SameLine(); HelpMarker("Overline is only drawn over the selected tab when ImGuiTabBarFlags_DrawSelectedOverline is set.");
8446 DragFloat("TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected", &style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected, 0.1f, -1.0f, 100.0f, (style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected < 0.0f) ? "%.0f (Always)" : "%.0f");
8447 DragFloat("TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected", &style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected, 0.1f, -1.0f, 100.0f, (style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected < 0.0f) ? "%.0f (Always)" : "%.0f");
8448 SliderFloat("TabRounding", &style.TabRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8449
8450 SeparatorText("Tables");
8451 SliderFloat2("CellPadding", (float*)&style.CellPadding, 0.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8452 SliderAngle("TableAngledHeadersAngle", &style.TableAngledHeadersAngle, -50.0f, +50.0f);
8453 SliderFloat2("TableAngledHeadersTextAlign", (float*)&style.TableAngledHeadersTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
8454
8455 SeparatorText("Trees");
8456 bool combo_open = BeginCombo("TreeLinesFlags", GetTreeLinesFlagsName(style.TreeLinesFlags));
8457 SameLine();
8458 HelpMarker("[Experimental] Tree lines may not work in all situations (e.g. using a clipper) and may incurs slight traversal overhead.\n\nImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull is faster than ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNode.");
8459 if (combo_open)
8460 {
8461 const ImGuiTreeNodeFlags options[] = { ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes };
8462 for (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags option : options)
8463 if (Selectable(GetTreeLinesFlagsName(option), style.TreeLinesFlags == option))
8464 style.TreeLinesFlags = option;
8465 EndCombo();
8466 }
8467 SliderFloat("TreeLinesSize", &style.TreeLinesSize, 0.0f, 2.0f, "%.0f");
8468 SliderFloat("TreeLinesRounding", &style.TreeLinesRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8469
8470 SeparatorText("Windows");
8471 SliderFloat2("WindowTitleAlign", (float*)&style.WindowTitleAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
8472 SliderFloat("WindowBorderHoverPadding", &style.WindowBorderHoverPadding, 1.0f, 20.0f, "%.0f");
8473 int window_menu_button_position = style.WindowMenuButtonPosition + 1;
8474 if (Combo("WindowMenuButtonPosition", (int*)&window_menu_button_position, "None\0Left\0Right\0"))
8475 style.WindowMenuButtonPosition = (ImGuiDir)(window_menu_button_position - 1);
8476
8477 SeparatorText("Widgets");
8478 Combo("ColorButtonPosition", (int*)&style.ColorButtonPosition, "Left\0Right\0");
8479 SliderFloat2("ButtonTextAlign", (float*)&style.ButtonTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
8480 SameLine(); HelpMarker("Alignment applies when a button is larger than its text content.");
8481 SliderFloat2("SelectableTextAlign", (float*)&style.SelectableTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
8482 SameLine(); HelpMarker("Alignment applies when a selectable is larger than its text content.");
8483 SliderFloat("SeparatorTextBorderSize", &style.SeparatorTextBorderSize, 0.0f, 10.0f, "%.0f");
8484 SliderFloat2("SeparatorTextAlign", (float*)&style.SeparatorTextAlign, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f");
8485 SliderFloat2("SeparatorTextPadding", (float*)&style.SeparatorTextPadding, 0.0f, 40.0f, "%.0f");
8486 SliderFloat("LogSliderDeadzone", &style.LogSliderDeadzone, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8487 SliderFloat("ImageBorderSize", &style.ImageBorderSize, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.0f");
8488
8489 SeparatorText("Docking");
8490 SliderFloat("DockingSeparatorSize", &style.DockingSeparatorSize, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f");
8491
8492 SeparatorText("Tooltips");
8493 for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)
8494 if (TreeNodeEx(n == 0 ? "HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse" : "HoverFlagsForTooltipNav"))
8495 {
8496 ImGuiHoveredFlags* p = (n == 0) ? &style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse : &style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav;
8497 CheckboxFlags("ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone", p, ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone);
8498 CheckboxFlags("ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort", p, ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort);
8499 CheckboxFlags("ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal", p, ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal);
8500 CheckboxFlags("ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary", p, ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary);
8501 CheckboxFlags("ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay", p, ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay);
8502 TreePop();
8503 }
8504
8505 SeparatorText("Misc");
8506 SliderFloat2("DisplayWindowPadding", (float*)&style.DisplayWindowPadding, 0.0f, 30.0f, "%.0f"); SameLine(); HelpMarker("Apply to regular windows: amount which we enforce to keep visible when moving near edges of your screen.");
8507 SliderFloat2("DisplaySafeAreaPadding", (float*)&style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding, 0.0f, 30.0f, "%.0f"); SameLine(); HelpMarker("Apply to every windows, menus, popups, tooltips: amount where we avoid displaying contents. Adjust if you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV where scaling has not been configured).");
8508
8509 EndTabItem();
8510 }
8511
8512 if (BeginTabItem("Colors"))
8513 {
8514 static int output_dest = 0;
8515 static bool output_only_modified = true;
8516 if (Button("Export"))
8517 {
8518 if (output_dest == 0)
8519 LogToClipboard();
8520 else
8521 LogToTTY();
8522 LogText("ImVec4* colors = GetStyle().Colors;" IM_NEWLINE);
8523 for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiCol_COUNT; i++)
8524 {
8525 const ImVec4& col = style.Colors[i];
8526 const char* name = GetStyleColorName(i);
8527 if (!output_only_modified || memcmp(&col, &ref->Colors[i], sizeof(ImVec4)) != 0)
8528 LogText("colors[ImGuiCol_%s]%*s= ImVec4(%.2ff, %.2ff, %.2ff, %.2ff);" IM_NEWLINE,
8529 name, 23 - (int)strlen(name), "", col.x, col.y, col.z, col.w);
8530 }
8531 LogFinish();
8532 }
8533 SameLine(); SetNextItemWidth(120); Combo("##output_type", &output_dest, "To Clipboard\0To TTY\0");
8534 SameLine(); Checkbox("Only Modified Colors", &output_only_modified);
8535
8536 static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
8537 filter.Draw("Filter colors", GetFontSize() * 16);
8538
8539 static ImGuiColorEditFlags alpha_flags = 0;
8540 if (RadioButton("Opaque", alpha_flags == ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque)) { alpha_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque; } SameLine();
8541 if (RadioButton("Alpha", alpha_flags == ImGuiColorEditFlags_None)) { alpha_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_None; } SameLine();
8542 if (RadioButton("Both", alpha_flags == ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf)) { alpha_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf; } SameLine();
8543 HelpMarker(
8544 "In the color list:\n"
8545 "Left-click on color square to open color picker,\n"
8546 "Right-click to open edit options menu.");
8547
8548 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0.0f, GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 10), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX));
8549 BeginChild("##colors", ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders | ImGuiChildFlags_NavFlattened, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
8550 PushItemWidth(GetFontSize() * -12);
8551 for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiCol_COUNT; i++)
8552 {
8553 const char* name = GetStyleColorName(i);
8554 if (!filter.PassFilter(name))
8555 continue;
8556 PushID(i);
8557#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
8558 if (Button("?"))
8559 DebugFlashStyleColor((ImGuiCol)i);
8560 SetItemTooltip("Flash given color to identify places where it is used.");
8561 SameLine();
8562#endif
8563 ColorEdit4("##color", (float*)&style.Colors[i], ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar | alpha_flags);
8564 if (memcmp(&style.Colors[i], &ref->Colors[i], sizeof(ImVec4)) != 0)
8565 {
8566 // Tips: in a real user application, you may want to merge and use an icon font into the main font,
8567 // so instead of "Save"/"Revert" you'd use icons!
8568 // Read the FAQ and docs/FONTS.md about using icon fonts. It's really easy and super convenient!
8569 SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x); if (Button("Save")) { ref->Colors[i] = style.Colors[i]; }
8570 SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x); if (Button("Revert")) { style.Colors[i] = ref->Colors[i]; }
8571 }
8572 SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
8573 TextUnformatted(name);
8574 PopID();
8575 }
8576 PopItemWidth();
8577 EndChild();
8578
8579 EndTabItem();
8580 }
8581
8582 if (BeginTabItem("Fonts"))
8583 {
8584 ImGuiIO& io = GetIO();
8585 ImFontAtlas* atlas = io.Fonts;
8586 ShowFontAtlas(atlas);
8587
8588 // Post-baking font scaling. Note that this is NOT the nice way of scaling fonts, read below.
8589 // (we enforce hard clamping manually as by default DragFloat/SliderFloat allows CTRL+Click text to get out of bounds).
8590 /*
8591 SeparatorText("Legacy Scaling");
8592 const float MIN_SCALE = 0.3f;
8593 const float MAX_SCALE = 2.0f;
8594 HelpMarker(
8595 "Those are old settings provided for convenience.\n"
8596 "However, the _correct_ way of scaling your UI is currently to reload your font at the designed size, "
8597 "rebuild the font atlas, and call style.ScaleAllSizes() on a reference ImGuiStyle structure.\n"
8598 "Using those settings here will give you poor quality results.");
8599 PushItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 8);
8600 DragFloat("global scale", &io.FontGlobalScale, 0.005f, MIN_SCALE, MAX_SCALE, "%.2f", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp); // Scale everything
8601 //static float window_scale = 1.0f;
8602 //if (DragFloat("window scale", &window_scale, 0.005f, MIN_SCALE, MAX_SCALE, "%.2f", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp)) // Scale only this window
8603 // SetWindowFontScale(window_scale);
8604 PopItemWidth();
8605 */
8606
8607 EndTabItem();
8608 }
8609
8610 if (BeginTabItem("Rendering"))
8611 {
8612 Checkbox("Anti-aliased lines", &style.AntiAliasedLines);
8613 SameLine();
8614 HelpMarker("When disabling anti-aliasing lines, you'll probably want to disable borders in your style as well.");
8615
8616 Checkbox("Anti-aliased lines use texture", &style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex);
8617 SameLine();
8618 HelpMarker("Faster lines using texture data. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (not point/nearest filtering).");
8619
8620 Checkbox("Anti-aliased fill", &style.AntiAliasedFill);
8621 PushItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 8);
8622 DragFloat("Curve Tessellation Tolerance", &style.CurveTessellationTol, 0.02f, 0.10f, 10.0f, "%.2f");
8623 if (style.CurveTessellationTol < 0.10f) style.CurveTessellationTol = 0.10f;
8624
8625 // When editing the "Circle Segment Max Error" value, draw a preview of its effect on auto-tessellated circles.
8626 DragFloat("Circle Tessellation Max Error", &style.CircleTessellationMaxError , 0.005f, 0.10f, 5.0f, "%.2f", ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
8627 const bool show_samples = IsItemActive();
8628 if (show_samples)
8629 SetNextWindowPos(GetCursorScreenPos());
8630 if (show_samples && BeginTooltip())
8631 {
8632 TextUnformatted("(R = radius, N = approx number of segments)");
8633 Spacing();
8634 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetWindowDrawList();
8635 const float min_widget_width = CalcTextSize("R: MMM\nN: MMM").x;
8636 for (int n = 0; n < 8; n++)
8637 {
8638 const float RAD_MIN = 5.0f;
8639 const float RAD_MAX = 70.0f;
8640 const float rad = RAD_MIN + (RAD_MAX - RAD_MIN) * (float)n / (8.0f - 1.0f);
8641
8642 BeginGroup();
8643
8644 // N is not always exact here due to how PathArcTo() function work internally
8645 Text("R: %.f\nN: %d", rad, draw_list->_CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(rad));
8646
8647 const float canvas_width = IM_MAX(min_widget_width, rad * 2.0f);
8648 const float offset_x = floorf(canvas_width * 0.5f);
8649 const float offset_y = floorf(RAD_MAX);
8650
8651 const ImVec2 p1 = GetCursorScreenPos();
8652 draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(p1.x + offset_x, p1.y + offset_y), rad, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
8653 Dummy(ImVec2(canvas_width, RAD_MAX * 2));
8654
8655 /*
8656 const ImVec2 p2 = GetCursorScreenPos();
8657 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(p2.x + offset_x, p2.y + offset_y), rad, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
8658 Dummy(ImVec2(canvas_width, RAD_MAX * 2));
8659 */
8660
8661 EndGroup();
8662 SameLine();
8663 }
8664 EndTooltip();
8665 }
8666 SameLine();
8667 HelpMarker("When drawing circle primitives with \"num_segments == 0\" tessellation will be calculated automatically.");
8668
8669 DragFloat("Global Alpha", &style.Alpha, 0.005f, 0.20f, 1.0f, "%.2f"); // Not exposing zero here so user doesn't "lose" the UI (zero alpha clips all widgets). But application code could have a toggle to switch between zero and non-zero.
8670 DragFloat("Disabled Alpha", &style.DisabledAlpha, 0.005f, 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f"); SameLine(); HelpMarker("Additional alpha multiplier for disabled items (multiply over current value of Alpha).");
8671 PopItemWidth();
8672
8673 EndTabItem();
8674 }
8675
8676 EndTabBar();
8677 }
8678 PopItemWidth();
8679}
8680
8681//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8682// [SECTION] User Guide / ShowUserGuide()
8683//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8684
8685// We omit the ImGui:: prefix in this function, as we don't expect user to be copy and pasting this code.
8686void ImGui::ShowUserGuide()
8687{
8688 ImGuiIO& io = GetIO();
8689 BulletText("Double-click on title bar to collapse window.");
8690 BulletText(
8691 "Click and drag on lower corner to resize window\n"
8692 "(double-click to auto fit window to its contents).");
8693 BulletText("CTRL+Click on a slider or drag box to input value as text.");
8694 BulletText("TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");
8695 BulletText("CTRL+Tab to select a window.");
8696 if (io.FontAllowUserScaling)
8697 BulletText("CTRL+Mouse Wheel to zoom window contents.");
8698 BulletText("While inputting text:\n");
8699 Indent();
8700 BulletText("CTRL+Left/Right to word jump.");
8701 BulletText("CTRL+A or double-click to select all.");
8702 BulletText("CTRL+X/C/V to use clipboard cut/copy/paste.");
8703 BulletText("CTRL+Z to undo, CTRL+Y/CTRL+SHIFT+Z to redo.");
8704 BulletText("ESCAPE to revert.");
8705 Unindent();
8706 BulletText("With keyboard navigation enabled:");
8707 Indent();
8708 BulletText("Arrow keys to navigate.");
8709 BulletText("Space to activate a widget.");
8710 BulletText("Return to input text into a widget.");
8711 BulletText("Escape to deactivate a widget, close popup, exit child window.");
8712 BulletText("Alt to jump to the menu layer of a window.");
8713 Unindent();
8714}
8715
8716//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8717// [SECTION] Example App: Main Menu Bar / ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
8718//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8719// - ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
8720// - ShowExampleMenuFile()
8721//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8722
8723// Demonstrate creating a "main" fullscreen menu bar and populating it.
8724// Note the difference between BeginMainMenuBar() and BeginMenuBar():
8725// - BeginMenuBar() = menu-bar inside current window (which needs the ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar flag!)
8726// - BeginMainMenuBar() = helper to create menu-bar-sized window at the top of the main viewport + call BeginMenuBar() into it.
8727static void ShowExampleAppMainMenuBar()
8728{
8729 if (ImGui::BeginMainMenuBar())
8730 {
8731 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
8732 {
8733 ShowExampleMenuFile();
8734 ImGui::EndMenu();
8735 }
8736 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Edit"))
8737 {
8738 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Undo", "CTRL+Z")) {}
8739 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Redo", "CTRL+Y", false, false)) {} // Disabled item
8740 ImGui::Separator();
8741 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Cut", "CTRL+X")) {}
8742 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Copy", "CTRL+C")) {}
8743 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Paste", "CTRL+V")) {}
8744 ImGui::EndMenu();
8745 }
8746 ImGui::EndMainMenuBar();
8747 }
8748}
8749
8750// Note that shortcuts are currently provided for display only
8751// (future version will add explicit flags to BeginMenu() to request processing shortcuts)
8752static void ShowExampleMenuFile()
8753{
8754 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Menu");
8755 ImGui::MenuItem("(demo menu)", NULL, false, false);
8756 if (ImGui::MenuItem("New")) {}
8757 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Open", "Ctrl+O")) {}
8758 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Open Recent"))
8759 {
8760 ImGui::MenuItem("fish_hat.c");
8761 ImGui::MenuItem("fish_hat.inl");
8762 ImGui::MenuItem("fish_hat.h");
8763 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("More.."))
8764 {
8765 ImGui::MenuItem("Hello");
8766 ImGui::MenuItem("Sailor");
8767 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Recurse.."))
8768 {
8769 ShowExampleMenuFile();
8770 ImGui::EndMenu();
8771 }
8772 ImGui::EndMenu();
8773 }
8774 ImGui::EndMenu();
8775 }
8776 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Save", "Ctrl+S")) {}
8777 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Save As..")) {}
8778
8779 ImGui::Separator();
8780 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Menu/Options");
8781 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Options"))
8782 {
8783 static bool enabled = true;
8784 ImGui::MenuItem("Enabled", "", &enabled);
8785 ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 60), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders);
8786 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
8787 ImGui::Text("Scrolling Text %d", i);
8788 ImGui::EndChild();
8789 static float f = 0.5f;
8790 static int n = 0;
8791 ImGui::SliderFloat("Value", &f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
8792 ImGui::InputFloat("Input", &f, 0.1f);
8793 ImGui::Combo("Combo", &n, "Yes\0No\0Maybe\0\0");
8794 ImGui::EndMenu();
8795 }
8796
8797 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Menu/Colors");
8798 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Colors"))
8799 {
8800 float sz = ImGui::GetTextLineHeight();
8801 for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiCol_COUNT; i++)
8802 {
8803 const char* name = ImGui::GetStyleColorName((ImGuiCol)i);
8804 ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
8805 ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(p, ImVec2(p.x + sz, p.y + sz), ImGui::GetColorU32((ImGuiCol)i));
8806 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(sz, sz));
8807 ImGui::SameLine();
8808 ImGui::MenuItem(name);
8809 }
8810 ImGui::EndMenu();
8811 }
8812
8813 // Here we demonstrate appending again to the "Options" menu (which we already created above)
8814 // Of course in this demo it is a little bit silly that this function calls BeginMenu("Options") twice.
8815 // In a real code-base using it would make senses to use this feature from very different code locations.
8816 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Options")) // <-- Append!
8817 {
8818 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Menu/Append to an existing menu");
8819 static bool b = true;
8820 ImGui::Checkbox("SomeOption", &b);
8821 ImGui::EndMenu();
8822 }
8823
8824 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Disabled", false)) // Disabled
8825 {
8826 IM_ASSERT(0);
8827 }
8828 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Checked", NULL, true)) {}
8829 ImGui::Separator();
8830 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Quit", "Alt+F4")) {}
8831}
8832
8833//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8834// [SECTION] Example App: Debug Console / ShowExampleAppConsole()
8835//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8836
8837// Demonstrate creating a simple console window, with scrolling, filtering, completion and history.
8838// For the console example, we are using a more C++ like approach of declaring a class to hold both data and functions.
8839struct ExampleAppConsole
8840{
8841 char InputBuf[256];
8842 ImVector<char*> Items;
8843 ImVector<const char*> Commands;
8844 ImVector<char*> History;
8845 int HistoryPos; // -1: new line, 0..History.Size-1 browsing history.
8846 ImGuiTextFilter Filter;
8847 bool AutoScroll;
8848 bool ScrollToBottom;
8849
8850 ExampleAppConsole()
8851 {
8852 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Console");
8853 ClearLog();
8854 memset(InputBuf, 0, sizeof(InputBuf));
8855 HistoryPos = -1;
8856
8857 // "CLASSIFY" is here to provide the test case where "C"+[tab] completes to "CL" and display multiple matches.
8858 Commands.push_back("HELP");
8859 Commands.push_back("HISTORY");
8860 Commands.push_back("CLEAR");
8861 Commands.push_back("CLASSIFY");
8862 AutoScroll = true;
8863 ScrollToBottom = false;
8864 AddLog("Welcome to Dear ImGui!");
8865 }
8866 ~ExampleAppConsole()
8867 {
8868 ClearLog();
8869 for (int i = 0; i < History.Size; i++)
8870 ImGui::MemFree(History[i]);
8871 }
8872
8873 // Portable helpers
8874 static int Stricmp(const char* s1, const char* s2) { int d; while ((d = toupper(*s2) - toupper(*s1)) == 0 && *s1) { s1++; s2++; } return d; }
8875 static int Strnicmp(const char* s1, const char* s2, int n) { int d = 0; while (n > 0 && (d = toupper(*s2) - toupper(*s1)) == 0 && *s1) { s1++; s2++; n--; } return d; }
8876 static char* Strdup(const char* s) { IM_ASSERT(s); size_t len = strlen(s) + 1; void* buf = ImGui::MemAlloc(len); IM_ASSERT(buf); return (char*)memcpy(buf, (const void*)s, len); }
8877 static void Strtrim(char* s) { char* str_end = s + strlen(s); while (str_end > s && str_end[-1] == ' ') str_end--; *str_end = 0; }
8878
8879 void ClearLog()
8880 {
8881 for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
8882 ImGui::MemFree(Items[i]);
8883 Items.clear();
8884 }
8885
8886 void AddLog(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)
8887 {
8888 // FIXME-OPT
8889 char buf[1024];
8890 va_list args;
8891 va_start(args, fmt);
8892 vsnprintf(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), fmt, args);
8893 buf[IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf)-1] = 0;
8894 va_end(args);
8895 Items.push_back(Strdup(buf));
8896 }
8897
8898 void Draw(const char* title, bool* p_open)
8899 {
8900 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520, 600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
8901 if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open))
8902 {
8903 ImGui::End();
8904 return;
8905 }
8906
8907 // As a specific feature guaranteed by the library, after calling Begin() the last Item represent the title bar.
8908 // So e.g. IsItemHovered() will return true when hovering the title bar.
8909 // Here we create a context menu only available from the title bar.
8910 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
8911 {
8912 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close Console"))
8913 *p_open = false;
8914 ImGui::EndPopup();
8915 }
8916
8917 ImGui::TextWrapped(
8918 "This example implements a console with basic coloring, completion (TAB key) and history (Up/Down keys). A more elaborate "
8919 "implementation may want to store entries along with extra data such as timestamp, emitter, etc.");
8920 ImGui::TextWrapped("Enter 'HELP' for help.");
8921
8922 // TODO: display items starting from the bottom
8923
8924 if (ImGui::SmallButton("Add Debug Text")) { AddLog("%d some text", Items.Size); AddLog("some more text"); AddLog("display very important message here!"); }
8925 ImGui::SameLine();
8926 if (ImGui::SmallButton("Add Debug Error")) { AddLog("[error] something went wrong"); }
8927 ImGui::SameLine();
8928 if (ImGui::SmallButton("Clear")) { ClearLog(); }
8929 ImGui::SameLine();
8930 bool copy_to_clipboard = ImGui::SmallButton("Copy");
8931 //static float t = 0.0f; if (ImGui::GetTime() - t > 0.02f) { t = ImGui::GetTime(); AddLog("Spam %f", t); }
8932
8933 ImGui::Separator();
8934
8935 // Options menu
8936 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("Options"))
8937 {
8938 ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-scroll", &AutoScroll);
8939 ImGui::EndPopup();
8940 }
8941
8942 // Options, Filter
8943 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_O, ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
8944 if (ImGui::Button("Options"))
8945 ImGui::OpenPopup("Options");
8946 ImGui::SameLine();
8947 Filter.Draw("Filter (\"incl,-excl\") (\"error\")", 180);
8948 ImGui::Separator();
8949
8950 // Reserve enough left-over height for 1 separator + 1 input text
8951 const float footer_height_to_reserve = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y + ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing();
8952 if (ImGui::BeginChild("ScrollingRegion", ImVec2(0, -footer_height_to_reserve), ImGuiChildFlags_NavFlattened, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar))
8953 {
8954 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
8955 {
8956 if (ImGui::Selectable("Clear")) ClearLog();
8957 ImGui::EndPopup();
8958 }
8959
8960 // Display every line as a separate entry so we can change their color or add custom widgets.
8961 // If you only want raw text you can use ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());
8962 // NB- if you have thousands of entries this approach may be too inefficient and may require user-side clipping
8963 // to only process visible items. The clipper will automatically measure the height of your first item and then
8964 // "seek" to display only items in the visible area.
8965 // To use the clipper we can replace your standard loop:
8966 // for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
8967 // With:
8968 // ImGuiListClipper clipper;
8969 // clipper.Begin(Items.Size);
8970 // while (clipper.Step())
8971 // for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
8972 // - That your items are evenly spaced (same height)
8973 // - That you have cheap random access to your elements (you can access them given their index,
8974 // without processing all the ones before)
8975 // You cannot this code as-is if a filter is active because it breaks the 'cheap random-access' property.
8976 // We would need random-access on the post-filtered list.
8977 // A typical application wanting coarse clipping and filtering may want to pre-compute an array of indices
8978 // or offsets of items that passed the filtering test, recomputing this array when user changes the filter,
8979 // and appending newly elements as they are inserted. This is left as a task to the user until we can manage
8980 // to improve this example code!
8981 // If your items are of variable height:
8982 // - Split them into same height items would be simpler and facilitate random-seeking into your list.
8983 // - Consider using manual call to IsRectVisible() and skipping extraneous decoration from your items.
8984 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(4, 1)); // Tighten spacing
8985 if (copy_to_clipboard)
8986 ImGui::LogToClipboard();
8987 for (const char* item : Items)
8988 {
8989 if (!Filter.PassFilter(item))
8990 continue;
8991
8992 // Normally you would store more information in your item than just a string.
8993 // (e.g. make Items[] an array of structure, store color/type etc.)
8994 ImVec4 color;
8995 bool has_color = false;
8996 if (strstr(item, "[error]")) { color = ImVec4(1.0f, 0.4f, 0.4f, 1.0f); has_color = true; }
8997 else if (strncmp(item, "# ", 2) == 0) { color = ImVec4(1.0f, 0.8f, 0.6f, 1.0f); has_color = true; }
8998 if (has_color)
8999 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, color);
9000 ImGui::TextUnformatted(item);
9001 if (has_color)
9002 ImGui::PopStyleColor();
9003 }
9004 if (copy_to_clipboard)
9005 ImGui::LogFinish();
9006
9007 // Keep up at the bottom of the scroll region if we were already at the bottom at the beginning of the frame.
9008 // Using a scrollbar or mouse-wheel will take away from the bottom edge.
9009 if (ScrollToBottom || (AutoScroll && ImGui::GetScrollY() >= ImGui::GetScrollMaxY()))
9010 ImGui::SetScrollHereY(1.0f);
9011 ScrollToBottom = false;
9012
9013 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
9014 }
9015 ImGui::EndChild();
9016 ImGui::Separator();
9017
9018 // Command-line
9019 bool reclaim_focus = false;
9020 ImGuiInputTextFlags input_text_flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue | ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
9021 if (ImGui::InputText("Input", InputBuf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(InputBuf), input_text_flags, &TextEditCallbackStub, (void*)this))
9022 {
9023 char* s = InputBuf;
9024 Strtrim(s);
9025 if (s[0])
9026 ExecCommand(s);
9027 strcpy(s, "");
9028 reclaim_focus = true;
9029 }
9030
9031 // Auto-focus on window apparition
9032 ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
9033 if (reclaim_focus)
9034 ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1); // Auto focus previous widget
9035
9036 ImGui::End();
9037 }
9038
9039 void ExecCommand(const char* command_line)
9040 {
9041 AddLog("# %s\n", command_line);
9042
9043 // Insert into history. First find match and delete it so it can be pushed to the back.
9044 // This isn't trying to be smart or optimal.
9045 HistoryPos = -1;
9046 for (int i = History.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
9047 if (Stricmp(History[i], command_line) == 0)
9048 {
9049 ImGui::MemFree(History[i]);
9050 History.erase(History.begin() + i);
9051 break;
9052 }
9053 History.push_back(Strdup(command_line));
9054
9055 // Process command
9056 if (Stricmp(command_line, "CLEAR") == 0)
9057 {
9058 ClearLog();
9059 }
9060 else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HELP") == 0)
9061 {
9062 AddLog("Commands:");
9063 for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)
9064 AddLog("- %s", Commands[i]);
9065 }
9066 else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HISTORY") == 0)
9067 {
9068 int first = History.Size - 10;
9069 for (int i = first > 0 ? first : 0; i < History.Size; i++)
9070 AddLog("%3d: %s\n", i, History[i]);
9071 }
9072 else
9073 {
9074 AddLog("Unknown command: '%s'\n", command_line);
9075 }
9076
9077 // On command input, we scroll to bottom even if AutoScroll==false
9078 ScrollToBottom = true;
9079 }
9080
9081 // In C++11 you'd be better off using lambdas for this sort of forwarding callbacks
9082 static int TextEditCallbackStub(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)
9083 {
9084 ExampleAppConsole* console = (ExampleAppConsole*)data->UserData;
9085 return console->TextEditCallback(data);
9086 }
9087
9088 int TextEditCallback(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)
9089 {
9090 //AddLog("cursor: %d, selection: %d-%d", data->CursorPos, data->SelectionStart, data->SelectionEnd);
9091 switch (data->EventFlag)
9092 {
9093 case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion:
9094 {
9095 // Example of TEXT COMPLETION
9096
9097 // Locate beginning of current word
9098 const char* word_end = data->Buf + data->CursorPos;
9099 const char* word_start = word_end;
9100 while (word_start > data->Buf)
9101 {
9102 const char c = word_start[-1];
9103 if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == ',' || c == ';')
9104 break;
9105 word_start--;
9106 }
9107
9108 // Build a list of candidates
9109 ImVector<const char*> candidates;
9110 for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)
9111 if (Strnicmp(Commands[i], word_start, (int)(word_end - word_start)) == 0)
9112 candidates.push_back(Commands[i]);
9113
9114 if (candidates.Size == 0)
9115 {
9116 // No match
9117 AddLog("No match for \"%.*s\"!\n", (int)(word_end - word_start), word_start);
9118 }
9119 else if (candidates.Size == 1)
9120 {
9121 // Single match. Delete the beginning of the word and replace it entirely so we've got nice casing.
9122 data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end - word_start));
9123 data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0]);
9124 data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, " ");
9125 }
9126 else
9127 {
9128 // Multiple matches. Complete as much as we can..
9129 // So inputting "C"+Tab will complete to "CL" then display "CLEAR" and "CLASSIFY" as matches.
9130 int match_len = (int)(word_end - word_start);
9131 for (;;)
9132 {
9133 int c = 0;
9134 bool all_candidates_matches = true;
9135 for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size && all_candidates_matches; i++)
9136 if (i == 0)
9137 c = toupper(candidates[i][match_len]);
9138 else if (c == 0 || c != toupper(candidates[i][match_len]))
9139 all_candidates_matches = false;
9140 if (!all_candidates_matches)
9141 break;
9142 match_len++;
9143 }
9144
9145 if (match_len > 0)
9146 {
9147 data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end - word_start));
9148 data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0], candidates[0] + match_len);
9149 }
9150
9151 // List matches
9152 AddLog("Possible matches:\n");
9153 for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size; i++)
9154 AddLog("- %s\n", candidates[i]);
9155 }
9156
9157 break;
9158 }
9159 case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory:
9160 {
9161 // Example of HISTORY
9162 const int prev_history_pos = HistoryPos;
9163 if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_UpArrow)
9164 {
9165 if (HistoryPos == -1)
9166 HistoryPos = History.Size - 1;
9167 else if (HistoryPos > 0)
9168 HistoryPos--;
9169 }
9170 else if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_DownArrow)
9171 {
9172 if (HistoryPos != -1)
9173 if (++HistoryPos >= History.Size)
9174 HistoryPos = -1;
9175 }
9176
9177 // A better implementation would preserve the data on the current input line along with cursor position.
9178 if (prev_history_pos != HistoryPos)
9179 {
9180 const char* history_str = (HistoryPos >= 0) ? History[HistoryPos] : "";
9181 data->DeleteChars(0, data->BufTextLen);
9182 data->InsertChars(0, history_str);
9183 }
9184 }
9185 }
9186 return 0;
9187 }
9188};
9189
9190static void ShowExampleAppConsole(bool* p_open)
9191{
9192 static ExampleAppConsole console;
9193 console.Draw("Example: Console", p_open);
9194}
9195
9196//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9197// [SECTION] Example App: Debug Log / ShowExampleAppLog()
9198//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9199
9200// Usage:
9201// static ExampleAppLog my_log;
9202// my_log.AddLog("Hello %d world\n", 123);
9203// my_log.Draw("title");
9204struct ExampleAppLog
9205{
9206 ImGuiTextBuffer Buf;
9207 ImGuiTextFilter Filter;
9208 ImVector<int> LineOffsets; // Index to lines offset. We maintain this with AddLog() calls.
9209 bool AutoScroll; // Keep scrolling if already at the bottom.
9210
9211 ExampleAppLog()
9212 {
9213 AutoScroll = true;
9214 Clear();
9215 }
9216
9217 void Clear()
9218 {
9219 Buf.clear();
9220 LineOffsets.clear();
9221 LineOffsets.push_back(0);
9222 }
9223
9224 void AddLog(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)
9225 {
9226 int old_size = Buf.size();
9227 va_list args;
9228 va_start(args, fmt);
9229 Buf.appendfv(fmt, args);
9230 va_end(args);
9231 for (int new_size = Buf.size(); old_size < new_size; old_size++)
9232 if (Buf[old_size] == '\n')
9233 LineOffsets.push_back(old_size + 1);
9234 }
9235
9236 void Draw(const char* title, bool* p_open = NULL)
9237 {
9238 if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open))
9239 {
9240 ImGui::End();
9241 return;
9242 }
9243
9244 // Options menu
9245 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("Options"))
9246 {
9247 ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-scroll", &AutoScroll);
9248 ImGui::EndPopup();
9249 }
9250
9251 // Main window
9252 if (ImGui::Button("Options"))
9253 ImGui::OpenPopup("Options");
9254 ImGui::SameLine();
9255 bool clear = ImGui::Button("Clear");
9256 ImGui::SameLine();
9257 bool copy = ImGui::Button("Copy");
9258 ImGui::SameLine();
9259 Filter.Draw("Filter", -100.0f);
9260
9261 ImGui::Separator();
9262
9263 if (ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags_None, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar))
9264 {
9265 if (clear)
9266 Clear();
9267 if (copy)
9268 ImGui::LogToClipboard();
9269
9270 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
9271 const char* buf = Buf.begin();
9272 const char* buf_end = Buf.end();
9273 if (Filter.IsActive())
9274 {
9275 // In this example we don't use the clipper when Filter is enabled.
9276 // This is because we don't have random access to the result of our filter.
9277 // A real application processing logs with ten of thousands of entries may want to store the result of
9278 // search/filter.. especially if the filtering function is not trivial (e.g. reg-exp).
9279 for (int line_no = 0; line_no < LineOffsets.Size; line_no++)
9280 {
9281 const char* line_start = buf + LineOffsets[line_no];
9282 const char* line_end = (line_no + 1 < LineOffsets.Size) ? (buf + LineOffsets[line_no + 1] - 1) : buf_end;
9283 if (Filter.PassFilter(line_start, line_end))
9284 ImGui::TextUnformatted(line_start, line_end);
9285 }
9286 }
9287 else
9288 {
9289 // The simplest and easy way to display the entire buffer:
9290 // ImGui::TextUnformatted(buf_begin, buf_end);
9291 // And it'll just work. TextUnformatted() has specialization for large blob of text and will fast-forward
9292 // to skip non-visible lines. Here we instead demonstrate using the clipper to only process lines that are
9293 // within the visible area.
9294 // If you have tens of thousands of items and their processing cost is non-negligible, coarse clipping them
9295 // on your side is recommended. Using ImGuiListClipper requires
9296 // - A) random access into your data
9297 // - B) items all being the same height,
9298 // both of which we can handle since we have an array pointing to the beginning of each line of text.
9299 // When using the filter (in the block of code above) we don't have random access into the data to display
9300 // anymore, which is why we don't use the clipper. Storing or skimming through the search result would make
9301 // it possible (and would be recommended if you want to search through tens of thousands of entries).
9302 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
9303 clipper.Begin(LineOffsets.Size);
9304 while (clipper.Step())
9305 {
9306 for (int line_no = clipper.DisplayStart; line_no < clipper.DisplayEnd; line_no++)
9307 {
9308 const char* line_start = buf + LineOffsets[line_no];
9309 const char* line_end = (line_no + 1 < LineOffsets.Size) ? (buf + LineOffsets[line_no + 1] - 1) : buf_end;
9310 ImGui::TextUnformatted(line_start, line_end);
9311 }
9312 }
9313 clipper.End();
9314 }
9315 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
9316
9317 // Keep up at the bottom of the scroll region if we were already at the bottom at the beginning of the frame.
9318 // Using a scrollbar or mouse-wheel will take away from the bottom edge.
9319 if (AutoScroll && ImGui::GetScrollY() >= ImGui::GetScrollMaxY())
9320 ImGui::SetScrollHereY(1.0f);
9321 }
9322 ImGui::EndChild();
9323 ImGui::End();
9324 }
9325};
9326
9327// Demonstrate creating a simple log window with basic filtering.
9328static void ShowExampleAppLog(bool* p_open)
9329{
9330 static ExampleAppLog log;
9331
9332 // For the demo: add a debug button _BEFORE_ the normal log window contents
9333 // We take advantage of a rarely used feature: multiple calls to Begin()/End() are appending to the _same_ window.
9334 // Most of the contents of the window will be added by the log.Draw() call.
9335 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9336 ImGui::Begin("Example: Log", p_open);
9337 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Log");
9338 if (ImGui::SmallButton("[Debug] Add 5 entries"))
9339 {
9340 static int counter = 0;
9341 const char* categories[3] = { "info", "warn", "error" };
9342 const char* words[] = { "Bumfuzzled", "Cattywampus", "Snickersnee", "Abibliophobia", "Absquatulate", "Nincompoop", "Pauciloquent" };
9343 for (int n = 0; n < 5; n++)
9344 {
9345 const char* category = categories[counter % IM_ARRAYSIZE(categories)];
9346 const char* word = words[counter % IM_ARRAYSIZE(words)];
9347 log.AddLog("[%05d] [%s] Hello, current time is %.1f, here's a word: '%s'\n",
9348 ImGui::GetFrameCount(), category, ImGui::GetTime(), word);
9349 counter++;
9350 }
9351 }
9352 ImGui::End();
9353
9354 // Actually call in the regular Log helper (which will Begin() into the same window as we just did)
9355 log.Draw("Example: Log", p_open);
9356}
9357
9358//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9359// [SECTION] Example App: Simple Layout / ShowExampleAppLayout()
9360//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9361
9362// Demonstrate create a window with multiple child windows.
9363static void ShowExampleAppLayout(bool* p_open)
9364{
9365 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 440), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9366 if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple layout", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
9367 {
9368 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Simple layout");
9369 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
9370 {
9371 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
9372 {
9373 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close", "Ctrl+W")) { *p_open = false; }
9374 ImGui::EndMenu();
9375 }
9376 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
9377 }
9378
9379 // Left
9380 static int selected = 0;
9381 {
9382 ImGui::BeginChild("left pane", ImVec2(150, 0), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeX);
9383 for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
9384 {
9385 // FIXME: Good candidate to use ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav
9386 char label[128];
9387 sprintf(label, "MyObject %d", i);
9388 if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i))
9389 selected = i;
9390 }
9391 ImGui::EndChild();
9392 }
9393 ImGui::SameLine();
9394
9395 // Right
9396 {
9397 ImGui::BeginGroup();
9398 ImGui::BeginChild("item view", ImVec2(0, -ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing())); // Leave room for 1 line below us
9399 ImGui::Text("MyObject: %d", selected);
9400 ImGui::Separator();
9401 if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##Tabs", ImGuiTabBarFlags_None))
9402 {
9403 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Description"))
9404 {
9405 ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. ");
9406 ImGui::EndTabItem();
9407 }
9408 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Details"))
9409 {
9410 ImGui::Text("ID: 0123456789");
9411 ImGui::EndTabItem();
9412 }
9413 ImGui::EndTabBar();
9414 }
9415 ImGui::EndChild();
9416 if (ImGui::Button("Revert")) {}
9417 ImGui::SameLine();
9418 if (ImGui::Button("Save")) {}
9419 ImGui::EndGroup();
9420 }
9421 }
9422 ImGui::End();
9423}
9424
9425//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9426// [SECTION] Example App: Property Editor / ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor()
9427//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9428// Some of the interactions are a bit lack-luster:
9429// - We would want pressing validating or leaving the filter to somehow restore focus.
9430// - We may want more advanced filtering (child nodes) and clipper support: both will need extra work.
9431// - We would want to customize some keyboard interactions to easily keyboard navigate between the tree and the properties.
9432//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9433
9434struct ExampleAppPropertyEditor
9435{
9436 ImGuiTextFilter Filter;
9437 ExampleTreeNode* VisibleNode = NULL;
9438
9439 void Draw(ExampleTreeNode* root_node)
9440 {
9441 // Left side: draw tree
9442 // - Currently using a table to benefit from RowBg feature
9443 if (ImGui::BeginChild("##tree", ImVec2(300, 0), ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeX | ImGuiChildFlags_Borders | ImGuiChildFlags_NavFlattened))
9444 {
9445 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
9446 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_F, ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
9447 ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus, true);
9448 if (ImGui::InputTextWithHint("##Filter", "incl,-excl", Filter.InputBuf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(Filter.InputBuf), ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll))
9449 Filter.Build();
9450 ImGui::PopItemFlag();
9451
9452 if (ImGui::BeginTable("##bg", 1, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg))
9453 {
9454 for (ExampleTreeNode* node : root_node->Childs)
9455 if (Filter.PassFilter(node->Name)) // Filter root node
9456 DrawTreeNode(node);
9457 ImGui::EndTable();
9458 }
9459 }
9460 ImGui::EndChild();
9461
9462 // Right side: draw properties
9463 ImGui::SameLine();
9464
9465 ImGui::BeginGroup(); // Lock X position
9466 if (ExampleTreeNode* node = VisibleNode)
9467 {
9468 ImGui::Text("%s", node->Name);
9469 ImGui::TextDisabled("UID: 0x%08X", node->UID);
9470 ImGui::Separator();
9471 if (ImGui::BeginTable("##properties", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY))
9472 {
9473 // Push object ID after we entered the table, so table is shared for all objects
9474 ImGui::PushID((int)node->UID);
9475 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed);
9476 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 2.0f); // Default twice larger
9477 if (node->HasData)
9478 {
9479 // In a typical application, the structure description would be derived from a data-driven system.
9480 // - We try to mimic this with our ExampleMemberInfo structure and the ExampleTreeNodeMemberInfos[] array.
9481 // - Limits and some details are hard-coded to simplify the demo.
9482 for (const ExampleMemberInfo& field_desc : ExampleTreeNodeMemberInfos)
9483 {
9484 ImGui::TableNextRow();
9485 ImGui::PushID(field_desc.Name);
9486 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
9487 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
9488 ImGui::TextUnformatted(field_desc.Name);
9489 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
9490 void* field_ptr = (void*)(((unsigned char*)node) + field_desc.Offset);
9491 switch (field_desc.DataType)
9492 {
9493 case ImGuiDataType_Bool:
9494 {
9495 IM_ASSERT(field_desc.DataCount == 1);
9496 ImGui::Checkbox("##Editor", (bool*)field_ptr);
9497 break;
9498 }
9499 case ImGuiDataType_S32:
9500 {
9501 int v_min = INT_MIN, v_max = INT_MAX;
9502 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
9503 ImGui::DragScalarN("##Editor", field_desc.DataType, field_ptr, field_desc.DataCount, 1.0f, &v_min, &v_max);
9504 break;
9505 }
9506 case ImGuiDataType_Float:
9507 {
9508 float v_min = 0.0f, v_max = 1.0f;
9509 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
9510 ImGui::SliderScalarN("##Editor", field_desc.DataType, field_ptr, field_desc.DataCount, &v_min, &v_max);
9511 break;
9512 }
9513 case ImGuiDataType_String:
9514 {
9515 ImGui::InputText("##Editor", reinterpret_cast<char*>(field_ptr), 28);
9516 break;
9517 }
9518 }
9519 ImGui::PopID();
9520 }
9521 }
9522 ImGui::PopID();
9523 ImGui::EndTable();
9524 }
9525 }
9526 ImGui::EndGroup();
9527 }
9528
9529 void DrawTreeNode(ExampleTreeNode* node)
9530 {
9531 ImGui::TableNextRow();
9532 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
9533 ImGui::PushID(node->UID);
9534 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags tree_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None;
9535 tree_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick;// Standard opening mode as we are likely to want to add selection afterwards
9536 tree_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent; // Left arrow support
9537 tree_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth; // Span full width for easier mouse reach
9538 tree_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes; // Always draw hierarchy outlines
9539 if (node == VisibleNode)
9540 tree_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected;
9541 if (node->Childs.Size == 0)
9542 tree_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet;
9543 if (node->DataMyBool == false)
9544 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, ImGui::GetStyle().Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]);
9545 bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx("", tree_flags, "%s", node->Name);
9546 if (node->DataMyBool == false)
9547 ImGui::PopStyleColor();
9548 if (ImGui::IsItemFocused())
9549 VisibleNode = node;
9550 if (node_open)
9551 {
9552 for (ExampleTreeNode* child : node->Childs)
9553 DrawTreeNode(child);
9554 ImGui::TreePop();
9555 }
9556 ImGui::PopID();
9557 }
9558};
9559
9560// Demonstrate creating a simple property editor.
9561static void ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(bool* p_open, ImGuiDemoWindowData* demo_data)
9562{
9563 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(430, 450), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9564 if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Property editor", p_open))
9565 {
9566 ImGui::End();
9567 return;
9568 }
9569
9570 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Property Editor");
9571 static ExampleAppPropertyEditor property_editor;
9572 if (demo_data->DemoTree == NULL)
9573 demo_data->DemoTree = ExampleTree_CreateDemoTree();
9574 property_editor.Draw(demo_data->DemoTree);
9575
9576 ImGui::End();
9577}
9578
9579//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9580// [SECTION] Example App: Long Text / ShowExampleAppLongText()
9581//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9582
9583// Demonstrate/test rendering huge amount of text, and the incidence of clipping.
9584static void ShowExampleAppLongText(bool* p_open)
9585{
9586 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520, 600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9587 if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Long text display", p_open))
9588 {
9589 ImGui::End();
9590 return;
9591 }
9592 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Long text display");
9593
9594 static int test_type = 0;
9595 static ImGuiTextBuffer log;
9596 static int lines = 0;
9597 ImGui::Text("Printing unusually long amount of text.");
9598 ImGui::Combo("Test type", &test_type,
9599 "Single call to TextUnformatted()\0"
9600 "Multiple calls to Text(), clipped\0"
9601 "Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)\0");
9602 ImGui::Text("Buffer contents: %d lines, %d bytes", lines, log.size());
9603 if (ImGui::Button("Clear")) { log.clear(); lines = 0; }
9604 ImGui::SameLine();
9605 if (ImGui::Button("Add 1000 lines"))
9606 {
9607 for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
9608 log.appendf("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog\n", lines + i);
9609 lines += 1000;
9610 }
9611 ImGui::BeginChild("Log");
9612 switch (test_type)
9613 {
9614 case 0:
9615 // Single call to TextUnformatted() with a big buffer
9616 ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());
9617 break;
9618 case 1:
9619 {
9620 // Multiple calls to Text(), manually coarsely clipped - demonstrate how to use the ImGuiListClipper helper.
9621 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
9622 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
9623 clipper.Begin(lines);
9624 while (clipper.Step())
9625 for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
9626 ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);
9627 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
9628 break;
9629 }
9630 case 2:
9631 // Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)
9632 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
9633 for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)
9634 ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);
9635 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
9636 break;
9637 }
9638 ImGui::EndChild();
9639 ImGui::End();
9640}
9641
9642//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9643// [SECTION] Example App: Auto Resize / ShowExampleAppAutoResize()
9644//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9645
9646// Demonstrate creating a window which gets auto-resized according to its content.
9647static void ShowExampleAppAutoResize(bool* p_open)
9648{
9649 if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Auto-resizing window", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
9650 {
9651 ImGui::End();
9652 return;
9653 }
9654 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Auto-resizing window");
9655
9656 static int lines = 10;
9657 ImGui::TextUnformatted(
9658 "Window will resize every-frame to the size of its content.\n"
9659 "Note that you probably don't want to query the window size to\n"
9660 "output your content because that would create a feedback loop.");
9661 ImGui::SliderInt("Number of lines", &lines, 1, 20);
9662 for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)
9663 ImGui::Text("%*sThis is line %d", i * 4, "", i); // Pad with space to extend size horizontally
9664 ImGui::End();
9665}
9666
9667//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9668// [SECTION] Example App: Constrained Resize / ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize()
9669//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9670
9671// Demonstrate creating a window with custom resize constraints.
9672// Note that size constraints currently don't work on a docked window (when in 'docking' branch)
9673static void ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(bool* p_open)
9674{
9675 struct CustomConstraints
9676 {
9677 // Helper functions to demonstrate programmatic constraints
9678 // FIXME: This doesn't take account of decoration size (e.g. title bar), library should make this easier.
9679 // FIXME: None of the three demos works consistently when resizing from borders.
9680 static void AspectRatio(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)
9681 {
9682 float aspect_ratio = *(float*)data->UserData;
9683 data->DesiredSize.y = (float)(int)(data->DesiredSize.x / aspect_ratio);
9684 }
9685 static void Square(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)
9686 {
9687 data->DesiredSize.x = data->DesiredSize.y = IM_MAX(data->DesiredSize.x, data->DesiredSize.y);
9688 }
9689 static void Step(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)
9690 {
9691 float step = *(float*)data->UserData;
9692 data->DesiredSize = ImVec2((int)(data->DesiredSize.x / step + 0.5f) * step, (int)(data->DesiredSize.y / step + 0.5f) * step);
9693 }
9694 };
9695
9696 const char* test_desc[] =
9697 {
9698 "Between 100x100 and 500x500",
9699 "At least 100x100",
9700 "Resize vertical + lock current width",
9701 "Resize horizontal + lock current height",
9702 "Width Between 400 and 500",
9703 "Height at least 400",
9704 "Custom: Aspect Ratio 16:9",
9705 "Custom: Always Square",
9706 "Custom: Fixed Steps (100)",
9707 };
9708
9709 // Options
9710 static bool auto_resize = false;
9711 static bool window_padding = true;
9712 static int type = 6; // Aspect Ratio
9713 static int display_lines = 10;
9714
9715 // Submit constraint
9716 float aspect_ratio = 16.0f / 9.0f;
9717 float fixed_step = 100.0f;
9718 if (type == 0) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(500, 500)); // Between 100x100 and 500x500
9719 if (type == 1) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX)); // Width > 100, Height > 100
9720 if (type == 2) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX)); // Resize vertical + lock current width
9721 if (type == 3) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, -1)); // Resize horizontal + lock current height
9722 if (type == 4) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(400, -1), ImVec2(500, -1)); // Width Between and 400 and 500
9723 if (type == 5) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 400), ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX)); // Height at least 400
9724 if (type == 6) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::AspectRatio, (void*)&aspect_ratio); // Aspect ratio
9725 if (type == 7) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Square); // Always Square
9726 if (type == 8) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Step, (void*)&fixed_step); // Fixed Step
9727
9728 // Submit window
9729 if (!window_padding)
9730 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
9731 const ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = auto_resize ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize : 0;
9732 const bool window_open = ImGui::Begin("Example: Constrained Resize", p_open, window_flags);
9733 if (!window_padding)
9734 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
9735 if (window_open)
9736 {
9737 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Constrained Resizing window");
9738 if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyShift)
9739 {
9740 // Display a dummy viewport (in your real app you would likely use ImageButton() to display a texture.
9741 ImVec2 avail_size = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail();
9742 ImVec2 pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9743 ImGui::ColorButton("viewport", ImVec4(0.5f, 0.2f, 0.5f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, avail_size);
9744 ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(pos.x + 10, pos.y + 10));
9745 ImGui::Text("%.2f x %.2f", avail_size.x, avail_size.y);
9746 }
9747 else
9748 {
9749 ImGui::Text("(Hold SHIFT to display a dummy viewport)");
9750 if (ImGui::IsWindowDocked())
9751 ImGui::Text("Warning: Sizing Constraints won't work if the window is docked!");
9752 if (ImGui::Button("Set 200x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(200, 200)); } ImGui::SameLine();
9753 if (ImGui::Button("Set 500x500")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 500)); } ImGui::SameLine();
9754 if (ImGui::Button("Set 800x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(800, 200)); }
9755 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20);
9756 ImGui::Combo("Constraint", &type, test_desc, IM_ARRAYSIZE(test_desc));
9757 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20);
9758 ImGui::DragInt("Lines", &display_lines, 0.2f, 1, 100);
9759 ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-resize", &auto_resize);
9760 ImGui::Checkbox("Window padding", &window_padding);
9761 for (int i = 0; i < display_lines; i++)
9762 ImGui::Text("%*sHello, sailor! Making this line long enough for the example.", i * 4, "");
9763 }
9764 }
9765 ImGui::End();
9766}
9767
9768//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9769// [SECTION] Example App: Simple overlay / ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay()
9770//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9771
9772// Demonstrate creating a simple static window with no decoration
9773// + a context-menu to choose which corner of the screen to use.
9774static void ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(bool* p_open)
9775{
9776 static int location = 0;
9777 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
9778 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav;
9779 if (location >= 0)
9780 {
9781 const float PAD = 10.0f;
9782 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
9783 ImVec2 work_pos = viewport->WorkPos; // Use work area to avoid menu-bar/task-bar, if any!
9784 ImVec2 work_size = viewport->WorkSize;
9785 ImVec2 window_pos, window_pos_pivot;
9786 window_pos.x = (location & 1) ? (work_pos.x + work_size.x - PAD) : (work_pos.x + PAD);
9787 window_pos.y = (location & 2) ? (work_pos.y + work_size.y - PAD) : (work_pos.y + PAD);
9788 window_pos_pivot.x = (location & 1) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
9789 window_pos_pivot.y = (location & 2) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
9790 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(window_pos, ImGuiCond_Always, window_pos_pivot);
9791 ImGui::SetNextWindowViewport(viewport->ID);
9792 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
9793 }
9794 else if (location == -2)
9795 {
9796 // Center window
9797 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImGui::GetMainViewport()->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
9798 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
9799 }
9800 ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.35f); // Transparent background
9801 if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple overlay", p_open, window_flags))
9802 {
9803 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Simple Overlay");
9804 ImGui::Text("Simple overlay\n" "(right-click to change position)");
9805 ImGui::Separator();
9806 if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
9807 ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: (%.1f,%.1f)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
9808 else
9809 ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: <invalid>");
9810 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
9811 {
9812 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Custom", NULL, location == -1)) location = -1;
9813 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Center", NULL, location == -2)) location = -2;
9814 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-left", NULL, location == 0)) location = 0;
9815 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-right", NULL, location == 1)) location = 1;
9816 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-left", NULL, location == 2)) location = 2;
9817 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-right", NULL, location == 3)) location = 3;
9818 if (p_open && ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) *p_open = false;
9819 ImGui::EndPopup();
9820 }
9821 }
9822 ImGui::End();
9823}
9824
9825//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9826// [SECTION] Example App: Fullscreen window / ShowExampleAppFullscreen()
9827//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9828
9829// Demonstrate creating a window covering the entire screen/viewport
9830static void ShowExampleAppFullscreen(bool* p_open)
9831{
9832 static bool use_work_area = true;
9833 static ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
9834
9835 // We demonstrate using the full viewport area or the work area (without menu-bars, task-bars etc.)
9836 // Based on your use case you may want one or the other.
9837 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
9838 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(use_work_area ? viewport->WorkPos : viewport->Pos);
9839 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(use_work_area ? viewport->WorkSize : viewport->Size);
9840
9841 if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Fullscreen window", p_open, flags))
9842 {
9843 ImGui::Checkbox("Use work area instead of main area", &use_work_area);
9844 ImGui::SameLine();
9845 HelpMarker("Main Area = entire viewport,\nWork Area = entire viewport minus sections used by the main menu bars, task bars etc.\n\nEnable the main-menu bar in Examples menu to see the difference.");
9846
9847 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground);
9848 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration);
9849 ImGui::Indent();
9850 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar);
9851 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse);
9852 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar", &flags, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
9853 ImGui::Unindent();
9854
9855 if (p_open && ImGui::Button("Close this window"))
9856 *p_open = false;
9857 }
9858 ImGui::End();
9859}
9860
9861//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9862// [SECTION] Example App: Manipulating Window Titles / ShowExampleAppWindowTitles()
9863//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9864
9865// Demonstrate the use of "##" and "###" in identifiers to manipulate ID generation.
9866// This applies to all regular items as well.
9867// Read FAQ section "How can I have multiple widgets with the same label?" for details.
9868static void ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(bool*)
9869{
9870 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
9871 const ImVec2 base_pos = viewport->Pos;
9872
9873 // By default, Windows are uniquely identified by their title.
9874 // You can use the "##" and "###" markers to manipulate the display/ID.
9875
9876 // Using "##" to display same title but have unique identifier.
9877 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 100), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9878 ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##1");
9879 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Manipulating window titles");
9880 ImGui::Text("This is window 1.\nMy title is the same as window 2, but my identifier is unique.");
9881 ImGui::End();
9882
9883 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 200), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9884 ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##2");
9885 ImGui::Text("This is window 2.\nMy title is the same as window 1, but my identifier is unique.");
9886 ImGui::End();
9887
9888 // Using "###" to display a changing title but keep a static identifier "AnimatedTitle"
9889 char buf[128];
9890 sprintf(buf, "Animated title %c %d###AnimatedTitle", "|/-\\"[(int)(ImGui::GetTime() / 0.25f) & 3], ImGui::GetFrameCount());
9891 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(base_pos.x + 100, base_pos.y + 300), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
9892 ImGui::Begin(buf);
9893 ImGui::Text("This window has a changing title.");
9894 ImGui::End();
9895}
9896
9897//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9898// [SECTION] Example App: Custom Rendering using ImDrawList API / ShowExampleAppCustomRendering()
9899//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9900
9901// Add a |_| looking shape
9902static void PathConcaveShape(ImDrawList* draw_list, float x, float y, float sz)
9903{
9904 const ImVec2 pos_norms[] = { { 0.0f, 0.0f }, { 0.3f, 0.0f }, { 0.3f, 0.7f }, { 0.7f, 0.7f }, { 0.7f, 0.0f }, { 1.0f, 0.0f }, { 1.0f, 1.0f }, { 0.0f, 1.0f } };
9905 for (const ImVec2& p : pos_norms)
9906 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(x + 0.5f + (int)(sz * p.x), y + 0.5f + (int)(sz * p.y)));
9907}
9908
9909// Demonstrate using the low-level ImDrawList to draw custom shapes.
9910static void ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(bool* p_open)
9911{
9912 if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Custom rendering", p_open))
9913 {
9914 ImGui::End();
9915 return;
9916 }
9917 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Custom Rendering");
9918
9919 // Tip: If you do a lot of custom rendering, you probably want to use your own geometrical types and benefit of
9920 // overloaded operators, etc. Define IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h to create implicit conversions between your
9921 // types and ImVec2/ImVec4. Dear ImGui defines overloaded operators but they are internal to imgui.cpp and not
9922 // exposed outside (to avoid messing with your types) In this example we are not using the maths operators!
9923
9924 if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##TabBar"))
9925 {
9926 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Primitives"))
9927 {
9928 ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
9929 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
9930
9931 // Draw gradients
9932 // (note that those are currently exacerbating our sRGB/Linear issues)
9933 // Calling ImGui::GetColorU32() multiplies the given colors by the current Style Alpha, but you may pass the IM_COL32() directly as well..
9934 ImGui::Text("Gradients");
9935 ImVec2 gradient_size = ImVec2(ImGui::CalcItemWidth(), ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
9936 {
9937 ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9938 ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);
9939 ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255));
9940 ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));
9941 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);
9942 ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient1", gradient_size);
9943 }
9944 {
9945 ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9946 ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);
9947 ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
9948 ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
9949 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);
9950 ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient2", gradient_size);
9951 }
9952
9953 // Draw a bunch of primitives
9954 ImGui::Text("All primitives");
9955 static float sz = 36.0f;
9956 static float thickness = 3.0f;
9957 static int ngon_sides = 6;
9958 static bool circle_segments_override = false;
9959 static int circle_segments_override_v = 12;
9960 static bool curve_segments_override = false;
9961 static int curve_segments_override_v = 8;
9962 static ImVec4 colf = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 0.4f, 1.0f);
9963 ImGui::DragFloat("Size", &sz, 0.2f, 2.0f, 100.0f, "%.0f");
9964 ImGui::DragFloat("Thickness", &thickness, 0.05f, 1.0f, 8.0f, "%.02f");
9965 ImGui::SliderInt("N-gon sides", &ngon_sides, 3, 12);
9966 ImGui::Checkbox("##circlesegmentoverride", &circle_segments_override);
9967 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
9968 circle_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Circle segments override", &circle_segments_override_v, 3, 40);
9969 ImGui::Checkbox("##curvessegmentoverride", &curve_segments_override);
9970 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
9971 curve_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Curves segments override", &curve_segments_override_v, 3, 40);
9972 ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", &colf.x);
9973
9974 const ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9975 const ImU32 col = ImColor(colf);
9976 const float spacing = 10.0f;
9977 const ImDrawFlags corners_tl_br = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight;
9978 const float rounding = sz / 5.0f;
9979 const int circle_segments = circle_segments_override ? circle_segments_override_v : 0;
9980 const int curve_segments = curve_segments_override ? curve_segments_override_v : 0;
9981 const ImVec2 cp3[3] = { ImVec2(0.0f, sz * 0.6f), ImVec2(sz * 0.5f, -sz * 0.4f), ImVec2(sz, sz) }; // Control points for curves
9982 const ImVec2 cp4[4] = { ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), ImVec2(sz * 1.3f, sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(sz - sz * 1.3f, sz - sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(sz, sz) };
9983
9984 float x = p.x + 4.0f;
9985 float y = p.y + 4.0f;
9986 for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)
9987 {
9988 // First line uses a thickness of 1.0f, second line uses the configurable thickness
9989 float th = (n == 0) ? 1.0f : thickness;
9990 draw_list->AddNgon(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, ngon_sides, th); x += sz + spacing; // N-gon
9991 draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, circle_segments, th); x += sz + spacing; // Circle
9992 draw_list->AddEllipse(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), ImVec2(sz*0.5f, sz*0.3f), col, -0.3f, circle_segments, th); x += sz + spacing; // Ellipse
9993 draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_None, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square
9994 draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, ImDrawFlags_None, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square with all rounded corners
9995 draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, corners_tl_br, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square with two rounded corners
9996 draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f,y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x += sz + spacing; // Triangle
9997 //draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x+= sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle
9998 PathConcaveShape(draw_list, x, y, sz); draw_list->PathStroke(col, ImDrawFlags_Closed, th); x += sz + spacing; // Concave Shape
9999 //draw_list->AddPolyline(concave_shape, IM_ARRAYSIZE(concave_shape), col, ImDrawFlags_Closed, th);
10000 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Horizontal line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
10001 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x, y + sz), col, th); x += spacing; // Vertical line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
10002 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Diagonal line
10003
10004 // Path
10005 draw_list->PathArcTo(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, 3.141592f, 3.141592f * -0.5f);
10006 draw_list->PathStroke(col, ImDrawFlags_None, th);
10007 x += sz + spacing;
10008
10009 // Quadratic Bezier Curve (3 control points)
10010 draw_list->AddBezierQuadratic(ImVec2(x + cp3[0].x, y + cp3[0].y), ImVec2(x + cp3[1].x, y + cp3[1].y), ImVec2(x + cp3[2].x, y + cp3[2].y), col, th, curve_segments);
10011 x += sz + spacing;
10012
10013 // Cubic Bezier Curve (4 control points)
10014 draw_list->AddBezierCubic(ImVec2(x + cp4[0].x, y + cp4[0].y), ImVec2(x + cp4[1].x, y + cp4[1].y), ImVec2(x + cp4[2].x, y + cp4[2].y), ImVec2(x + cp4[3].x, y + cp4[3].y), col, th, curve_segments);
10015
10016 x = p.x + 4;
10017 y += sz + spacing;
10018 }
10019
10020 // Filled shapes
10021 draw_list->AddNgonFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, ngon_sides); x += sz + spacing; // N-gon
10022 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, circle_segments); x += sz + spacing; // Circle
10023 draw_list->AddEllipseFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), ImVec2(sz * 0.5f, sz * 0.3f), col, -0.3f, circle_segments); x += sz + spacing;// Ellipse
10024 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col); x += sz + spacing; // Square
10025 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f); x += sz + spacing; // Square with all rounded corners
10026 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f, corners_tl_br); x += sz + spacing; // Square with two rounded corners
10027 draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f,y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), col); x += sz + spacing; // Triangle
10028 //draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col); x += sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle
10029 PathConcaveShape(draw_list, x, y, sz); draw_list->PathFillConcave(col); x += sz + spacing; // Concave shape
10030 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + thickness), col); x += sz + spacing; // Horizontal line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
10031 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + thickness, y + sz), col); x += spacing * 2.0f;// Vertical line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
10032 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + 1, y + 1), col); x += sz; // Pixel (faster than AddLine)
10033
10034 // Path
10035 draw_list->PathArcTo(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, 3.141592f * -0.5f, 3.141592f);
10036 draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
10037 x += sz + spacing;
10038
10039 // Quadratic Bezier Curve (3 control points)
10040 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(x + cp3[0].x, y + cp3[0].y));
10041 draw_list->PathBezierQuadraticCurveTo(ImVec2(x + cp3[1].x, y + cp3[1].y), ImVec2(x + cp3[2].x, y + cp3[2].y), curve_segments);
10042 draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
10043 x += sz + spacing;
10044
10045 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
10046 x += sz + spacing;
10047
10048 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2((sz + spacing) * 13.2f, (sz + spacing) * 3.0f));
10049 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
10050 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10051 }
10052
10053 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Canvas"))
10054 {
10055 static ImVector<ImVec2> points;
10056 static ImVec2 scrolling(0.0f, 0.0f);
10057 static bool opt_enable_grid = true;
10058 static bool opt_enable_context_menu = true;
10059 static bool adding_line = false;
10060
10061 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable grid", &opt_enable_grid);
10062 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable context menu", &opt_enable_context_menu);
10063 ImGui::Text("Mouse Left: drag to add lines,\nMouse Right: drag to scroll, click for context menu.");
10064
10065 // Typically you would use a BeginChild()/EndChild() pair to benefit from a clipping region + own scrolling.
10066 // Here we demonstrate that this can be replaced by simple offsetting + custom drawing + PushClipRect/PopClipRect() calls.
10067 // To use a child window instead we could use, e.g:
10068 // ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Disable padding
10069 // ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, IM_COL32(50, 50, 50, 255)); // Set a background color
10070 // ImGui::BeginChild("canvas", ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
10071 // ImGui::PopStyleColor();
10072 // ImGui::PopStyleVar();
10073 // [...]
10074 // ImGui::EndChild();
10075
10076 // Using InvisibleButton() as a convenience 1) it will advance the layout cursor and 2) allows us to use IsItemHovered()/IsItemActive()
10077 ImVec2 canvas_p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos(); // ImDrawList API uses screen coordinates!
10078 ImVec2 canvas_sz = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail(); // Resize canvas to what's available
10079 if (canvas_sz.x < 50.0f) canvas_sz.x = 50.0f;
10080 if (canvas_sz.y < 50.0f) canvas_sz.y = 50.0f;
10081 ImVec2 canvas_p1 = ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + canvas_sz.x, canvas_p0.y + canvas_sz.y);
10082
10083 // Draw border and background color
10084 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
10085 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
10086 draw_list->AddRectFilled(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, IM_COL32(50, 50, 50, 255));
10087 draw_list->AddRect(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));
10088
10089 // This will catch our interactions
10090 ImGui::InvisibleButton("canvas", canvas_sz, ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight);
10091 const bool is_hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered(); // Hovered
10092 const bool is_active = ImGui::IsItemActive(); // Held
10093 const ImVec2 origin(canvas_p0.x + scrolling.x, canvas_p0.y + scrolling.y); // Lock scrolled origin
10094 const ImVec2 mouse_pos_in_canvas(io.MousePos.x - origin.x, io.MousePos.y - origin.y);
