10095
10096 // Add first and second point
10097 if (is_hovered && !adding_line && ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
10098 {
10099 points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
10100 points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
10101 adding_line = true;
10102 }
10103 if (adding_line)
10104 {
10105 points.back() = mouse_pos_in_canvas;
10106 if (!ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
10107 adding_line = false;
10108 }
10109
10110 // Pan (we use a zero mouse threshold when there's no context menu)
10111 // You may decide to make that threshold dynamic based on whether the mouse is hovering something etc.
10112 const float mouse_threshold_for_pan = opt_enable_context_menu ? -1.0f : 0.0f;
10113 if (is_active && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton_Right, mouse_threshold_for_pan))
10114 {
10115 scrolling.x += io.MouseDelta.x;
10116 scrolling.y += io.MouseDelta.y;
10117 }
10118
10119 // Context menu (under default mouse threshold)
10120 ImVec2 drag_delta = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton_Right);
10121 if (opt_enable_context_menu && drag_delta.x == 0.0f && drag_delta.y == 0.0f)
10122 ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
10123 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("context"))
10124 {
10125 if (adding_line)
10126 points.resize(points.size() - 2);
10127 adding_line = false;
10128 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Remove one", NULL, false, points.Size > 0)) { points.resize(points.size() - 2); }
10129 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Remove all", NULL, false, points.Size > 0)) { points.clear(); }
10130 ImGui::EndPopup();
10131 }
10132
10133 // Draw grid + all lines in the canvas
10134 draw_list->PushClipRect(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, true);
10135 if (opt_enable_grid)
10136 {
10137 const float GRID_STEP = 64.0f;
10138 for (float x = fmodf(scrolling.x, GRID_STEP); x < canvas_sz.x; x += GRID_STEP)
10139 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + x, canvas_p0.y), ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + x, canvas_p1.y), IM_COL32(200, 200, 200, 40));
10140 for (float y = fmodf(scrolling.y, GRID_STEP); y < canvas_sz.y; y += GRID_STEP)
10141 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_p0.x, canvas_p0.y + y), ImVec2(canvas_p1.x, canvas_p0.y + y), IM_COL32(200, 200, 200, 40));
10142 }
10143 for (int n = 0; n < points.Size; n += 2)
10144 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(origin.x + points[n].x, origin.y + points[n].y), ImVec2(origin.x + points[n + 1].x, origin.y + points[n + 1].y), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 2.0f);
10145 draw_list->PopClipRect();
10146
10147 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10148 }
10149
10150 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("BG/FG draw lists"))
10151 {
10152 static bool draw_bg = true;
10153 static bool draw_fg = true;
10154 ImGui::Checkbox("Draw in Background draw list", &draw_bg);
10155 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("The Background draw list will be rendered below every Dear ImGui windows.");
10156 ImGui::Checkbox("Draw in Foreground draw list", &draw_fg);
10157 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("The Foreground draw list will be rendered over every Dear ImGui windows.");
10158 ImVec2 window_pos = ImGui::GetWindowPos();
10159 ImVec2 window_size = ImGui::GetWindowSize();
10160 ImVec2 window_center = ImVec2(window_pos.x + window_size.x * 0.5f, window_pos.y + window_size.y * 0.5f);
10161 if (draw_bg)
10162 ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()->AddCircle(window_center, window_size.x * 0.6f, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200), 0, 10 + 4);
10163 if (draw_fg)
10164 ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddCircle(window_center, window_size.y * 0.6f, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 200), 0, 10);
10165 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10166 }
10167
10168 // Demonstrate out-of-order rendering via channels splitting
10169 // We use functions in ImDrawList as each draw list contains a convenience splitter,
10170 // but you can also instantiate your own ImDrawListSplitter if you need to nest them.
10171 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Draw Channels"))
10172 {
10173 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
10174 {
10175 ImGui::Text("Blue shape is drawn first: appears in back");
10176 ImGui::Text("Red shape is drawn after: appears in front");
10177 ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
10178 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p0.x, p0.y), ImVec2(p0.x + 50, p0.y + 50), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255)); // Blue
10179 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p0.x + 25, p0.y + 25), ImVec2(p0.x + 75, p0.y + 75), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255)); // Red
10180 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(75, 75));
10181 }
10182 ImGui::Separator();
10183 {
10184 ImGui::Text("Blue shape is drawn first, into channel 1: appears in front");
10185 ImGui::Text("Red shape is drawn after, into channel 0: appears in back");
10186 ImVec2 p1 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
10187
10188 // Create 2 channels and draw a Blue shape THEN a Red shape.
10189 // You can create any number of channels. Tables API use 1 channel per column in order to better batch draw calls.
10190 draw_list->ChannelsSplit(2);
10191 draw_list->ChannelsSetCurrent(1);
10192 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p1.x, p1.y), ImVec2(p1.x + 50, p1.y + 50), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255)); // Blue
10193 draw_list->ChannelsSetCurrent(0);
10194 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p1.x + 25, p1.y + 25), ImVec2(p1.x + 75, p1.y + 75), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255)); // Red
10195
10196 // Flatten/reorder channels. Red shape is in channel 0 and it appears below the Blue shape in channel 1.
10197 // This works by copying draw indices only (vertices are not copied).
10198 draw_list->ChannelsMerge();
10199 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(75, 75));
10200 ImGui::Text("After reordering, contents of channel 0 appears below channel 1.");
10201 }
10202 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10203 }
10204
10205 ImGui::EndTabBar();
10206 }
10207
10208 ImGui::End();
10209}
10210
10211//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10212// [SECTION] Example App: Docking, DockSpace / ShowExampleAppDockSpace()
10213//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10214
10215// Demonstrate using DockSpace() to create an explicit docking node within an existing window.
10216// Note: You can use most Docking facilities without calling any API. You DO NOT need to call DockSpace() to use Docking!
10217// - Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to disable docking.
10218// - Drag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).
10219// - When io.ConfigDockingWithShift == true, you instead need to hold SHIFT to enable docking.
10220// About dockspaces:
10221// - Use DockSpace() to create an explicit dock node _within_ an existing window.
10222// - Use DockSpaceOverViewport() to create an explicit dock node covering the screen or a specific viewport.
10223// This is often used with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode.
10224// - Important: Dockspaces need to be submitted _before_ any window they can host. Submit it early in your frame! (*)
10225// - Important: Dockspaces need to be kept alive if hidden, otherwise windows docked into it will be undocked.
10226// e.g. if you have multiple tabs with a dockspace inside each tab: submit the non-visible dockspaces with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly.
10227// (*) because of this constraint, the implicit \"Debug\" window can not be docked into an explicit DockSpace() node,
10228// because that window is submitted as part of the part of the NewFrame() call. An easy workaround is that you can create
10229// your own implicit "Debug##2" window after calling DockSpace() and leave it in the window stack for anyone to use.
10230void ShowExampleAppDockSpace(bool* p_open)
10231{
10232 // READ THIS !!!
10233 // TL;DR; this demo is more complicated than what most users you would normally use.
10234 // If we remove all options we are showcasing, this demo would become:
10235 // void ShowExampleAppDockSpace()
10236 // {
10237 // ImGui::DockSpaceOverViewport(0, ImGui::GetMainViewport());
10238 // }
10239 // In most cases you should be able to just call DockSpaceOverViewport() and ignore all the code below!
10240 // In this specific demo, we are not using DockSpaceOverViewport() because:
10241 // - (1) we allow the host window to be floating/moveable instead of filling the viewport (when opt_fullscreen == false)
10242 // - (2) we allow the host window to have padding (when opt_padding == true)
10243 // - (3) we expose many flags and need a way to have them visible.
10244 // - (4) we have a local menu bar in the host window (vs. you could use BeginMainMenuBar() + DockSpaceOverViewport()
10245 // in your code, but we don't here because we allow the window to be floating)
10246
10247 static bool opt_fullscreen = true;
10248 static bool opt_padding = false;
10249 static ImGuiDockNodeFlags dockspace_flags = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None;
10250
10251 // We are using the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking flag to make the parent window not dockable into,
10252 // because it would be confusing to have two docking targets within each others.
10253 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
10254 if (opt_fullscreen)
10255 {
10256 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
10257 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(viewport->WorkPos);
10258 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(viewport->WorkSize);
10259 ImGui::SetNextWindowViewport(viewport->ID);
10260 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, 0.0f);
10261 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize, 0.0f);
10262 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
10263 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus;
10264 }
10265 else
10266 {
10267 dockspace_flags &= ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode;
10268 }
10269
10270 // When using ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode, DockSpace() will render our background
10271 // and handle the pass-thru hole, so we ask Begin() to not render a background.
10272 if (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode)
10273 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground;
10274
10275 // Important: note that we proceed even if Begin() returns false (aka window is collapsed).
10276 // This is because we want to keep our DockSpace() active. If a DockSpace() is inactive,
10277 // all active windows docked into it will lose their parent and become undocked.
10278 // We cannot preserve the docking relationship between an active window and an inactive docking, otherwise
10279 // any change of dockspace/settings would lead to windows being stuck in limbo and never being visible.
10280 if (!opt_padding)
10281 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
10282 ImGui::Begin("DockSpace Demo", p_open, window_flags);
10283 if (!opt_padding)
10284 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
10285
10286 if (opt_fullscreen)
10287 ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
10288
10289 // Submit the DockSpace
10290 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
10291 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable)
10292 {
10293 ImGuiID dockspace_id = ImGui::GetID("MyDockSpace");
10294 ImGui::DockSpace(dockspace_id, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), dockspace_flags);
10295 }
10296 else
10297 {
10298 ShowDockingDisabledMessage();
10299 }
10300
10301 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
10302 {
10303 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Options"))
10304 {
10305 // Disabling fullscreen would allow the window to be moved to the front of other windows,
10306 // which we can't undo at the moment without finer window depth/z control.
10307 ImGui::MenuItem("Fullscreen", NULL, &opt_fullscreen);
10308 ImGui::MenuItem("Padding", NULL, &opt_padding);
10309 ImGui::Separator();
10310
10311 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Flag: NoDockingOverCentralNode", "", (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode) != 0)) { dockspace_flags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode; }
10312 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Flag: NoDockingSplit", "", (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit) != 0)) { dockspace_flags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit; }
10313 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Flag: NoUndocking", "", (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoUndocking) != 0)) { dockspace_flags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoUndocking; }
10314 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Flag: NoResize", "", (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize) != 0)) { dockspace_flags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize; }
10315 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Flag: AutoHideTabBar", "", (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar) != 0)) { dockspace_flags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar; }
10316 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Flag: PassthruCentralNode", "", (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode) != 0, opt_fullscreen)) { dockspace_flags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode; }
10317 ImGui::Separator();
10318
10319 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close", NULL, false, p_open != NULL))
10320 *p_open = false;
10321 ImGui::EndMenu();
10322 }
10323 HelpMarker(
10324 "When docking is enabled, you can ALWAYS dock MOST window into another! Try it now!" "\n"
10325 "- Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock." "\n"
10326 "- Drag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows)." "\n"
10327 "- Hold SHIFT to disable docking (if io.ConfigDockingWithShift == false, default)" "\n"
10328 "- Hold SHIFT to enable docking (if io.ConfigDockingWithShift == true)" "\n"
10329 "This demo app has nothing to do with enabling docking!" "\n\n"
10330 "This demo app only demonstrate the use of ImGui::DockSpace() which allows you to manually create a docking node _within_ another window." "\n\n"
10331 "Read comments in ShowExampleAppDockSpace() for more details.");
10332
10333 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
10334 }
10335
10336 ImGui::End();
10337}
10338
10339//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10340// [SECTION] Example App: Documents Handling / ShowExampleAppDocuments()
10341//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10342
10343// Simplified structure to mimic a Document model
10344struct MyDocument
10345{
10346 char Name[32]; // Document title
10347 int UID; // Unique ID (necessary as we can change title)
10348 bool Open; // Set when open (we keep an array of all available documents to simplify demo code!)
10349 bool OpenPrev; // Copy of Open from last update.
10350 bool Dirty; // Set when the document has been modified
10351 ImVec4 Color; // An arbitrary variable associated to the document
10352
10353 MyDocument(int uid, const char* name, bool open = true, const ImVec4& color = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f))
10354 {
10355 UID = uid;
10356 snprintf(Name, sizeof(Name), "%s", name);
10357 Open = OpenPrev = open;
10358 Dirty = false;
10359 Color = color;
10360 }
10361 void DoOpen() { Open = true; }
10362 void DoForceClose() { Open = false; Dirty = false; }
10363 void DoSave() { Dirty = false; }
10364};
10365
10366struct ExampleAppDocuments
10367{
10368 ImVector<MyDocument> Documents;
10369 ImVector<MyDocument*> CloseQueue;
10370 MyDocument* RenamingDoc = NULL;
10371 bool RenamingStarted = false;
10372
10373 ExampleAppDocuments()
10374 {
10375 Documents.push_back(MyDocument(0, "Lettuce", true, ImVec4(0.4f, 0.8f, 0.4f, 1.0f)));
10376 Documents.push_back(MyDocument(1, "Eggplant", true, ImVec4(0.8f, 0.5f, 1.0f, 1.0f)));
10377 Documents.push_back(MyDocument(2, "Carrot", true, ImVec4(1.0f, 0.8f, 0.5f, 1.0f)));
10378 Documents.push_back(MyDocument(3, "Tomato", false, ImVec4(1.0f, 0.3f, 0.4f, 1.0f)));
10379 Documents.push_back(MyDocument(4, "A Rather Long Title", false, ImVec4(0.4f, 0.8f, 0.8f, 1.0f)));
10380 Documents.push_back(MyDocument(5, "Some Document", false, ImVec4(0.8f, 0.8f, 1.0f, 1.0f)));
10381 }
10382
10383 // As we allow to change document name, we append a never-changing document ID so tabs are stable
10384 void GetTabName(MyDocument* doc, char* out_buf, size_t out_buf_size)
10385 {
10386 snprintf(out_buf, out_buf_size, "%s###doc%d", doc->Name, doc->UID);
10387 }
10388
10389 // Display placeholder contents for the Document
10390 void DisplayDocContents(MyDocument* doc)
10391 {
10392 ImGui::PushID(doc);
10393 ImGui::Text("Document \"%s\"", doc->Name);
10394 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, doc->Color);
10395 ImGui::TextWrapped("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.");
10396 ImGui::PopStyleColor();
10397
10398 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_R, ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
10399 if (ImGui::Button("Rename.."))
10400 {
10401 RenamingDoc = doc;
10402 RenamingStarted = true;
10403 }
10404 ImGui::SameLine();
10405
10406 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_M, ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
10407 if (ImGui::Button("Modify"))
10408 doc->Dirty = true;
10409
10410 ImGui::SameLine();
10411 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_S, ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
10412 if (ImGui::Button("Save"))
10413 doc->DoSave();
10414
10415 ImGui::SameLine();
10416 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_W, ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
10417 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
10418 CloseQueue.push_back(doc);
10419 ImGui::ColorEdit3("color", &doc->Color.x); // Useful to test drag and drop and hold-dragged-to-open-tab behavior.
10420 ImGui::PopID();
10421 }
10422
10423 // Display context menu for the Document
10424 void DisplayDocContextMenu(MyDocument* doc)
10425 {
10426 if (!ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
10427 return;
10428
10429 char buf[256];
10430 sprintf(buf, "Save %s", doc->Name);
10431 if (ImGui::MenuItem(buf, "Ctrl+S", false, doc->Open))
10432 doc->DoSave();
10433 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Rename...", "Ctrl+R", false, doc->Open))
10434 RenamingDoc = doc;
10435 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close", "Ctrl+W", false, doc->Open))
10436 CloseQueue.push_back(doc);
10437 ImGui::EndPopup();
10438 }
10439
10440 // [Optional] Notify the system of Tabs/Windows closure that happened outside the regular tab interface.
10441 // If a tab has been closed programmatically (aka closed from another source such as the Checkbox() in the demo,
10442 // as opposed to clicking on the regular tab closing button) and stops being submitted, it will take a frame for
10443 // the tab bar to notice its absence. During this frame there will be a gap in the tab bar, and if the tab that has
10444 // disappeared was the selected one, the tab bar will report no selected tab during the frame. This will effectively
10445 // give the impression of a flicker for one frame.
10446 // We call SetTabItemClosed() to manually notify the Tab Bar or Docking system of removed tabs to avoid this glitch.
10447 // Note that this completely optional, and only affect tab bars with the ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable flag.
10448 void NotifyOfDocumentsClosedElsewhere()
10449 {
10450 for (MyDocument& doc : Documents)
10451 {
10452 if (!doc.Open && doc.OpenPrev)
10453 ImGui::SetTabItemClosed(doc.Name);
10454 doc.OpenPrev = doc.Open;
10455 }
10456 }
10457};
10458
10459void ShowExampleAppDocuments(bool* p_open)
10460{
10461 static ExampleAppDocuments app;
10462
10463 // Options
10464 enum Target
10465 {
10466 Target_None,
10467 Target_Tab, // Create documents as local tab into a local tab bar
10468 Target_DockSpaceAndWindow // Create documents as regular windows, and create an embedded dockspace
10469 };
10470 static Target opt_target = Target_Tab;
10471 static bool opt_reorderable = true;
10472 static ImGuiTabBarFlags opt_fitting_flags = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
10473
10474 // When (opt_target == Target_DockSpaceAndWindow) there is the possibily that one of our child Document window (e.g. "Eggplant")
10475 // that we emit gets docked into the same spot as the parent window ("Example: Documents").
10476 // This would create a problematic feedback loop because selecting the "Eggplant" tab would make the "Example: Documents" tab
10477 // not visible, which in turn would stop submitting the "Eggplant" window.
10478 // We avoid this problem by submitting our documents window even if our parent window is not currently visible.
10479 // Another solution may be to make the "Example: Documents" window use the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking.
10480
10481 bool window_contents_visible = ImGui::Begin("Example: Documents", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar);
10482 if (!window_contents_visible && opt_target != Target_DockSpaceAndWindow)
10483 {
10484 ImGui::End();
10485 return;
10486 }
10487
10488 // Menu
10489 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
10490 {
10491 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
10492 {
10493 int open_count = 0;
10494 for (MyDocument& doc : app.Documents)
10495 open_count += doc.Open ? 1 : 0;
10496
10497 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Open", open_count < app.Documents.Size))
10498 {
10499 for (MyDocument& doc : app.Documents)
10500 if (!doc.Open && ImGui::MenuItem(doc.Name))
10501 doc.DoOpen();
10502 ImGui::EndMenu();
10503 }
10504 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close All Documents", NULL, false, open_count > 0))
10505 for (MyDocument& doc : app.Documents)
10506 app.CloseQueue.push_back(&doc);
10507 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Exit") && p_open)
10508 *p_open = false;
10509 ImGui::EndMenu();
10510 }
10511 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
10512 }
10513
10514 // [Debug] List documents with one checkbox for each
10515 for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
10516 {
10517 MyDocument& doc = app.Documents[doc_n];
10518 if (doc_n > 0)
10519 ImGui::SameLine();
10520 ImGui::PushID(&doc);
10521 if (ImGui::Checkbox(doc.Name, &doc.Open))
10522 if (!doc.Open)
10523 doc.DoForceClose();
10524 ImGui::PopID();
10525 }
10526 ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 12);
10527 ImGui::Combo("Output", (int*)&opt_target, "None\0TabBar+Tabs\0DockSpace+Window\0");
10528 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
10529 bool redock_all = false;
10530 if (opt_target == Target_Tab) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Checkbox("Reorderable Tabs", &opt_reorderable); }
10531 if (opt_target == Target_DockSpaceAndWindow) { ImGui::SameLine(); redock_all = ImGui::Button("Redock all"); }
10532
10533 ImGui::Separator();
10534
10535 // About the ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument / ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument flags.
10536 // They have multiple effects:
10537 // - Display a dot next to the title.
10538 // - Tab is selected when clicking the X close button.
10539 // - Closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab).
10540 // Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.
10541 // We need to assume closure by default otherwise waiting for "lack of submission" on the next frame would leave an empty
10542 // hole for one-frame, both in the tab-bar and in tab-contents when closing a tab/window.
10543 // The rarely used SetTabItemClosed() function is a way to notify of programmatic closure to avoid the one-frame hole.
10544
10545 // Tabs
10546 if (opt_target == Target_Tab)
10547 {
10548 ImGuiTabBarFlags tab_bar_flags = (opt_fitting_flags) | (opt_reorderable ? ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable : 0);
10549 tab_bar_flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_DrawSelectedOverline;
10550 if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##tabs", tab_bar_flags))
10551 {
10552 if (opt_reorderable)
10553 app.NotifyOfDocumentsClosedElsewhere();
10554
10555 // [DEBUG] Stress tests
10556 //if ((ImGui::GetFrameCount() % 30) == 0) docs[1].Open ^= 1; // [DEBUG] Automatically show/hide a tab. Test various interactions e.g. dragging with this on.
10557 //if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl) ImGui::SetTabItemSelected(docs[1].Name); // [DEBUG] Test SetTabItemSelected(), probably not very useful as-is anyway..
10558
10559 // Submit Tabs
10560 for (MyDocument& doc : app.Documents)
10561 {
10562 if (!doc.Open)
10563 continue;
10564
10565 // As we allow to change document name, we append a never-changing document id so tabs are stable
10566 char doc_name_buf[64];
10567 app.GetTabName(&doc, doc_name_buf, sizeof(doc_name_buf));
10568 ImGuiTabItemFlags tab_flags = (doc.Dirty ? ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument : 0);
10569 bool visible = ImGui::BeginTabItem(doc_name_buf, &doc.Open, tab_flags);
10570
10571 // Cancel attempt to close when unsaved add to save queue so we can display a popup.
10572 if (!doc.Open && doc.Dirty)
10573 {
10574 doc.Open = true;
10575 app.CloseQueue.push_back(&doc);
10576 }
10577
10578 app.DisplayDocContextMenu(&doc);
10579 if (visible)
10580 {
10581 app.DisplayDocContents(&doc);
10582 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10583 }
10584 }
10585
10586 ImGui::EndTabBar();
10587 }
10588 }
10589 else if (opt_target == Target_DockSpaceAndWindow)
10590 {
10591 if (ImGui::GetIO().ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable)
10592 {
10593 app.NotifyOfDocumentsClosedElsewhere();
10594
10595 // Create a DockSpace node where any window can be docked
10596 ImGuiID dockspace_id = ImGui::GetID("MyDockSpace");
10597 ImGui::DockSpace(dockspace_id);
10598
10599 // Create Windows
10600 for (int doc_n = 0; doc_n < app.Documents.Size; doc_n++)
10601 {
10602 MyDocument* doc = &app.Documents[doc_n];
10603 if (!doc->Open)
10604 continue;
10605
10606 ImGui::SetNextWindowDockID(dockspace_id, redock_all ? ImGuiCond_Always : ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
10607 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = (doc->Dirty ? ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument : 0);
10608 bool visible = ImGui::Begin(doc->Name, &doc->Open, window_flags);
10609
10610 // Cancel attempt to close when unsaved add to save queue so we can display a popup.
10611 if (!doc->Open && doc->Dirty)
10612 {
10613 doc->Open = true;
10614 app.CloseQueue.push_back(doc);
10615 }
10616
10617 app.DisplayDocContextMenu(doc);
10618 if (visible)
10619 app.DisplayDocContents(doc);
10620
10621 ImGui::End();
10622 }
10623 }
10624 else
10625 {
10626 ShowDockingDisabledMessage();
10627 }
10628 }
10629
10630 // Early out other contents
10631 if (!window_contents_visible)
10632 {
10633 ImGui::End();
10634 return;
10635 }
10636
10637 // Display renaming UI
10638 if (app.RenamingDoc != NULL)
10639 {
10640 if (app.RenamingStarted)
10641 ImGui::OpenPopup("Rename");
10642 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("Rename"))
10643 {
10644 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 30);
10645 if (ImGui::InputText("###Name", app.RenamingDoc->Name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(app.RenamingDoc->Name), ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue))
10646 {
10647 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
10648 app.RenamingDoc = NULL;
10649 }
10650 if (app.RenamingStarted)
10651 ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1);
10652 ImGui::EndPopup();
10653 }
10654 else
10655 {
10656 app.RenamingDoc = NULL;
10657 }
10658 app.RenamingStarted = false;
10659 }
10660
10661 // Display closing confirmation UI
10662 if (!app.CloseQueue.empty())
10663 {
10664 int close_queue_unsaved_documents = 0;
10665 for (int n = 0; n < app.CloseQueue.Size; n++)
10666 if (app.CloseQueue[n]->Dirty)
10667 close_queue_unsaved_documents++;
10668
10669 if (close_queue_unsaved_documents == 0)
10670 {
10671 // Close documents when all are unsaved
10672 for (int n = 0; n < app.CloseQueue.Size; n++)
10673 app.CloseQueue[n]->DoForceClose();
10674 app.CloseQueue.clear();
10675 }
10676 else
10677 {
10678 if (!ImGui::IsPopupOpen("Save?"))
10679 ImGui::OpenPopup("Save?");
10680 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Save?", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
10681 {
10682 ImGui::Text("Save change to the following items?");
10683 float item_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
10684 if (ImGui::BeginChild(ImGui::GetID("frame"), ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 6.25f * item_height), ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle))
10685 for (MyDocument* doc : app.CloseQueue)
10686 if (doc->Dirty)
10687 ImGui::Text("%s", doc->Name);
10688 ImGui::EndChild();
10689
10690 ImVec2 button_size(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 7.0f, 0.0f);
10691 if (ImGui::Button("Yes", button_size))
10692 {
10693 for (MyDocument* doc : app.CloseQueue)
10694 {
10695 if (doc->Dirty)
10696 doc->DoSave();
10697 doc->DoForceClose();
10698 }
10699 app.CloseQueue.clear();
10700 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
10701 }
10702 ImGui::SameLine();
10703 if (ImGui::Button("No", button_size))
10704 {
10705 for (MyDocument* doc : app.CloseQueue)
10706 doc->DoForceClose();
10707 app.CloseQueue.clear();
10708 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
10709 }
10710 ImGui::SameLine();
10711 if (ImGui::Button("Cancel", button_size))
10712 {
10713 app.CloseQueue.clear();
10714 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
10715 }
10716 ImGui::EndPopup();
10717 }
10718 }
10719 }
10720
10721 ImGui::End();
10722}
10723
10724//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10725// [SECTION] Example App: Assets Browser / ShowExampleAppAssetsBrowser()
10726//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10727
10728//#include "imgui_internal.h" // NavMoveRequestTryWrapping()
10729
10730struct ExampleAsset
10731{
10732 ImGuiID ID;
10733 int Type;
10734
10735 ExampleAsset(ImGuiID id, int type) { ID = id; Type = type; }
10736
10737 static const ImGuiTableSortSpecs* s_current_sort_specs;
10738
10739 static void SortWithSortSpecs(ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sort_specs, ExampleAsset* items, int items_count)
10740 {
10741 s_current_sort_specs = sort_specs; // Store in variable accessible by the sort function.
10742 if (items_count > 1)
10743 qsort(items, (size_t)items_count, sizeof(items[0]), ExampleAsset::CompareWithSortSpecs);
10744 s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
10745 }
10746
10747 // Compare function to be used by qsort()
10748 static int IMGUI_CDECL CompareWithSortSpecs(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
10749 {
10750 const ExampleAsset* a = (const ExampleAsset*)lhs;
10751 const ExampleAsset* b = (const ExampleAsset*)rhs;
10752 for (int n = 0; n < s_current_sort_specs->SpecsCount; n++)
10753 {
10754 const ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs* sort_spec = &s_current_sort_specs->Specs[n];
10755 int delta = 0;
10756 if (sort_spec->ColumnIndex == 0)
10757 delta = ((int)a->ID - (int)b->ID);
10758 else if (sort_spec->ColumnIndex == 1)
10759 delta = (a->Type - b->Type);
10760 if (delta > 0)
10761 return (sort_spec->SortDirection == ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending) ? +1 : -1;
10762 if (delta < 0)
10763 return (sort_spec->SortDirection == ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending) ? -1 : +1;
10764 }
10765 return ((int)a->ID - (int)b->ID);
10766 }
10767};
10768const ImGuiTableSortSpecs* ExampleAsset::s_current_sort_specs = NULL;
10769
10770struct ExampleAssetsBrowser
10771{
10772 // Options
10773 bool ShowTypeOverlay = true;
10774 bool AllowSorting = true;
10775 bool AllowDragUnselected = false;
10776 bool AllowBoxSelect = true;
10777 float IconSize = 32.0f;
10778 int IconSpacing = 10;
10779 int IconHitSpacing = 4; // Increase hit-spacing if you want to make it possible to clear or box-select from gaps. Some spacing is required to able to amend with Shift+box-select. Value is small in Explorer.
10780 bool StretchSpacing = true;
10781
10782 // State
10783 ImVector<ExampleAsset> Items; // Our items
10784 ExampleSelectionWithDeletion Selection; // Our selection (ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage + helper funcs to handle deletion)
10785 ImGuiID NextItemId = 0; // Unique identifier when creating new items
10786 bool RequestDelete = false; // Deferred deletion request
10787 bool RequestSort = false; // Deferred sort request
10788 float ZoomWheelAccum = 0.0f; // Mouse wheel accumulator to handle smooth wheels better
10789
10790 // Calculated sizes for layout, output of UpdateLayoutSizes(). Could be locals but our code is simpler this way.
10791 ImVec2 LayoutItemSize;
10792 ImVec2 LayoutItemStep; // == LayoutItemSize + LayoutItemSpacing
10793 float LayoutItemSpacing = 0.0f;
10794 float LayoutSelectableSpacing = 0.0f;
10795 float LayoutOuterPadding = 0.0f;
10796 int LayoutColumnCount = 0;
10797 int LayoutLineCount = 0;
10798
10799 // Functions
10800 ExampleAssetsBrowser()
10801 {
10802 AddItems(10000);
10803 }
10804 void AddItems(int count)
10805 {
10806 if (Items.Size == 0)
10807 NextItemId = 0;
10808 Items.reserve(Items.Size + count);
10809 for (int n = 0; n < count; n++, NextItemId++)
10810 Items.push_back(ExampleAsset(NextItemId, (NextItemId % 20) < 15 ? 0 : (NextItemId % 20) < 18 ? 1 : 2));
10811 RequestSort = true;
10812 }
10813 void ClearItems()
10814 {
10815 Items.clear();
10816 Selection.Clear();
10817 }
10818
10819 // Logic would be written in the main code BeginChild() and outputting to local variables.
10820 // We extracted it into a function so we can call it easily from multiple places.
10821 void UpdateLayoutSizes(float avail_width)
10822 {
10823 // Layout: when not stretching: allow extending into right-most spacing.
10824 LayoutItemSpacing = (float)IconSpacing;
10825 if (StretchSpacing == false)
10826 avail_width += floorf(LayoutItemSpacing * 0.5f);
10827
10828 // Layout: calculate number of icon per line and number of lines
10829 LayoutItemSize = ImVec2(floorf(IconSize), floorf(IconSize));
10830 LayoutColumnCount = IM_MAX((int)(avail_width / (LayoutItemSize.x + LayoutItemSpacing)), 1);
10831 LayoutLineCount = (Items.Size + LayoutColumnCount - 1) / LayoutColumnCount;
10832
10833 // Layout: when stretching: allocate remaining space to more spacing. Round before division, so item_spacing may be non-integer.
10834 if (StretchSpacing && LayoutColumnCount > 1)
10835 LayoutItemSpacing = floorf(avail_width - LayoutItemSize.x * LayoutColumnCount) / LayoutColumnCount;
10836
10837 LayoutItemStep = ImVec2(LayoutItemSize.x + LayoutItemSpacing, LayoutItemSize.y + LayoutItemSpacing);
10838 LayoutSelectableSpacing = IM_MAX(floorf(LayoutItemSpacing) - IconHitSpacing, 0.0f);
10839 LayoutOuterPadding = floorf(LayoutItemSpacing * 0.5f);
10840 }
10841
10842 void Draw(const char* title, bool* p_open)
10843 {
10844 ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(IconSize * 25, IconSize * 15), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
10845 if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
10846 {
10847 ImGui::End();
10848 return;
10849 }
10850
10851 // Menu bar
10852 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
10853 {
10854 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
10855 {
10856 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Add 10000 items"))
10857 AddItems(10000);
10858 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Clear items"))
10859 ClearItems();
10860 ImGui::Separator();
10861 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close", NULL, false, p_open != NULL))
10862 *p_open = false;
10863 ImGui::EndMenu();
10864 }
10865 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Edit"))
10866 {
10867 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Delete", "Del", false, Selection.Size > 0))
10868 RequestDelete = true;
10869 ImGui::EndMenu();
10870 }
10871 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Options"))
10872 {
10873 ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 10);
10874
10875 ImGui::SeparatorText("Contents");
10876 ImGui::Checkbox("Show Type Overlay", &ShowTypeOverlay);
10877 ImGui::Checkbox("Allow Sorting", &AllowSorting);
10878
10879 ImGui::SeparatorText("Selection Behavior");
10880 ImGui::Checkbox("Allow dragging unselected item", &AllowDragUnselected);
10881 ImGui::Checkbox("Allow box-selection", &AllowBoxSelect);
10882
10883 ImGui::SeparatorText("Layout");
10884 ImGui::SliderFloat("Icon Size", &IconSize, 16.0f, 128.0f, "%.0f");
10885 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Use CTRL+Wheel to zoom");
10886 ImGui::SliderInt("Icon Spacing", &IconSpacing, 0, 32);
10887 ImGui::SliderInt("Icon Hit Spacing", &IconHitSpacing, 0, 32);
10888 ImGui::Checkbox("Stretch Spacing", &StretchSpacing);
10889 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
10890 ImGui::EndMenu();
10891 }
10892 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
10893 }
10894
10895 // Show a table with ONLY one header row to showcase the idea/possibility of using this to provide a sorting UI
10896 if (AllowSorting)
10897 {
10898 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
10899 ImGuiTableFlags table_flags_for_sort_specs = ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable | ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_Borders;
10900 if (ImGui::BeginTable("for_sort_specs_only", 2, table_flags_for_sort_specs, ImVec2(0.0f, ImGui::GetFrameHeight())))
10901 {
10902 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Index");
10903 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Type");
10904 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
10905 if (ImGuiTableSortSpecs* sort_specs = ImGui::TableGetSortSpecs())
10906 if (sort_specs->SpecsDirty || RequestSort)
10907 {
10908 ExampleAsset::SortWithSortSpecs(sort_specs, Items.Data, Items.Size);
10909 sort_specs->SpecsDirty = RequestSort = false;
10910 }
10911 ImGui::EndTable();
10912 }
10913 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
10914 }
10915
10916 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
10917 ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(0.0f, LayoutOuterPadding + LayoutLineCount * (LayoutItemSize.y + LayoutItemSpacing)));
10918 if (ImGui::BeginChild("Assets", ImVec2(0.0f, -ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
10919 {
10920 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
10921
10922 const float avail_width = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x;
10923 UpdateLayoutSizes(avail_width);
10924
10925 // Calculate and store start position.
10926 ImVec2 start_pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
10927 start_pos = ImVec2(start_pos.x + LayoutOuterPadding, start_pos.y + LayoutOuterPadding);
10928 ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(start_pos);
10929
10930 // Multi-select
10931 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags ms_flags = ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnClickVoid;
10932
10933 // - Enable box-select (in 2D mode, so that changing box-select rectangle X1/X2 boundaries will affect clipped items)
10934 if (AllowBoxSelect)
10935 ms_flags |= ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d;
10936
10937 // - This feature allows dragging an unselected item without selecting it (rarely used)
10938 if (AllowDragUnselected)
10939 ms_flags |= ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease;
10940
10941 // - Enable keyboard wrapping on X axis
10942 // (FIXME-MULTISELECT: We haven't designed/exposed a general nav wrapping api yet, so this flag is provided as a courtesy to avoid doing:
10943 // ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGui::GetCurrentWindow(), ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX);
10944 // When we finish implementing a more general API for this, we will obsolete this flag in favor of the new system)
10945 ms_flags |= ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NavWrapX;
10946
10947 ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io = ImGui::BeginMultiSelect(ms_flags, Selection.Size, Items.Size);
10948
10949 // Use custom selection adapter: store ID in selection (recommended)
10950 Selection.UserData = this;
10951 Selection.AdapterIndexToStorageId = [](ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* self_, int idx) { ExampleAssetsBrowser* self = (ExampleAssetsBrowser*)self_->UserData; return self->Items[idx].ID; };
10952 Selection.ApplyRequests(ms_io);
10953
10954 const bool want_delete = (ImGui::Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Delete, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat) && (Selection.Size > 0)) || RequestDelete;
10955 const int item_curr_idx_to_focus = want_delete ? Selection.ApplyDeletionPreLoop(ms_io, Items.Size) : -1;
10956 RequestDelete = false;
10957
10958 // Push LayoutSelectableSpacing (which is LayoutItemSpacing minus hit-spacing, if we decide to have hit gaps between items)
10959 // Altering style ItemSpacing may seem unnecessary as we position every items using SetCursorScreenPos()...
10960 // But it is necessary for two reasons:
10961 // - Selectables uses it by default to visually fill the space between two items.
10962 // - The vertical spacing would be measured by Clipper to calculate line height if we didn't provide it explicitly (here we do).
10963 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(LayoutSelectableSpacing, LayoutSelectableSpacing));
10964
10965 // Rendering parameters
10966 const ImU32 icon_type_overlay_colors[3] = { 0, IM_COL32(200, 70, 70, 255), IM_COL32(70, 170, 70, 255) };
10967 const ImU32 icon_bg_color = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(35, 35, 35, 220));
10968 const ImVec2 icon_type_overlay_size = ImVec2(4.0f, 4.0f);
10969 const bool display_label = (LayoutItemSize.x >= ImGui::CalcTextSize("999").x);
10970
10971 const int column_count = LayoutColumnCount;
10972 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
10973 clipper.Begin(LayoutLineCount, LayoutItemStep.y);
10974 if (item_curr_idx_to_focus != -1)
10975 clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(item_curr_idx_to_focus / column_count); // Ensure focused item line is not clipped.
10976 if (ms_io->RangeSrcItem != -1)
10977 clipper.IncludeItemByIndex((int)ms_io->RangeSrcItem / column_count); // Ensure RangeSrc item line is not clipped.
10978 while (clipper.Step())
10979 {
10980 for (int line_idx = clipper.DisplayStart; line_idx < clipper.DisplayEnd; line_idx++)
10981 {
10982 const int item_min_idx_for_current_line = line_idx * column_count;
10983 const int item_max_idx_for_current_line = IM_MIN((line_idx + 1) * column_count, Items.Size);
10984 for (int item_idx = item_min_idx_for_current_line; item_idx < item_max_idx_for_current_line; ++item_idx)
10985 {
10986 ExampleAsset* item_data = &Items[item_idx];
10987 ImGui::PushID((int)item_data->ID);
10988
10989 // Position item
10990 ImVec2 pos = ImVec2(start_pos.x + (item_idx % column_count) * LayoutItemStep.x, start_pos.y + line_idx * LayoutItemStep.y);
10991 ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(pos);
10992
10993 ImGui::SetNextItemSelectionUserData(item_idx);
10994 bool item_is_selected = Selection.Contains((ImGuiID)item_data->ID);
10995 bool item_is_visible = ImGui::IsRectVisible(LayoutItemSize);
10996 ImGui::Selectable("", item_is_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags_None, LayoutItemSize);
10997
10998 // Update our selection state immediately (without waiting for EndMultiSelect() requests)
10999 // because we use this to alter the color of our text/icon.
11000 if (ImGui::IsItemToggledSelection())
11001 item_is_selected = !item_is_selected;
11002
11003 // Focus (for after deletion)
11004 if (item_curr_idx_to_focus == item_idx)
11005 ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1);
11006
11007 // Drag and drop
11008 if (ImGui::BeginDragDropSource())
11009 {
11010 // Create payload with full selection OR single unselected item.
11011 // (the later is only possible when using ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease)
11012 if (ImGui::GetDragDropPayload() == NULL)
11013 {
11014 ImVector<ImGuiID> payload_items;
11015 void* it = NULL;
11016 ImGuiID id = 0;
11017 if (!item_is_selected)
11018 payload_items.push_back(item_data->ID);
11019 else
11020 while (Selection.GetNextSelectedItem(&it, &id))
11021 payload_items.push_back(id);
11022 ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("ASSETS_BROWSER_ITEMS", payload_items.Data, (size_t)payload_items.size_in_bytes());
11023 }
11024
11025 // Display payload content in tooltip, by extracting it from the payload data
11026 // (we could read from selection, but it is more correct and reusable to read from payload)
11027 const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::GetDragDropPayload();
11028 const int payload_count = (int)payload->DataSize / (int)sizeof(ImGuiID);
11029 ImGui::Text("%d assets", payload_count);
11030
11031 ImGui::EndDragDropSource();
11032 }
11033
11034 // Render icon (a real app would likely display an image/thumbnail here)
11035 // Because we use ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d, clipping vertical may occasionally be larger, so we coarse-clip our rendering as well.
11036 if (item_is_visible)
11037 {
11038 ImVec2 box_min(pos.x - 1, pos.y - 1);
11039 ImVec2 box_max(box_min.x + LayoutItemSize.x + 2, box_min.y + LayoutItemSize.y + 2); // Dubious
11040 draw_list->AddRectFilled(box_min, box_max, icon_bg_color); // Background color
11041 if (ShowTypeOverlay && item_data->Type != 0)
11042 {
11043 ImU32 type_col = icon_type_overlay_colors[item_data->Type % IM_ARRAYSIZE(icon_type_overlay_colors)];
11044 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(box_max.x - 2 - icon_type_overlay_size.x, box_min.y + 2), ImVec2(box_max.x - 2, box_min.y + 2 + icon_type_overlay_size.y), type_col);
11045 }
11046 if (display_label)
11047 {
11048 ImU32 label_col = ImGui::GetColorU32(item_is_selected ? ImGuiCol_Text : ImGuiCol_TextDisabled);
11049 char label[32];
11050 sprintf(label, "%d", item_data->ID);
11051 draw_list->AddText(ImVec2(box_min.x, box_max.y - ImGui::GetFontSize()), label_col, label);
11052 }
11053 }
11054
11055 ImGui::PopID();
11056 }
11057 }
11058 }
11059 clipper.End();
11060 ImGui::PopStyleVar(); // ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing
11061
11062 // Context menu
11063 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
11064 {
11065 ImGui::Text("Selection: %d items", Selection.Size);
11066 ImGui::Separator();
11067 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Delete", "Del", false, Selection.Size > 0))
11068 RequestDelete = true;
11069 ImGui::EndPopup();
11070 }
11071
11072 ms_io = ImGui::EndMultiSelect();
11073 Selection.ApplyRequests(ms_io);
11074 if (want_delete)
11075 Selection.ApplyDeletionPostLoop(ms_io, Items, item_curr_idx_to_focus);
11076
11077 // Zooming with CTRL+Wheel
11078 if (ImGui::IsWindowAppearing())
11079 ZoomWheelAccum = 0.0f;
11080 if (ImGui::IsWindowHovered() && io.MouseWheel != 0.0f && ImGui::IsKeyDown(ImGuiMod_Ctrl) && ImGui::IsAnyItemActive() == false)
11081 {
11082 ZoomWheelAccum += io.MouseWheel;
11083 if (fabsf(ZoomWheelAccum) >= 1.0f)
11084 {
11085 // Calculate hovered item index from mouse location
11086 // FIXME: Locking aiming on 'hovered_item_idx' (with a cool-down timer) would ensure zoom keeps on it.
11087 const float hovered_item_nx = (io.MousePos.x - start_pos.x + LayoutItemSpacing * 0.5f) / LayoutItemStep.x;
11088 const float hovered_item_ny = (io.MousePos.y - start_pos.y + LayoutItemSpacing * 0.5f) / LayoutItemStep.y;
11089 const int hovered_item_idx = ((int)hovered_item_ny * LayoutColumnCount) + (int)hovered_item_nx;
11090 //ImGui::SetTooltip("%f,%f -> item %d", hovered_item_nx, hovered_item_ny, hovered_item_idx); // Move those 4 lines in block above for easy debugging
11091
11092 // Zoom
11093 IconSize *= powf(1.1f, (float)(int)ZoomWheelAccum);
11094 IconSize = IM_CLAMP(IconSize, 16.0f, 128.0f);
11095 ZoomWheelAccum -= (int)ZoomWheelAccum;
11096 UpdateLayoutSizes(avail_width);
11097
11098 // Manipulate scroll to that we will land at the same Y location of currently hovered item.
11099 // - Calculate next frame position of item under mouse
11100 // - Set new scroll position to be used in next ImGui::BeginChild() call.
11101 float hovered_item_rel_pos_y = ((float)(hovered_item_idx / LayoutColumnCount) + fmodf(hovered_item_ny, 1.0f)) * LayoutItemStep.y;
11102 hovered_item_rel_pos_y += ImGui::GetStyle().WindowPadding.y;
11103 float mouse_local_y = io.MousePos.y - ImGui::GetWindowPos().y;
11104 ImGui::SetScrollY(hovered_item_rel_pos_y - mouse_local_y);
11105 }
11106 }
11107 }
11108 ImGui::EndChild();
11109
11110 ImGui::Text("Selected: %d/%d items", Selection.Size, Items.Size);
11111 ImGui::End();
11112 }
11113};
11114
11115void ShowExampleAppAssetsBrowser(bool* p_open)
11116{
11117 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Assets Browser");
11118 static ExampleAssetsBrowser assets_browser;
11119 assets_browser.Draw("Example: Assets Browser", p_open);
11120}
11121
11122// End of Demo code
11123#else
11124
11125void ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(bool*) {}
11126void ImGui::ShowDemoWindow(bool*) {}
11127void ImGui::ShowUserGuide() {}
11128void ImGui::ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle*) {}
11129bool ImGui::ShowStyleSelector(const char*) { return false; }
11130
11131#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS
11132
11133#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
func
void func()
Definition: group.cpp:13
imgui.h
ImGuiDir
